placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Superbe lieu, hôtel très propre, très calme en basse saison, avec plage privée, (nos enfants ont même pu faire du surf) adorable accueil, nourriture (curry) délicieux! Petit déjeuners copieux et savoureux. Nous reviendrons avec plaisir dans ce très bel hôtel!
title: Superbe!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
luxurious large room. staff were all very friendly and likeable. enjoyed our stay here.

they were doing some maintainance so there was a bit of noise during the day
title: nice place

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Wir hatten einen tollen Aufenthalt. Waren 3 Nächte im Hotel.  Würden in der Hauptsaison wieder buchen, dann wäre im Meer schwimmen möglich. Das Personal wär sehr freundlich. Man konnte sich austauschen und hat so noch mehr über Sri Lanka erfahren.
title: Top Lage, sehr sehr freundliches Personal. Sehr gut gegessen. Sehr gepflegte Anlage.  Ich kann weiter emofehlen.,,,,,

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing place for relaxing and quiet stay. I’ve spent there one week at the end of May 2025 and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is located quite on the ocean beach with fantastic views on the open ocean and Galle Fort. The facility is small and cozy that gives you a feeling of being like at home. Hotel management and team are very friendly, smiling and caring. All services are absolutely great, and even extra for a 4-star level. The meals are very delicious providing a variety of the local and other countries’ food. The hotel beach is very calm and comfortable with a nice pool next to it. There are many sightseeing locations in the close vicinity where you can go by tuk-tuk always available next to the hotel. I would recommend the Cocobay hotel to all tourists who want to explore Sri Lanka. And many thanks once again to all hotel team for my fabulous days there!
title: Marvelous stay at Coco Bay Hotel

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing time
At COCOBAY. The staff was very sweet, empathetic and helpful. The room
And the view was absolutely enthralling. 

I would recommend this place to anyone visiting unawatuna for great views, people and service. It was a memorable stay.
title: Loved our stay at cocobay!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our second time staying at Cocobay Unawatuna, and it was just as magical as the first—if not better. If you're looking to unwind, relax, and recharge, this is the perfect place.

We had a room with a private plunge pool, which was spotless and cleaned every morning. Impressively, even if a leaf fell in, the lifeguard would somehow sense it and appear with a net to fish it out—amazing attention to detail!

The hotel is tucked away in a peaceful spot, just a short 15-minute tuk tuk ride to Galle or Unawatuna, making it feel like a serene escape without being too far from town.

From the moment we arrived, the reception team made us feel completely welcome with a delicious welcome drink and a smooth check-in process.

All the staff were friendly and accommodating, always ready to help. The housekeeping team was especially thoughtful—one day, we returned to find the cutest towel elephant waiting for us on the bed!

If you're an animal lover, you’ll adore the two gentle, affectionate resident dogs, Spicy and Chia. They were a joy to be around and made the place feel even more homely.

We also really enjoyed dining at Le Mer, the in-house restaurant. The food was delicious, and the team was more than happy to accommodate our preferences.

Cocobay Unawatuna is a hidden gem and holds a special place in our hearts. It's ideal for couples looking for a peaceful, romantic, and heartwarming getaway. We’ll definitely be back!
title: Second Stay – Even Better Than the First! A Peaceful, Romantic Escape

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely resort. On the Beach .... the room had the sea view.
Rooms were very comfortable and spacious.
The restaurant staff were very courteous and helpful.
The restaurant also overlooks the sea.
A nice small swimming pool.
The beach is a private beach with calm shores.
title: Nice place for a family relaxed vacation

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check the availability earlier, they fills really fast.
text:
The pillows are so damn Good, soft and comfy for a comfortable sleep so as the bed.
Food tastes really good and staff is really really friendly and helpful, 
View and quietness makes me lot happier. Room are very clean and well equipped and arranged. I recommend this place as one of the best places that you should enjoy with all the hospitality and the environment together...
title: Happy and enjoyable with nature

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I think all rooms have a sea view (except for room used for early or late check in/out). TukTuks available down road as well as at hotel.
text:
I spent five nights here and loved it all.  The room (I did have one with it's own pool), the service, helpfulness, and restaurant were all amazing. I thought I would feel a little out of it being solo but it was perfect. I ate outside most nights which was a beautifully created setting. I had not intended to eat in the hotel's restaurant every night but the food and service was just so good. 
The beach was cleared of any rubbish at least twice a day but this is a very difficult and ongoing issue with all of the hotels.
The main pool was also great and perfect for children. So I felt whether you were solo, a couple, or a family, this boutique hotel was idyllic for all. Very friendly and helpful.
Loved it and although I did not think I would need to return to Sri Lanka after doing a 14 day tour, this is a great alternative for some much needed downtime.
title: Perfection! Boutique Hotel

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Rustig en kleinschalig hotel, direct aan de zee en een klein strand. Staff is uitermate vriendelijk en behulpzaam met alles. Ontbijt en diner waren inbepregen en gewoon goed en lekker. Prijzen niet  te hoog. Met een uber ben je in 5.minuten bij het fort voor rond de 1200 roepie. Op het prive strand voldoende bedjes. Kamer was ruin en wij kregen een gratis upgeade naar suite. Alle kamers hebben zee zicht.  Al met al een prima uitvals basis.
title: Vriendelijkste hotel in Unawatana

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: A perfect end to our visit to Sri Lanka. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, balcony area facing the sea, mini bar and jacuzzi in the bathroom. The food is amazing, the portion size is very generous and the quality is stunning. Great location too with a private beach, kept spotlessly clean. But what makes this hotel stand out is the staff, from the cleaners to the restaurant staff, they are all so attentive and can’t do enough for you, really lovely people. Oh, and winning the tug of war for the new year celebrations was also a bonus!!
title: Great hotel with amazing staff

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Siroter un mojito et écoutant les vagues… Attention aux coups de soleil!
text: L’hôtel est parfaitement situé, très confortable, à taille humaine avec un service de très grande qualité. On peut y aller les yeux fermés. La plage est accessible depuis l’hôtel et on peut facilement surfer ou faire du bodyboard. Le restaurant est également excellent!
title: Excellent hôtel!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Eet in het hotel ze hebben een heerlijke keuken
text: Super fijn hotel met een fantastische keuken. Wij verbleven aan het einde van onze vakantie in hotel CoCoBay. Wat een heerlijk hotel met ruime schone kamers, Uitzicht op zee en fantastisch personeel. Het eten in het restaurant van het hotel was heerlijk, En de bediening behulpzaam en belangstellend. Vooral genoten van de adviezen en de tips van de ober Rag. Kortom een hele fijne afsluiting van een fantastische vakantie.
title: Super fijn hotel met een fantastische keuken

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: CocoBay is a lovely owner-managed small hotel with a delightful personal touch. It is set in  a gorgeous tree lined Bay with calm seas and a great view of the Dutch fort at Gaulle. The staff are fantastic and cannot do enough for you; and a particular highlight is the delicious food (a Sri Lankan/Indian/European menu) all of which has been nothing short of perfection. A shady pool, large rooms with extremely comfortable beds and fantastic cleaning and laundry services makes this an extremely relaxing stay for those with young families. Plaudits go to the extremely friendly staff who have a great work ethic and really care about the guests – and who make this place worthy of its high rating.
title: Beautiful location; great staff and fantastic food

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Enjoy every minute !
text:
What a fantastic place to finish our holiday in Sri Lanka. The Hotel has its own beach and also an outdoor pool right outside the restaurant. The room we had was absolutely incredible. One of two very special rooms with a large balcony with a simple Jacuzzi. The suite was enormous and had two seating areas, a large bed, a minibar area, walk in wardrobe area, large bathroom with two sinks. We had three days here and lover every minute. The sunset views from the private beach are beautiful and you can pop across the lagoon carefully to eat at a local Seafood restaurant on the beach. It is a short ride on a Tuk Tuk into Unawatuna town where there are lots of places to eat and drink. The hotel breakfast was lovely and I ate the asri Lankan curry both days, especially enjoying the Dahl and Red Fish Curry.

It was a dreamy place to stay and we would easily go back. The staff were great and could not ask for more. 

Thankyou for making our final days in Sri Lanka so amazing !
title: Beautiful Place to End our stay in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: We spent 10 nights with my family at Coco Bay Hotel. Many thought we were staying in one place too long during our trip, but we don't regret a single second of the time we spent at Cocobay! Great beach! The waves were reasonable, almost a personal lifeguard during the daytime :) Thank you for the surfing lesson! There were no dangerous water creatures. The pool was partly not under the sun, which is important considering traveling with children in Sri Lanka. Great hospitality both in the hotel and in the hotel restaurant! The food, both local and international, offered a taste experience :) You could eat inside the restaurant, on the terrace or even with your toes in the sand on the beach. Our room was large and clean, with a sea view. We were very happy with the room. Location to the city - across the river and you are in Galle. Walking distance to the famous Unawatuna beach (it was too noisy for us). Unfortunately, I didn't remember all the names, but Nishad, Dileepa and Dinesha, please thank everyone once again from our family, aitäh! ISTUTI!
title: Honor and praise to the Coco Bay staff!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 6 nights in a pool suite facing the ocean.
The hotel has its own private beach as the main beach is separated by a river that flows directly into the sea.
The ensures no passers by and allows the feel of peace and tranquility.
The hotel has excellent facilities and the food provided at the resort was from the menu, which was a welcome change from the normal buffet style.
One of the wait staff Raj was a joy to have assist us both and always was very professional. 
I would recommend this hotel strongly.
as the staff at a hotel can make or break your stay and all staff were excellent.
title: Private beach paradise!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
The 4 day culmination of our3 week Sri lankan trip , what a choice. We loved this hotel great location, basically private beach, incredible staff, great food and absolutely perfect final choice.
Nothing was too much trouble for the attentive friendly staff. Brilliant food, highly recommend the private beach bbq. The best sunset view . Close to the amazing forte.
Loved could have stayed here an extra ‘unwind week’ .
title: Great final hotel

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We have stayed five nights at cocobay. And booked another 6 nights. We are currently staying at this wonderful place. If you are looking for a place to stay. Book here. It offers a relaxing and comfortable experience. With a private beach and calm seas. 
The staff are perfect and super welcoming and friendly. 10/10 would give more if possible. We love it here. Kim and Lene
title: The perfect place

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: The staff were amazing and the welcome wonderful. There is a great selection and quality of food and the views from our room across the water were wonderful. We would thoroughly recommend a stay at this hotel. The pool was crystal clear with plenty of  sun loungers at the private beach.
title: Wonderful hotel with exceptional service

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: My daughter & I spent three delightful days at this unique hotel. Ashburnham offers a rare combination of attentive service combined with homely charm. Vish and the team could not have been more friendly, we look forward to visiting again.
title: A delightful Easter getaway!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 3 nights at Ashburnham Estate on our travels across Sri Lanka and throughly enjoyed this beautifully situated and elegantly decorated former tea planters bungalow, with outstanding views over the Knuckles mountains.
The wonderful staff were amazing, from manager Roshane, Vish who was so attentive, chef Hasita who created the most delicious rice and curry and the lovely ladies who fussed over us, to the concerned gardeners who helped remove leeches from our feet!!!
It was an extremely tranquil place, which we surprisingly had to ourselves, and ideal for watching the birdlife feeding off the Flame tree as we had breakfast 
 The walk up to One Tree Hill was filled with laughter and conversation with ever-smiling tea pickers and villagers and the view from the top, breathtaking.
The pool was ideal for an afternoon chill after a long walk.
We have promised to return next year for a cookery lesson with Hasita and a tour of the tea plantation.
Our thanks again to Roshane and his excellent team!!!
title: Excellent location with breathtaking views, delicious food and attentive staff!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a great place to recharge if you’ve been on the go for a while. It’s secluded and very quiet. I think there’s only 6 guest rooms so you’ll have all the peace you need.

The rooms are probably a bit ….rustic, and conveniences like fridge, A/C, tea and coffee facilities aren’t provided.

That said the staff are fantastic and will bend over backwards for you. Are special shout out to Vish. He goes above and beyond to please.

Oh, and the food was exceptional.
title: Great place to unwind

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go to the waterfall
text: The service here was nothing short of incredible. The service from Vish especially was fantastic, he was always smiling and very fast with the food. Really enjoyed my stay here and Vish made sure to make us feel 100% comfortable and happy there. Highly recommend coming here. Additionally the waterfall nearby is a must to go.
title: I stayed for two nights and really enjoyed it. I went down to the waterfall and it was great

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Ashburnham is a really special place and feels like stepping back in time. It is still a small working tea estate and all of the accommodation are rooms in what was the estate owners house and that added a really authentic feel to our stay.  The communal lounge was really nice, though we were never in there, all of our free time was spent at the lovely pool or, for meals and early evening drinks, out on the front terrace with beautiful views out over the hills.  The bedrooms and bathrooms were very nicely furnished and comfortable. Something to be aware of is that there is no air conditioning and, although it is much cooler than down in Kandy town, we needed all of the windows open at night and, with no screens on the windows this resulted in some quite large spiders visiting. The tea tour with the estate manager was really interesting and the waterfall is a beautiful place for a dip before the arduous trek back up to the house. We were the only guests whilst we were there and it felt, at times, like they were not really fully open. There was only really one member of staff evident who filled the role of front of house, waiter, barman and fixer. He was great but, if he had gone off elsewhere, then we felt like we were living in a big house where we didn’t know where anything was or how it worked. It didn’t feel quite right to go into a “hotel” kitchen in search of milk for a cup of tea.  With a little more attention to detail and customer service, this place could be a really unforgettable stay.
title: A beautiful stay in a bit of a bygone era.

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Arrive early to enjoy hike and swim at waterfall, sundowner cocktail. Do tea plantation your early in the next morning to avoid heat
text:
Don't miss the informative and entertaining Tea Plantation tour. The 400 vertical foot Hike to waterfall is rewarded with an impressive 50 foot high waterfall and is a refreshing swim in the pool below.   No air conditioning in the historic 1930s plantation house. Meals are simple but you traveled the long winding road to experience life on a tea plantation a century ago. Well worth it.

Such friendly welcoming staff make you feel like you're staying at relatives home.
title: Authentic (non-commercial) Tea Plantation experience

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved Ashburnham. It is friendly, 'colonial', quiet, and scenic. The rooms are slightly jaded in the nicest possible way.  They are well serviced, and the bathroom is good. The communal area is largely made up of a large, comfortable hallway/sitting room and a lovely terrace outside. The swimming pool is nearby, well shaded from too much sun, but consequentially fresher than the Sri Lankan norm.
My slight niggle with the experience was the additional cost (mentioned in other reviews).  I think $30 pp for a dinner was about twice the price that we paid elsewhere for about the same. 
The wander around the tea part of the estate was well worth it in a relaxed way.  A picnic at the waterfall was lovely (but price-y for what it was) (by the way, keep an eye out for leeches - and on the tea walk)
The staff were lovely and went out of their way to help.
title: .A lovely start to a holiday

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check which room you have-ours was a bit public as overlooked the balcony
text:
The situation of the bungalow is truly beautiful, wonderful views of tea planting from the balcony. Yes- faded colonial grandeur, but very comfortable. Staff were very attentive, helpful, charming. Food was also good. Pool is warm, clean and welcoming. we thoroughly enjoyed the tea tour- very informative. 
However, as others have noted there is no transparency over the cost of anything-no prices displayed anywhere. It is true that one can ask, but once arrived, you are a captive audience, as the drive is long and there is nowhere else for miles around.
Another word of caution- we thought that the picnic by the waterfall was exceptionally over priced- it didn’t accord with the photos, and consisted of a wrap, few fries and a soft drink or two. Cost of $20 each seemed steep at the time, and then the final bill stated that the price of the food wasn’t even included- we had to challenge this and it was withdrawn. $20 dollars each without food? We could easily have carried the basket ourselves.
title: Beautifully situated, welcoming and relaxing, but check all the costs

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent two nights at Ashburnham and they were wonderful and a highlight of our time in Sri Lanka. It is a special and peaceful place which feels more like someone’s home than a hotel and perfect for reading and relaxing.
Given the price I think breakfast and lunch could be improved and it would have been good to know how much lunch and dinner cost at the outset.
G&Ts at sunset on the terrace are a must!
title: Relaxing stay

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: A wonderful three days at Ashburnham Estate including Christmas Day. A magical place to relax and explore. The staff were fantastic, as was the food and tea! Thank you to David, Indi and all at Ashburnham for a fabulous time!
title: Magical!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We loved our two nights at the Ashburnham Estate. It is an old colonial home with a huge porch overlooking the gardens, trees and tea plantations. The staff were delightful and a few had been there for 18 years and up. We had a lovely time here.
title: Old world charm

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You can also call George as private driver and guide directly on 0094777801724. George knows well the must see and drives very safely.
text: The staff are very helpful and good and would like to dedicate a special thank you to Vish he was very supportive with all what was missing in the room:) the venue was very beautiful the landscape around the hotel is just breathtaking however the hotel is way older than what we see in the pictures.
title: beautiful View and peaceful place

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely calm, relaxing hotel in a stunning location! We had a very relaxing few days and were looked after well. Great guided walk round the tea plantation and stunning waterfall and plunge pool. Food was a real highlight. Whilst the service we received was excellent the hotel is a bit tired and may not be to everyone's taste.
title: Stunning location!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The tea plantation tour is very interresting
text: On a round trip in Sri Lankawe booked 2 nights in hashburnham and we had the chance to have the all villa for ourself, what a wonderfull place. Food was amazing and the views from the terrasse, where we had our meals, were just so peacefull. I spent hours reading there. We loved it. Our kids (18 and 20 yo) played tennis and spent time in the pool. My wife was doing early morning yoga next to the pool. Defenetly one of our highlights in sri lanka.
title: What an amazing place

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you want all modern conveniences, this is not for you. If you want to switch off from the outside world for a while, this is for you.
text: It was as if we had gone back in time to a more gracious era. Ashburnham Estate is a former colonial plantation house perched on the side of a hill with incredible views of the Knuckles Mountain range. The house is set within its own 100 acre plantation and offers relaxed poolside living or for those more adventurous a trip to the waterfall is a must but be aware that the climb back up the steps in the heat is not for the faint heartbeat. There is no air conditioning but the air is clean and with all the windows open, the rooms never get too hot. For those of a nervous disposition, there is minimal security. The windows and doors barely locked but it all added to the charm and the relaxed nature. The highlight is undoubtedly the food which is first class and this, combined with yet more excellent G&T’s made for a wonderful 3 nights with the best sunsets. Finally, the hotel would not be the same without the brilliant team of staff. Albeit a small team, they worked tirelessly to make our stay so special including an excellent cookery class where we made a chicken curry.
title: From a more gentle era

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Nestled high in the hills, the location itself of the Ashburnham Estate is worth a 5*+. Splendid well-tended gardens with a wonderful view from the terrace complete the picture.

The food was very good, with the Sri Lankan picnic provided for our One Tree Hill visit, being the culinary highlight of our stay. Although the meals were in general very good, breakfast proved to be a little disappointing: small portions of fruit; eggs; sliced white bread and jam.

We cannot give a higher rating for the Ashburnham Estate as we were somewhat unsatisfied with the room. The room itself was very dusty (dirty) and the furniture needs a lot of TLC, and an upgrade of furniture would be even better. Plus the bathroom (+fittings) was also quite shabby and not as clean as we expected it to be. Perhaps we could have ignored all this, had it not been for the ant invasion.Our futile efforts at dealing with the army proved useless, and when we mentioned the problem to the staff we were informed that there was nothing that could be done.... We were not offered another room. We did ask that the bedroom and bathroom be rid of the dead ants, however, upon our return later to the room nothing had been done, and the bathroom sink and shower were still full of the results of our ant battle.... Hopefully, the hotel will resolve this kind of problem more efficiently in the future.

Overall though, worth the 2 day stay.
title: Five Star Location

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed 2 nights here and we had a very warm welcome by all the team. The property is situated in a tea plantation with wonderful views . There’s a wonderful outside terrace to have all the meals and it’s just magical.
The room was large and comfortable as well as the bathroom.
The food was nice served by the lovely Vish.
Amil  and Rako the dog took us on a very beautiful walk to the tree where the views are breathtaking in the tea plantations.
He also took us with the naturalist on a even more spectacular walk in the tea plantations and through a pine forest and down by the lake and through villages !Unforgettable for sure !
The nice thing is that you can start these hikes directly from the estate without having to drive anywhere.
If you want a peaceful place to stay away from the crowds here’s your place !
A lovely place made even more special by this wonderful team !
title: Very peaceful setting with very attentive staff

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
The estate is absolutely stunning. In the heart of some of the most breathtaking countryside, you could imagine. You are truly in the heart of the best Tea estates in the world. The estate itself is an old colonial lodge, beautifully preserved without feeling dated. You can have your meals on the terrace overlooking the mountains, it's truly amazing. 
All of the staff could not be more friendly or helpful. They provide guided tours of the tea fields and tasting. The staff are even willing to guide you on walks up the mountains if you ask. The cooks provide delicious traditional food, but will also make things on request (e.g. my wife doesn't like spicy food, so they were happy to tone this down). All our needs were met. 
The estate comes with great facilities e.g. a pool, tennis court. There is a waterful to visit close by for a more natural dip, and of course the tea fields themselves. Despite being so remote, the Wi-Fi signal is good and is reliable. 
The only issue we encountered were a significant number of ants in our room which could have been avoided. 
Overall however this is an amazing place to stay, and one i would happily visit again.
title: A truly wonderful place to stay

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring your most comfortable shoes :) get ready for an unforgettable adventure !
text:
This place is next to heaven!
The hospitality of the staffs are the biggest highlight of my Covid holiday.. wish i could stay longer to enjoy this amazing property. 
Well designed facilities with loads of activities to keep you close to nature. I enjoyed walking up and down the hill, looking at magnificent tea plantation the ladies looking great with the basket 'backpack' plucking fresh tea leaves, offering themselves to take a selfie 🤳 with me  was one of the unforgettable memories that will keep haunting me to come back! 

Thanks to the owner who is so kind and generous to share what they have to make your stay comfortable .. a true 
"feel at home" experience that made my holiday the best! 
Thank you Amila and the Team. Keep up the great work!
title: Next to Heaven ❤

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All the rooms are lovely and each one has it's unique special touches.
text:
I have stayed at the Ashburnham Estate many times since 2014 and most recently this winter.   It's a magical spot in the hill county near Kandy.  

When I'm at Ashburnham I feel like I'm living on top of the world.   Stunning views, pounding waterfalls to swim under, endless walking and a caring staff make the whole experience a real gem in Sri Lanka.
title: Amazing Hill Country Escape

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We’re thrilled you enjoyed your stay, the food, and the pool. It’s great to hear our location was perfect for your safari adventures. We hope to welcome you back soon

Resort Manager

text: We had a great stay at this place. Recently opened, extremely friendly staff, great food and marvellous pool. Ideal place to do a safari in the near Uda Walawe national park.
title: Great stay at Waraka - Udawalawe

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Really nice atmosphere. Calm, clean and very friendly service. Was nice lounging in the pool overlooking the river. Dinner was delicious and they accommodated a packed breakfast for our early morning the next day.

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Waraka Resort is considered one of the luxurious boutique hotels situated in the Udawalawa area. Its location on the canal bank, away from the main road and near the renowned Udawalawa Reservoir, offers a serene and quiet environment surrounded by nature. My wife and I recently visited this resort and had an exceptional experience, thanks to Mr. Madhawa, the resort manager, and his team's outstanding service. Although the resort was not very crowded with other guests, the staff provided excellent service from the moment we arrived, making our stay highly enjoyable. The à la carte meals were delectable, and we appreciated each one thoroughly. The resort is surrounded by jackfruit trees, enhancing its natural atmosphere.
We stayed in a deluxe room, which was spacious and luxurious, equipped with all necessary amenities for a pleasant stay. The pool was adequately sized for both of us. Mr. Madhawa assisted us in arranging an early morning safari ride, providing us with a remarkable experience at the famous Udawalawa National Park. I would highly recommend Waraka Resort to anyone seeking a luxurious escape from the city, offering private time and a close connection with nature. I extend my best wishes to the staff for maintaining their high standards for all future guests.
title: Luxurious Getaway in the Elephant City, Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. We’re glad you enjoyed Waraka’s stunning setting, the kayaking experience, and the hospitality of our team, especially Dinuka.

We sincerely apologize for the shortcomings during your stay, particularly around dining and service coordination—this fell short of our usual standards, especially during the holiday period. Your comments are invaluable, and we’re addressing these issues to improve clarity and efficiency.

We’d love the chance to welcome you back for a smoother, more enjoyable experience.

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed 2 nights half board at Waraka, it had been highly recommended by a local agent. It's a new boutique type hotel with just 12 rooms. The rooms and hotel are 'eco/ industrial' in style, the whole place is visually stunning and the staff very lovely. 

We hadn't appreciated just how rural and isolated Udawalawe is, we also stayed over Sri Lankan new year (which seemingly runs for a lot longer than we had expected) and I suspect this impacted our stay. 
I think if we were to go again, we'd maybe stay on one of the main roads, waraka is completely isolated and difficult to walk anywhere and I certainly wouldn't book the half board, udalwalawe rides can book you tuk tuks for short journeys out. 
Although we had a package with massage, evening tea with snack & mocktails - none of these were available during our stay (we assume due to the New Year). 

Please be aware they don't serve alcohol on poya days. 
The resident naturalist Dinuka was very helpful and we really enjoyed the kayaking. 
All staff seemed to be working very hard as we arrived, but there was a lot of confusion over rooms and bookings, it wasn't clear who was booking people in. 

Confusion continued around meals and drinks, times and orders. I can't stress enough just how lovely & accommodating everyone was, but it really felt like the chef, front desk & hotel manager had gone away for the holidays. 
Food took forever to arrive, both in the evening and when lunch was ordered. There seemed to be a lot of rules about what and how to order breakfast, and no clarity on when we could have breakfast (what time is breakfast available) - we were told anytime, but then to be told that we couldn't arrange to have anything kept to one side for after we returned from a 6am safari, only to return, be accommodated & see that seemingly no other guests had been asked to submit an order the previous night and were just ordering as everyone returned from safari about 10am. Imagine my surprise the following morning when we went down at 9.30 to be told we couldn't order the sri Lankan breakfast from the menu only to have it arrive later? The food we had for lunches was absolutely fine, but a lot of what we were given in an evening wasn't edible. Stunning hotel, very kind staff, but restaurant needs some looking at.
title: Go for the experience but not the food

text:
Outstanding Hospitality at Cinnamon Red

I had the pleasure of staying at Cinnamon Red, and I must say that it truly exemplifies the best of Sri Lankan hospitality. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by a warm and friendly staff who were always ready to assist with a smile. The hotel’s central location in the heart of Colombo made it incredibly convenient for exploring the city, yet it still felt like a peaceful retreat after a long day.

A special mention goes to Thiloka at the front desk. Her helpfulness, knowledge, and genuine understanding of guest relations were simply outstanding. She went above and beyond to ensure my stay was as comfortable as possible, providing excellent recommendations and handling every request with grace and professionalism. Thiloka is a shining example of what makes Cinnamon Red such a wonderful place to stay.

If you’re looking for a hotel with exceptional service, a great location, and true Sri Lankan hospitality, Cinnamon Red is the perfect choice.
title: Outstanding Hospitality

text:
We stayed at the Cinnamon Red Hotel when we arrived in Sri Lanka in June and again as we were departing. 
The buffet dinner and breakfast is exceptional with a range of cuisine and the best pitthu and other sri lankan delicacies.   Having fresh egg hoppers made upon request was wonderful and the ladies doing this were warm and friendly. 
The rooms were spacious and well equipped...comfortable bed.  The roof top bar had a fantastic view of the city and Lotus Tower.
A good sized gym with plenty of space,  machines and weights.
The pool was absolutely beautiful,  clean and big with a beautiful sea view.  
The staff throughout were so helpful.  Devna at reception was wonderful and helped us to get a few hours extended on our departure at no extra charge...this helped so much! She also showed us how to join a site that had hotels all over the world that we could stay in and earn point and get discounts on our food and beverage...lovely lady!!!
The staff at the entrance were so helpful in assisting us to get tuks from our uber app etc.
I have really enjoyed staying here and will be back.
title: Cinnamon Red

text:
During my week long stay at Cinnamon Red Colombo in mid June, I was in the city to attend a series of meetings and a workshop. As someone who makes it a habit to catch up on both national and international news each day, having access to television news is an essential part of my routine no matter where I am.

On the second morning of my stay, I realized that the television in my room wasn’t functioning properly, likely due to poor signal caused by the rainy weather in Colombo. While it was an understandable issue given the conditions, I hoped it could be resolved.

That’s when I met Mr. Gayan, the room boy assigned to the 20th floor, where I was staying. From the very beginning, Mr. Gayan left a positive impression. On my first day, he greeted me warmly in the morning, checked in to see if the room was in order, and made me feel genuinely welcome.

The following day, I happened to see him near the lift and casually mentioned the issue with the TV. Without hesitation and without needing any technical support, Mr. Gayan came to my room and quickly fixed the problem. I was truly impressed by his initiative, skill, and willingness to go the extra mile to ensure guests have a comfortable experience.

It was in that moment I realized how talented and multi-skilled the staff at Cinnamon Red truly are. Mr. Gayan is a shining example of hospitality done right a professional who not only understands his role but embodies the values of care, efficiency, and excellence.

Overall, my stay at Cinnamon Red was truly enjoyable. The food was exceptional, the ambience was refreshing, and above all, the staff were remarkably attentive and genuinely kind. Thanks to people like Mr. Gayan, my stay became a truly memorable one.
title: A Memorable Stay at Cinnamon Red – Thanks to a Remarkable Employee

text: We stayed here for our last night in Sri Lanka after a 3 week tour. It is very close to the airport so perfect for a first or last night stay in Sri Lanka. The hotel has a “corporate” feeling rather than a personal one however we enjoyed our 1 night stay. The pool was nice although the area around it needs a little TLC. The dinner buffet was not as big as some we had experienced but it was fine. The bar had a happy hour 5-7pm and we enjoyed our chat with the friendly barman. For breakfast the lady chef made me a delicious omelette. The bed was comfortable. Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this hotel for a Holiday but it’s fine for a one night stay if you want to be near the airport.

text:
We only stayed for one night at Vivanta Colombo, but we truly wish we had stayed longer. Our visit happened to coincide with my son’s ninth birthday, and the staff went above and beyond to make his day extra special. From the moment we arrived, they took such wonderful care of him, ensuring he felt celebrated and valued. Their attentiveness continued into breakfast, making him feel like a little VIP.

While this is a Vivanta, it carries the signature warmth and hospitality that the Taj brand is known for—it felt like a bit of my sister’s hospitality woven into the experience. Yes, the property is a little dated, but it exudes a timeless elegance and comfort that made our stay incredibly pleasant.

If you’re looking for a stay near the airport with exceptional service, I can’t recommend Vivanta Colombo enough. A special thank you to the incredible staff—Samanthi, Aneesha, Veron, Rumeshi, Luxman, and Sudari—who made our visit truly memorable.

We will definitely be back!
title: A Warm and Memorable Stay at Vivanta Colombo

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
What an soulful stay

From the moment we arrived at Santani, we were welcomed by the calming sounds of birdsong and nature—an immediate sense of peace. The setting is breathtaking, with views of the Knuckles mountain range and the soothing sound of waterfalls creating a truly serene escape.

The culinary experience was outstanding. Chefs Indika Liyanage, Indika Bandara, and Indunil—an incredibly passionate and talented team—curated a unique blend of European, Sri Lankan, and wellness-inspired cuisine. Every dish was made with organic, foraged ingredients, delivering exceptional freshness and flavor.

Service throughout our stay was flawless. The small but dedicated team provided warm, thoughtful hospitality, with a focus on detail and quality that elevated the experience. The well-curated wine list added a perfect complement to each meal.

We immersed ourselves in wellness activities like guided nature walks, morning yoga, and spa treatments that truly redefined relaxation.

Santani is more than just a wellness resort—it’s a place to reconnect with yourself and nature. The tranquility, clean mountain air, nourishing food, and mindful experiences combine to offer a true celebration of life.
title: A soulful Escape

text: Santani is truly a magical place. From the views to the service and the food. I did the detox program while I was staying at Santani which was a life changing experience. The most magical part and highlight of my stay at Santani was meeting the yoga instructor, Saman. The best yoga I have ever experienced and most challenging. I never felt stronger like I did after Samans yoga classes. He gives such good insight and truly wants to help each individual. He helped me alot with my physical and mental state and I believe I have met a life long friend and healer that I will be forever grateful for. The treatments are also incredible however again did not feel tailored to my physical and mental state. I had to ask for more personalized treatments. placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Santani Wellness Hotel in Kandy was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment we arrived, we were blown away by the incredible service and the serene, natural setting that made it one of the most memorable hotel experiences we've ever had.

The service here is truly exceptional. Santani went above and beyond to ensure every detail of our stay was perfect. The staff set up a WhatsApp group specifically to cater to our needs, which was such a thoughtful and effective touch. We would especially like to recognize Oshee, who was exceptionally  professional and  helpful. Her warmth and personable approach made us feel welcome and taken care of from the start. She even organized a personal meeting with the chef to discuss our dietary preferences and requirements, ensuring that every meal was just as we wanted it.

The room itself was one of the most visually arresting and peaceful spaces we've ever stayed in. Set in the jungle, it offered the most incredible view we've ever had from a hotel room. The combination of glass and balcony made it feel private yet connected to the surrounding nature. At night, the fireflies and the sounds of the jungle created a magical atmosphere. There was (deliberately) no air conditioning, but this wasn’t a problem at all, as the room’s ventilation was thoughtfully designed and kept the space comfortable throughout our stay.

One of the highlights of our experience was the traditional Ayurvedic spa. The tranquil setting which was open to nature, and the stunning views made it feel like a true escape. We especially loved the hot pool, which was a perfect way to relax and unwind.

The outdoor infinity pool, with its sweeping views of the jungle, was another standout feature. The serene environment was perfect for lounging and gazing out at the lush greenery, truly making us feel at peace with the surroundings.

The food at Santani was sensational. The Sri Lankan dishes were packed with flavor and beautifully prepared, but there were also Western options for those who wanted them. Breakfast was a joy—generous portions, with a variety of choices to satisfy any craving.

We also had the privilege of experiencing yoga sessions with a traditional Hatha yoga instructor. The classes were thoughtful, and practicing in the open Shala, surrounded by the sounds of the rain and jungle, created a deeply special experience that we'll never forget.

A memorable highlight was the guided jungle walk into the Knuckles Mountain Range, led by the hotel's incredibly knowledgeable and passionate naturalist, Osanda. His deep understanding of the environment and ecology made this trek through the remote mountain range an unforgettable adventure. We saw a stunning array of wildlife, including shrub frogs, Sri Lankan jungle fowl, leaf-nosed lizards, mongoose, giant squirrels, egrets, and of course, plenty of leeches! Even though it rained heavily for hours, the experience was so enriching, and Osanda made sure we were safe and well-informed throughout the journey. We also witnessed remote waterfalls in an area that would have been inaccessible without a guide.

Santani Wellness Hotel provided the perfect balance of a peaceful retreat with exceptional service. It was the ideal place to disconnect and rejuvenate, and we were impressed by the thoughtful design of the property that allowed us to experience nature at its best while maintaining the highest levels of comfort. It’s easy to see why Santani has been recognized as one of the best spa hotels in the world—its setting, its service, and its offerings are unparalleled.

Ruth and Priya
title: Truly Exceptional

Second visit to this wellness resort well worth the trip from the United States will be coming back again next year the natural surroundings are unparalleled. Yoga twice a day that can be utilized at any level. I am a doctor and got a Ayverdic consultation from their physicians on staff and that was amazing.

I felt like I really learned a lot. Next time I want to go back and do a weeklong  detox, meet lots of people there who enjoyed their experience. The only part that I found unpleasant was the fact that the restrooms in your hotel room do not have doors on them this is annoying.

The birdhouse views are worth the extra the mist in the morning and watching the sunrise and  set is a spectacular experience.
title: Wellness in nature is an unparalleled experience

Lovely pool, wonderful views of the lagoon and coast. Beautifully maintained grounds. Only 4 sunbeds but this was not a problem. 
Hotel is a little way out of Galle but easy to find a tuktuk. 
Room 2 was large, very high ceilings, bed had mosquito nets. Could have benefited from a fridge and there's no window you can see out of which I didn't like very much. 
Large bathroom, good shower, towels and bathrobes. 
I would certainly highly recommend The Postcard.

Postcard’s chain of boutique hotels have been our favourite go-to hotels for a while now, especially with our daughter (now almost 4). The hotel in Galle was the perfect coalescence of luxury and comfort. It reminds one of the old Portuguese bungalows (being from Goa ourselves, we found nostalgia in those rooms) , yet there’s absolute luxury in the services provided. 

From the open verandahs, to the super spacious premium rooms and the quaintness of the property, we loved our stay. 

We also loved the picturesque sunsets from the patio and the warmth expressed by each and every one of the staff. Special thanks to Bharat- the property manager, Swati- the F&B manager; along with- Randika, Arshad, Vikum, Nirmal, Theekshana, Sandaruwan, Kaveesh and Prasan! We send our best regards and the warmest wishes. Thank you for being so wonderful to our daughter and helping us make wonderful memories for our 10th anniversary!

The hotel staff also helped us with arranging all transport, trips to Mirissa, Yala National Park and the turtle hatchery, making our entire trip seamless!
title: Coalescence of comfort and luxury

roomTip: We were the only guests at the property when we stayed here. Not sure about the quietness when it's full.
text:
Postcard Galle is an oasis of peace on the busy road leading south to Galle. The only sounds you'll hear once you're inside are of birds and of the ocean. The views from the deck and sit outs are outstanding. The lounge chairs and diwans in the balconies and common areas are super cosy and it's very tempting to just laze around the property doing nothing all day. Our room was very comfortable and the staff are friendly. Bharat and his team had great suggestions right from outings to local walks to what we should eat. 
We had a couple of meals here and the food was delicious. I also loved the cocktails we tried - they're innovative with surprising flavours and had no added sugar!
title: What a delightful stay!

placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: It’s still raining end November. But it’s worth it!
text:
I traveled by myself to this amazing hotel. I felt right at home the moment I walked in. The kind of hospitality and care, consideration and attention to detail is beyond anything I have experienced before. The view is spectacular, the place is secluded, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and everyone always has a smile. The food was all excellent too, as were the delectable cocktails- try the one with arrack!

Every night I would come back to a cute towel sculpture on my bed- a rabbit, an elephant, a turtle… always made me laugh. 

I spent hours sitting on my verandah staring at the ocean. 

If you want to get away from the madness, this is for you. Quiet, private, beautiful, calm, and full of a warmth that feels like “home”.

I would like to mention by name a few staff who made my stay so special for me:
Bharatvir - the manager who was knowledgeable, extremely considerate, and knows exactly how to make a good moment better. 
Sandaruwan- always smiling and the artist behind the towel animals.
Ramiz - always so attentive at meals, remembering how I like my coffee and fruits. 
Sandeep - the chef who kept creating some amazing dishes.
There were many more who all contributed towards making my vacation truly enjoyable. I will always remember the Postcard, Galle as one of most favourite vacations ever.
title: Best solo vacation ever

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for returning to Roman Beach and for sharing your thoughtful review! We are thrilled to hear that your second stay was just as magical as your first, and that you enjoyed the stunning views, comfortable room, and the impeccable care of our pool man/gardener. We’re especially grateful for your kind words about our staff—they truly make Roman Beach special, and we’re so happy that their warm hospitality made your stay memorable.

We apologize for the issues you experienced with the restaurant on this occasion, and we truly appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We’ll be sure to review our service and work on improving the overall dining experience, including the ambiance in the evening, as we strive to create a perfect atmosphere for our guests.

It’s wonderful to hear that you found time to relax by the pool and enjoy the beautiful sunsets from your balcony. We're so glad that you felt taken care of, even with your early flight, and that our team could offer you a little breakfast for the airport.

We would be absolutely delighted to welcome you back for a third stay! Roman Beach’s personal touch is something we cherish, and we’re grateful that you recognize that. We look forward to seeing you again soon for another unforgettable experience.

Warm regards,
The Roman Beach Team
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room 106 is the best!
text:
We first came to Roman Beach in 2018 and it was magical so I was a little worried it wouldn’t be as good this time. Thankfully we were given room 106 again which really does have the most beautiful view! So let’s start with all the positives - Roman Beach is still magical, the room is lovely - gorgeous bathroom with spa bath, comfortable bed and that view! The pool is the perfect temperature and the whole outside area is immaculately kept by their lovely pool man/gardener who will make up a sun lounger in your favourite spot as soon as he sees you and keeps checking in to make sure you are ok! What makes Roman Beach special is its staff - so helpful and just lovely smiley people. We did have a couple of issues though this time, we ate in the restaurant twice for dinner  and both times they got one of the meals wrong - the first time we decided not to say anything because we just wanted to eat together but the second time it happened, we did mention it. They were very upset that they had made a mistake and quick to make another meal but the food sadly wasn’t great - this being said, my husband had the Sri Lankan curry and he said it was delicious. Breakfast seems to be a huge affair and we decided to just go down the street to have a coffee - if you like a big breakfast then this place is for you! Having said that, even though the option for a smaller breakfast wasn’t on the menu, I am confident they would have accommodated this if we asked. Overall the restaurant does lack abit of ambience on an evening, maybe if they dimmed the lights, added candles, nice music and special menu’s it might be more inviting?
We quickly fell into a lovely rhythm of lazy mornings by the pool and afternoons on the balcony watching the glorious sunsets. Whilst RB is not licensed they will go out and get beer/wine for you and one afternoon we ordered a bottle of wine for the balcony for sundowners - bliss!
We left for an early flight and the chef had made us a little breakfast for the airport - really kind! 
So the big question is would we go back for a 3rd time and the answer is a resounding yes! Since we first went to Hikkaduwa some nice high end hotels have popped up with lovely restaurants but RB has a personal touch  that bigger hotels just don’t have come and see for yourself!
title: 2nd time to Roman Beach

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are thrilled to hear that you had an excellent stay with us and felt well taken care of from the moment you arrived. It’s fantastic to know that you enjoyed the chef’s special, our clean and comfortable rooms with beach views, and the peaceful beach right at the end of the pool.

We’re so glad that you found the hotel facilities to your liking and that your experience with us was truly special. We can’t wait to welcome you back for another amazing stay!

Warm regards,
The Roman Beach Team

text:
After our roundtrip we had 8 days to relax. We got an upgrade to King Suite due to our long stay (thank you so much!!) and really loved this room on the 2nd floor. Rooms are clean and (speaking about the Suite) spacious. There are overall 6 rooms (three 1st floor, three 2nd floor). Great pool, makes it possible to train (if you really want to -  during your holidays). Staff is extremely friendly and attentive, Reception, Pool and technical service (thanks, Sugath for preparing the sunbeds every day at the newly built umbrella on the beach) were great, Restaurant service (the two young guys were amazing), Kitchen (we never went out for dinner because the food in restaurant was so good) - the cook was recommending a dish every day -  and surprised us with different preparations. Extra wishes no problem. Manager Warna always had time for a chat and made us feel welcome. 
Please allow us one hint: the Bathroom could be renovated a little bit (for example the blinds between the bathroom and the sleeping room)
It was in a way like being part of the family for those 8 days. Thanks also for the opportunity to stay in the room until the evening of the departure day  - free of charge - this is not a given. Location is a bit outside of Hikkaduwa (roundabout 25 min. beach walk to turtle point) but not too far - Tuk Tuk or even walkintg to the center no problem. Perfect for long walks on the beach. Sea is a bit rough but "manageable".
We recommend this Hotel.
title: Relaxed days in a family atmosphere

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
We slowly wind our way through a breathtaking twisting mountainous road guided by Vinath who met us at the last turn off. We head to the northeastern foothills of Lanka’s highest peak Pidurutalagala, A tea factory comes into view overlooking the valley of Mandaramnuwara. And we soon realise that it is our destination. An abandoned tea factory built hundred and seventy-five years ago, during the infancy of growing tea in then Ceylon, now converted into a hotel.
It is mid-day and the Sun peers out of the clouds whisking past touching the mountain ranges. Mist keeps coming in and out giving us a performance as the views open and close. Temperatures feel cool compared to hot and humid planes we left only a couple of hours ago. A lady from the plantation Tamil community welcomes us and invites us to light a lamp and places a red coloured dot of ash on our foreheads, signifying that this is an area where the majority are from the Tamil community. A community whose ancestors were brought by the British from South India to clear the lush primary forests of the hills and plant coffee first and then once coffee was wiped out to plant tea in its place. We then meet the rest of the staff all with welcoming smiling faces and eager to interact with us
While the hotel has no frills, it is cosy and neatly kept. The rooms are spacious enough with views of the valley and rugged mountain peaks.
We had a mix of authentic local and western cuisine during our stay lovingly prepared by Chef Morgan and his team. Sasanka, Ramesh and Randika the stewards and Dumindu in the front office were always at hand to meet our needs. Akash and the rest at housekeeping kept our rooms spotless. What is unique about the place is the mini tea factory complete with the traditional machinery to produce black tea inhouse.  The flavour and aroma of the freshly manufactured tea is hard to beat. In fact, the aroma from the manufacturing process permeates across the hotel adding to the romance of the place. The affable, knowledgeable and versatile naturalist Lakshan doubles up as the person in charge of tea production and we learnt some hitherto unknown facts about growing and manufacturing of black tea from him. He is assisted by Selvaraj, the lovable teamaker. Lakshan accompanied us during our two days of travel in the vicinity experiencing the stunning views and the multitude of waterfalls. The terraced paddy fields and vegetable plots of the valley are still worked the traditional way as the slopes are too steep for machinery.
All in all, the eight of us had a lovely time.

“Here soars our island-summit. Here I stand
In spirit, as in body once I stood
Long years ago, in love with all the land,
This peerless land of Beauty’s plenitude.”
-	From Lanka from Pidurutalagala by Walter Stanley Senior
title: Land of Beauty's Plenitude

text:
It was a pleasant stay we had at Tea & Experience Factory on 13th June 2025. From booking to leaving from hotel was a smooth process without any hassle. You will not realize that it is a hotel until you walk into the premises as it is a tea factory from outside which converted to hotel in 2019. 

The entire team at the hotel was so caring, very help full and attending to every need with no hesitation. Vinoth guided us from the day prior to we visited the hotel. Dinidu went out of his way to help our mother who had difficulties in climbing stairs.

The road to the hotel is not the best but you will have to expect it as it is situated in a tea estate. Recommending using a vehicle with good ground clearance and drive with patience.

You will have a decent spread of food for all three meals, and the kitchen crew is doing a fabulous job to maintain good taste in every dish they offer.

Rooms are spacious and clean. The only drawback is they are not fully soundproof, so you can hear all the noise from outside.

One of the best experiences you could get is to know about a bit of history of tea industry in the world and Sri Lanka. You also can get experience of total orthodox tea manufacturing process from withering to packing. Lakshan is well equipped with knowledge and explains to you about the entire process & clears out any unclear area in the process.
title: Pleasent Experience

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
Stayed here during a trip to Mandraramnuwara with some friends and their families. The booking process was smooth, and I did it online. They have a pretty functional web site and are very responsive with the phone.

Location
It's located in the famous Mandraramnuwara area for its beautiful waterfalls, crazy weather swings, cold climate and beautiful views. The hotel is situated inside a tea state so getting there is bit difficult due to the road conditions, but you can easily negotiate the road even with a small car if you are careful. There were two small cars (Vitz and a Passo) while we were there.

Hotel
It's an old tea factory converted to hotel. The place has lot of history because its one of very first factories built in Sri Lanka in 1800's. There is a functioning tea factory in the same premises.

Welcome
We received a very nice traditional welcome inspired from Hindu culture. We received a pottu on our foreheads at the end of the small ritual. Afterwards we received snacks and Cinnamon infused tea which is produced in the factory next to the hotel.

Accommodation
We booked two rooms which are Sinna Dorei Family and Periya Dorei Family. They can accommodate 3 and 4 people respectively. Rooms had barn doors which are common in industrial facilities. Walls are made of corrugated metal sheets which is very common among tea factories. Walls are double layered probably with some insulation in it. Sound proofing is not great, but we have no complaints. After all it's a tea factory. The room had all the amenities required including an electric heater which is quite good. Tea making facilities a d supplies were available, and all the toiletries were available. The walls were decorated with old posters depicting the history. Both rooms were great and loved it. Mine was in the downstairs overlooking the garden area.

Food
We made our booking on full board basis so stayed for all three meals. Since the hotel partially occupied, we didn't receive a buffet. This was confirmed during the booking, so we were expecting this. The options provided for meals are limited but we found food items matched to our liking in all three meals. The portion sizes were good and filling. We tried pumpkin soup, seafood broth soup, fish balls, salads, baked chicken, fried rice, eggs cooked in various ways (poached, fried etc...), pasta, kottu, backed fish, curd, watalappam, cut fruit, fruit salad during our meals. All were good and tasty. Only complaint is that the kottu was very spicy even for Sri Lankan standards. They replaced it promptly after notifying about it and apologized. The service received during meals were great.

Service
We received excellent service from the hotel staff. The staff was extremely friendly and quite happy to attend to our requests and was ready to provide detailed explanation of the aspects of the hotel we questioned about. Loved the great service from the friendly staff.

Tea experience
They offer a tea experience tour covering every aspect from leaf to cup. Everything starts from tea plucking session. The person in charge of the tour is extremely knowledgeable and provide us details of plucking process and answered our question in very detailed manner. Afterwards the factory visit started. There we got to know lots of details of the tea manufacturing process and the science behind it. They demonstrated all the steps of the process using the machines that are being used for the actual production explaining lots of things going behind the scenes. We got to know how tea is made, how they taste different, how they are graded and so on. The final step is a tea tasting session which was great and visit to the old power room. Don't miss this tour.

During our stay we used the pool table which was nice. Wasn't able to use the nice swimming pool because of the weather. There are a few nice excursions available.

Overall, we loved the stay at the hotel. It's an excellent place for families or groups of friends to have a relaxing time with little adventures and great tea experience.
title: Breath taking views and great hospitality...

text:
We absolutely loved our stay at Tea & Experience Factory — it turned out to be one of the most memorable getaways we’ve had in a long time. From the moment we arrived, it felt like we had stepped into a quiet, peaceful world surrounded by green hills and fresh mountain air.

The whole place has a lovely charm to it. Staying inside a restored old tea factory was such a unique experience. Our room was clean and comfortable, with just the right amount of rustic style to match the setting. It was so calm and relaxing — all we could hear was the wind and the birds.

The guided tea tour was one of our favorite parts. It was really interesting to learn how tea is made, and the staff made it so engaging and easy to understand. They were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

The meals were simple but delicious, and we enjoyed every bite while looking out over the beautiful landscape. It’s a great spot if you’re looking to relax, unplug, and take in the beauty of the hill country. We’d definitely love to come back again someday!
title: A unique and peaceful escape into nature and history

Dear Guest,
Thank you so much for your beautifully detailed review. We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed the unique charm of our tea factory setting, from the traditional welcome and cinnamon tea to the immersive tea-making experience and cozy cabin stay. Buddhika Kohona
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
roomTip: Keep a half a day to experience the tea plucking and processing and to do the guided hike to Kabaragala Waterfall.
text:
It was a journey beyond a century to feel and experience the atmosphere of a Tea factory premises. At this vintage site they had made it possible for us to feel that it was much more than what it was meant to be over a century ago thus converting it to an abode with cozy beds and a restaurant where we could flavour the in-house cuisine and enjoy freshly brewed tea or cocktails from a rustic bar, while giving the patrons a chance to indulge in the manufacture of tea from plucking the fresh leaves to processing, tea tasting and to the point of packing the finished black tea. Our stay was very comfortable in a spacious cabin with important amenities provided to us. At the arrival we were greeted with a traditional “Arti” style welcome with lighted oil lamps followed by placing Thilaka or Bindi or Pottu on the forehead with blessings, followed by the serving of the welcome drink which was a warm cup of Cinnamon infused tea. They cared us with a high level of attention which made us feel that they wanted our visit to be memorable. Their hospitality was greatly appreciated, their staff was extraordinarily nice.  

We had a choice with their dinner and breakfast menus, bar had a few cocktails one special with Sri Lankan arrack and their Kabaragala tea. Room was warm and comfortable for the cooler night. We found it to be very central to numerous waterfalls and lookout points. They had a guided trek to Kabaragala Ella falls listed in their days programme. As we were interested in seeing all the attractions in Mandaram Nuwara precinct in a relatively short duration they assisted us to obtain a 4WD vehicle from an external service provider to travel to these locations.
title: A nice experience to dwell in an extremely old Tea factory and experience the tea producing process

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback! We’re thrilled to hear that your stay at our boutique hotel in Udawalawe exceeded your expectations. It's fantastic to know that our team made you feel special and that you enjoyed the beautiful setting and modern comforts of your room.

We’re glad to hear you appreciated the food and that our staff were able to accommodate your husband’s needs during dinner. Their attentiveness is something we take great pride in, and we’re happy it made a difference for you both.

Dinuka will be delighted to hear your kind words about the village walk. He truly enjoys sharing his knowledge and helping guests connect with the nature around us.

Thank you once again for your generous recommendation. We hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay in the future!

Warm regards,
Resort Manager
placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
What an absolutely amazing place to stay. Apart from one hotel during our stay in Sri Lanka which was disappointing everywhere we stayed was good but this hotel in Udawalawe was the best! It is a small boutique hotel that has only been open for 6 months and yet you would never know. It feels established with brilliant members of staff who effortlessly make you feel special. It is in a delightful setting. 

Our room was thoughtfully designed and furnished with all modern comforts. It was like being in the jungle but with all mod cons! Even a delightful swimming pool. The food was absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. Notwithstanding that we had chosen our evening meal my husband didn’t feel quite right having eaten something the day before that disagreed with him so that when we went to dinner he didn’t feel like eating his chosen meal. The staff were so understanding and were more than happy to make him a plain omelette. They were most solicitous and even asked about his well being at breakfast. They could not have been more caring. 

We also went on an early morning ‘village walk’ (which is more of a nature walk) with Dinuka, the resident naturalist. He was charming and so knowledgeable spotting things we would never have otherwise seen. 

We were sorry to leave and cannot recommend it highly enough.
title: An absolutely amazing place

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
A very eco-conscious and environmentally sympathetic hotel, set in beautiful grounds filled with jackfruit trees, hence the name ‘Waraka’.
Our room was an attic room which meant it had a mezzanine level. We had floor to ceiling windows looking out onto a veranda and down to the pool set in the dappled shade of the trees. 
The restaurant team were excellent. Very attentive and the open view to the friendly chefs in the kitchen was a fun addition. 
The riverside setting enabled a great hour of bird spotting - our own bird safari right on the doorstep with sightings of a water monitor, kingfishers, egrets, ibis - a perfect way to while away an hour after breakfast. 
Overall, a very pleasant stay.
title: A friendly, beautifully sustainable place to stay

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Anti moustique !!!!!🦟
text:
Je suis partagée… l'extérieur est absolument magnifique. Piscine incroyable, petit espace transat au bord de la rivière, salle de restauration très stylée, architecture sublime et très bien intégrée dans une végétation luxuriante. Le service est, comme toujours au sri lanka, aux petits soins.
Mais les chambres ne sont pas à la hauteur du prix selon moi. Elles sont en metal, aussi il n’y a pas d’isolation phonique. De plus, Si l'environnement vous touche, ce sont des passoires thermiques (et refroidir les chambres avec la clim alors que les murs en metal sont bouillants au soleil, cela me dérange un peu personnellement…).
Au final, nous passons peu de temps dans la chambre car nous avons préféré profiter de l’extérieur, mais je signale quand même mon ressenti 😉

Ah et point important, impératif d’avoir un très bon anti moustiqueh 🦟
title: Magnifique, mais…

The small infinity pool is lovely; although not huge amounts of sun loungers available. 

Nice decking, hot-tub & swing seats overlooking the river. Make sure you use mosquito spray.

The menu was limited but was very good quality, well cooked & presented.

The rooms are nice & face the door to ceiling windows/terrace, face the pool & river. However the rooms are too dark with inadequate lighting.

Wi-Fi works throughout & rooms have TV, tea/coffee making facilities. 

I would return !!!
title: Wonderful !!!

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Waraka Udawalawe by Thema Collection!
Dear Valued guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed our riverside location, the comfortable accommodation, and the warm hospitality of our team. It's wonderful to know that our staff’s efforts, from the gardener to the service team, made a positive impact on your stay.

We’re sorry to hear that our supper didn’t quite meet your expectations, especially given the high standards of Sri Lankan cuisine you’ve experienced elsewhere. Your feedback is invaluable, and we’ll use it to further enhance our dining experience.

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: The accommodation is generally good, if a bit functional, and certainly comfortable. The hotel is brilliantly located for a visit to the amazing Uda Walawe elephant reserve. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The location by the river makes for a very pleasant breakfast experience as there is plenty of wonderful bird life to experience. The breakfast is good but we also had supper here as part of an all-inclusive deal and this was not so good: we’ve had some wonderful meals in Sri Lanka in family restaurants, food halls and upmarket eateries, but this definitely was not one of them. You’ll be wondering, perhaps, why I’ve given 4, rather than 3 stars and the reason is that the hardworking staff certainly deserve 4 stars: even the gardener briefly stopped sweeping the lawn to smile and wish me ‘Good morning’: that’s worth quite a lot, isn’t it?
title: Lovely staff and riverside location, comfortable accommodation

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Totally agree with most reviews in that this hotel is a good solid 4 star hotel on a lovely quiet safe beach but agree its maybe not  5 star.
We liked it so much that we changed plans after our 4 night stay to return there( after a short side trip to  Yala NP ) for an additional  night there en route to Colombo.
We liked the balcony rooms but be warned there are no lifts at the hotel and we were on the top floor which meant several flights of stairs. Also although we would have liked the jacuzzi bath it was just too big to  get in and out of it safely which was a shame.
Half board did mean a set evening meal which was better some nights than others but breakfast was always good.
We very much liked the friendly and helpful staff at the hotel both on reception and in the restaurant and also particularly Chamara the lifeguard and pool attendant.
What was  useful for us was that the hotel could arrange a driver called Ryan   both to take us to Yala and collect us at a much better price than we had been quoted by both the Yala hotel and the Colombo hotel and he was excellent and very accommodating when we wanted to do a couple of small detours en route namely to go to a local shop selling tea and to go to see Unawatuna town beach .
As mentioned there are tuktuk drivers waiting just 5 minutes from the hotel to get to Galle and Unawatuna etc and after one tuktuk driver kindly took us for free over a very large puddle after a downpour when we were walking to the main road   we took up his offer to take us by car to Colombo and this worked out well.  
We would definitely recommend this hotel  and hope to return one day
title: Very much liked this hotel

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Отдых в отеле был одним из лучших! 
Весь персонал очень приветливый и доброжелательный. 
Отдельное спасибо хотим сказать работнику ресепшен Упулу, который помогал нам в решении любых наших проблем. 
Отдельно хочется отметить и спасателя на пляже. Молодой человек не только следил за порядком и чистотой на пляже и в бассейнах, но и обучал серфингу и сапсерфингу. 
На время отдыха у нас был постоянный водитель, которого тоже порекомендовал Упул.
Номера чистые, кондиционер работал, джакузи белоснежное, уборка каждый день.
title: Замечательный отель. Уже скучаем. Хотим вернуться

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Cocobay-the best! Это самый лучший отель, в который мы обязательно вернемся! В отеле всё прекрасно: расположение в тихой бухте, уединенный пляж, красивые комнаты с видом на океан, вкусная еда, заботливый персонал! Мы приехали отметить 16 лет дочери. Менеджеры отеля устроили настоящий праздник для нас! Вручили букет, Украсили комнату, сделали красивый стол на пляже и в конце вечера торжественно вручили торт всем персоналом! Это было так красиво и трогательно! Большое спасибо!

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka

Hotel is located close to the city of Galle which allows you to eat in the hotel or visit Galle with its range of quality restaurants. Hotel room was excellent, sea facing, lovely sized room and bathroom with great balcony

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It's cheaper to catch a tuktuk from just up the road the corner than order through hotel.  The average cost from hotel to fort is LKR 1000 which is less than £2
text: We stayed for 4 nights in the Aqua Romance room on ground floor with own pool and access to beach.  What a wonderful place.  Very peaceful with great views.  The staff is exceptional and cannot do enough for you to enjoy your stay.  The bed was super comfortable. Large bathroom with seperate shower and modern new jacuzzi bath.  It's very quiet.  The aircon is impossible to adjust so makes the room pretty cold but we slept under the fan and both my husband and I slept better than ever.  The food is also good with a good variety even if you are a vegetarian.
