placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: Отдыхали с подругой в конце февраля 2025г. Отель небольшой, но очень уютный, красивый, компактный.  Очень приветливый и отзывчивый персонал. Конечно без знания английского иногда приходилось непросто, но в помощь переводчик, да и многие немного говорят по-русски. При покупки тура взяли завтраки-ужины и не пожалели. Ужины это отдельный шедевр повара. Все очень вкусно, сытно. Порции очень большие. Отель расположен в бухте, поэтому волны не очень большие, с детьми будет комфортно здесь отдыхать. Каждый день в комнату приносили комплимент от отеля - печеньки. Отдельно хочется рассказать про исполнителя песен. Узнав, что мы из России он подобрал мелодию и исполнил "Катюшу", было очень трогательно. Огромное спасибо всему персоналу за наш отдых!!! Отель однозначно рекомендую для тихого уютного отдыха
title: Незабываемый отдых

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Så mysigt hotell med endast 16 rum i Unawatuna. Personligt, toppenservice, fina rum och fantastisk personal. Maten är väldigt god och prisvärd. Långgrund fin strand precis vid hotellet och en fräsch pool att svalka sig i. 
Vi kommer gärna tillbaka!
title: Bästa hotellet i Unawatuna

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is shabby chic rather than boutique luxury. The rooms need updating and air-conditioning is noisy. The jacuzzi bath is yellow with age. Location at beach is good but definitely not located in picturesque area (there's nothing pretty around hotel). It's a 50 min walk to Galle and 20 min to Unawatuna. Staff and food are the highlight of the hotel.
title: No longer 5* luxury

placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff at this hotel are the friendliest and most helpful I have ever encountered. We had a warm welcome, and things just got better from there. The restaurant is excellent, serving both snacks and full meals. The menu is extensive and varied with some excellent seafood options.  There is a secluded beach with a very shallow slope into the sea, meaning that it is a long walk out before you are out of your depth.

The beach is not huge, but there is room for everyone, and towels are provided. There is a lifeguard on duty every day. Others have remarked that the hotel is a little tired in places, but this seems to be a problem everywhere after Covid and the recent fiscal crisis in Sri Lanka. The hotel was spotless, and the beach was thoroughly cleaned every day.

If you are looking for 5-star luxury with modern, impressive rooms and communal areas, then this will not be for you. If you want to feel looked after with nothing being too much trouble and somewhere to relax, then this is the place to go. We enjoyed the food very much and ended up not bothering to look elsewhere during out stay.
title: We loved it!

text:
Путешествуем достаточно много и никогда не писали отзывы, а здесь просто не смогли удержаться. Отдыхали в Cocobay с 18.01.2025 по 28.01.2025. 
Отель Cocobay. Нас заселили в номер на третьем этаже, номер превзошел наши ожидания- большая комната с огромной кроватью, чистое постельное бельё, большая ванная комната с душем и джакузи и просто фантастический вид с балкона, океан у ваших ног. Уборка номера производилась каждый день, пополняли мини-бар, каждый день приносили воду и печенье, несколько раз меняли постельное бельё. Удачное месторасположение отеля, отель находится в бухте и складывается ощущение, что вы отделились от городской суеты.
Исходя из выше сказанного, хочется отметить, что в данном отеле чувствуешь себя в безопасности (не смотря на бешеный ритм города). 
Находясь в данном отеле, ощущается тепло и домашний уют, при этом, работа персонала выражает искренность и дает понимание того, что все готовы сделать твой отдых запоминающимся и комфортным (без намека на «чай»).
С полной уверенностью рекомендуем данный отель, для комфортного, безопасного и незабываемого отдыха на Шри-Ланке.
title: Отель для комфортного, уютного и незабываемого отдыха.

text: My boyfriend booked here as a suprise for my birthday and WOW this was the best hotel I’ve ever been in with the best most helpful staff ever! They done the room up for my birthday with balloons, cake abd happy birthday on the bed with real flowers and leafs, it was incredible the detail that went into it all! The breakfast every day was perfect, eating fresh fruit to start with a view of the sea, followed by a cooked breakfast and some toasts and pastries. The food here by the way is immaculate, and it’s no problem to make a special request! My boyfriend booked a private bbq on the beach for dinner for my birthday as well, I can’t explain how good this was, it was so romantic and so perfect. We had our own private chef and private waiter who kept topping our plates up as soon as we’d finished. The food again was incredible, we were spoiled with potato salad, salad and rice, I had vegetable skewers and my partner had chicken and beef, it was so nice listening to the sound of the waves whilst we were eating our dinner. I definitely recommend the private bbq on the beach it was honestly so good and so special! The rooms are spot on, the bed is huge and very comfortable, the bathroom is also HUGE! Nice hot water in the shower and the jacuzzi as well is amazing! You get toiletries topped up daily as well such as shampoo, body wash and conditioner. We had a balcony overlooking the beach where we enjoyed the beautiful sunsets 😍 finally the staff here are all so kind, smiley and helpful. They really feel like your friends and have such great customer service skills I was thoroughly impressed with the service we received here. I wish I could stay here every day for the rest of my life 😍😍😍 thank you so much to everyone at coco bay for making my birthday so special ❤️
title: I wish I could stay here every day for the rest of my life!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Ashburnham is one of the most amazing places I've ever been with everything you could ever ask for. The house is a beautiful bungalow that lays in magnificent hills north of Kandy, with its entire encyclopedia of rare and exotic wildlife and stunning views that stretch forever. There is no other place you would rather spend your day. The staff are all delightful and the food (western or local) is superb. I would definitely recommend to anyone in Sri Lanka or even UK to see this magical place and experience the time I had there.
title: An incredible place pulling me back to go again

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: My wife and I and another couple stayed at Ashburnham for three days weeks before the Ukrainian war started. Thinking about this magical place and stay then, makes me temporarily forget the war in the east. The view and absolute tranquility of the place have settled in my heart. Having a cool drink, listening to the birds or sit beside the waterfall, what does one need more in life. Perhaps a deep desire to return once? We loved the place. Never felt so safe and well taken care of. Slepped like a rock! A gem. Keep it up. Don't miss it. Owner; it might be costly to keep it in the perfect state it is right now, but please preserve it like it is for our children. Thank you staff. Ashburnham? Home in Sri Lanka. Gregor Netherlands
title: Asburnham - Awesome

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a stunning colonial bangalow surrounded by nature and a perfect place if you are looking for a quiet, isolated place to relax and unwind away from the busy cities. Ash has a very calm atmosphere and we were lucky to have the entire place to ourselves. The rooms were very comfortable and the food was reasonably priced as well as delicious. 

One of the staff called Vish guided us through the breathtaking Tea Plantation and the waterfall where we spent the entire evening at! He was very attentive to all of our needs. (He also surprised my friend with a birthday cake!) There was so much more to explore and plenty of activites to do but sadly we were only staying for one night. Highly recommend to stay for a few nights and looking forward to visit once again. 

Thank you for making us feel at home.
title: Simply Magical

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
If looking for an oasis away from the world to read (or write) that book, to wander off and get in touch with nature, and to replenish yourself, this is the place for you. Ashburnham is one of my favourite locations, and I had a refreshing one-week stay where I got to de-stress and enjoy my days in leisure. 
For the duration of my stay, Ash was like a home away from home, far away from the hubbub, and precisely what I needed. The bungalow itself is large and airy, complete with a fireplace for the cold evenings, and the tea-estate and surrounding hills sprawl away in lush greenery. The rooms are beautiful, and I must admit I enjoyed my siestas. 
The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed, and the staff are accommodating to vegan needs (though I suppose a few more vegan items could be added, especially for tea). I highly recommend the black-eyed-peas risotto (made with coconut), and the lunch salads in general were delicious. The staff are also happy to adjust and acquiesce to needs if they have the ingredients (essentially, they allowed me to customise my breakfasts). 
Getting snacks and drinks in a cooler box and spending afternoons by the water is my suggestion. Languid immersions, watching the rainbow as it ascends up the waterfall, and then sunbathing on the warm rocks; doesn't get better than that! The water can be a bit chilly at first if one is not used to mountain rivers, but, then again, this would make it Wim Hof-approved! I certainly found it invigorating, and it became part of my daily ritual in reviving myself.
Quite frankly, reliving the memories makes me want to go right back and spend another week!
title: A perfect solo retreat in nature

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Visiting Ashburnham estate was like stepping back in time with its colonial architecture isolated by miles of stunning tea estate, jungle and mountains. 

Located 40 minutes from kandy and a stones throw from the Knuckles Forrest Reserve, Ashburnham made an idyllic spot to escape the city and experience the beauty of Sri Lanka’s central province. With bike trails, good walks, natural pools and waterfalls to swim in, as well as a tea tour from the enthusiastic Mr Das, all perfectly exhibited this paradisal part of the world. 

The staff here were brilliant - friendly, attentive and helpful which gave the place a really welcoming, homey and relaxed atmosphere. It was great to see the enthusiasm, effort and care put in by the staff (Vish seemingly able to pull G’&T’s out of thin air), especially after Covid and the recent civil unrest in the country. 

My sojourn at Ashburnham has been by far the highlight of my trip to Sri Lanka and my time spent here will stay with me forever.
title: Mountaintop Shangri-la

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We finished our tour of Sri Lanka at the Ashburnham Estate. Pure Nirvana - and a great place to chill. Charming and comfortable rooms with beautiful views of the gardens. Nice relaxed family atmosphere among the staff who are very attentive. We especially loved cosying up to the wood fire at night. Delicious breakfast in the morning on the patio overlooking a wonderfully serene and uplifting view of the hill range. Our kids loved the water chute into the pool and we loved bathing under the waterfall. I recommend Ashburnham, particularly if you want a tour of a working micro-tea plantation.
title: Tranquil Paradise - thank you Ashburnham!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing and magical place! Surrounded by stunning vegetation. Tea plantation, the waterfalls, long or short hikes and homely feel of the hotel with great food. We had a fantastic time. I enjoyed the sound ambience during the night - chirping crickets and the sound of the river makes it even more magical. The staff made a great effort to give us the best possible stay during this difficult time in Sri Lanka.
title: Amazing and Magical

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
What an amazing place. After our wonderful tour round different parts of Sri Lanka, Ashburnham is the place that has most left its mark. There is something magic in the air… the tranquility, the landscape, the views, the building, the guests, the staff… all of it combining to make a place that lodges in your mind and beckons you to one day return. This is a place of memories and I cannot wait to go back. 

Wonderful food and wonderful staff. I don’t know how they managed but it is a testimony to the owners that despite COVID and its impact on tourism they have managed to keep their excellent and friendly staff employed without so much as a furlough in sight! Well done and thanks to all for a lovely stay. See you again one day.
title: Heavenly peace

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing time here. Offers a completely different type of experience to other places in Sri Lanka since the few times I have been. With waterfalls and natural pools to swim in or even just to see and areas with great viewpoints and treks, it gives a great sense of "off the beaten track" and yet you still have the luxury and comfort of the hotel and the food. The staff are very helpful, most speak good English, but the ones who don't, will not hesitate to smile. The only problem I had with the place is that I didn't stay longer. I will most definitely be visiting again!
title: Waterfalls and spectacular views

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: This place has a lot of character, it is set in the middle of tea plantation with a beautiful landscape around, quiet and isolated. The view from the veranda is awesome and the rooms are comfortable. The staff is kind, the food is very good and you feel totally at home.
title: Charming and cosy

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You can ask the best route to travel depending on the area you visit alkaduwa, call the Manager - Amila he will guide you always.
text:
The Ashburnham Estate is a paradise for Nature lovers, i recorded 67 Bird species who are Resident as well as Migratory around the property, out of them there are plenty of Endemic Birds that can be closely monitored, namely Sri Lankan wood pigeon, Srilankan Hanging parrot, Layard’s Parakeet, Yellow fronted Barbet & many more.

Also this is one of the perfect Boutique hotels in very close proximity to Kandy & i am sure you will feel like Home with its friendly staff & delicious food. 

Also there are plenty of attractions within the property such as Waterfall hunting & bathing, man made Lakes, Bird walks, Bike rides, Hiking & many more. 

Its a Luxury boutique hotel based in the mountains with some great views & its a must visit place if tou are planning to travel in Kandy.
title: A Parsdise for Nature Lovers

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 3 weeks traveling in Sri Lanka and staying in some of the "best" hotels on the island, but the two days spent at Ashburnham Estate at the end felt like coming home to friends we never knew we had.  Everything about this place was personal and the  owner and his family  made our stay so cosy and comfortable that we would have liked to stay for much longer.
The warm welcome by Amilla, the beautiful bedrooms, the delicious breakfast with fruit picked off the trees in the garden, swimming in the private waterfall, the magical sunsets on the terrace and the most amazing dinners served by the ever- smiling Vish made our experience magical and most memorable.
title: magical!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Have vegetable rolls on the way there
text:
We stayed for two nights and it was exactly what we needed to relax and disconnect! The room was beautiful and clean. I expected to see insects in the room because of all the nature around us but there weren’t any. The service was okay exceptional especially by the two guys who were around making sure whatever we needed was there for us but at the same time gave us out privacy! Amila and Vish are always smiling and making sure you are happy.

The food was phenomenal!! Everything made from scratch at the hotel! Fresh bread every morning and amazing Sri Lankan food!!

View is breathtaking and sunset with a cup of tea or glass of wine was worthwhile.

Bottom line is, the service is tailored to your needs and the professional staff are genuinely spending all there effort to make your vacation perfect!
title: One of a kind service and amazing food and landscape

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a great time at Ashburnham Estate. The nature around was amazing and we had a nice hike to the lake with one of the employees named Vish. 
The hotel is very clean and well designed. The hotel crew  (Amila, Vish, the nice cleaning Lady) was extremely r friendly and helpful. We would recommend this place for nature and good service lovers ;) 
The food was also great and good for foreigners who not used to the spicy srilankan kitchen. 

Best regards from Hannes and Laura from Germany.
title: Wonderful Stay

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Ashburnham Estate is honestly a little slice of paradise! Beginning from the drive through the hills until you arrive in what felt like a secret garden. The estate is super lush with such an overwhelming sense of tranquility. I spent only 2 nights at a Ashburnham but had my time permitted, I would have gladly stayed for much longer. 

The grounds speak for themselves. But what also made my stay were the exceptional staff and Owner’s. They ensured everything was to my comfort, taking the time to personalise my stay. I can’t thank Amila, Vish and the beautiful family who own the estate enough, for sharing their special sanctuary. Without a doubt I will be back.
title: Slice of paradise

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sunset Room
text: It took me some time to write this review since I am not very much into this. However I couldn’t resist myself without sharing my most favorite vacation i had at Ashburnham and the much deserving recommendation about the hospitality Amila and everyone provided us during our Stay. THE VIEW... " OMG...you should surely sip a cup of Tea in the front porch while enjoying the Sunset....just do it.... And every room has its own cozy feeling and if you stay longer the better, wont regret a second you spent there with that amazing weather, waterfalls, books and everything in it. I surely need to mention Amila (Manager) and Vish, super welcoming and friendly personalities who are very flexible  and surely the most Pleasant people i have meet and the Chef's  FOOOOOOD..... JUST YUMMY....YUMMY... YUMMY...This is a Must GO PLACE...
title: Purely a Heaven on Earth

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
I can honestly say this is one of the best places that had the pleasure to visit with some of my close friends.....the estate and bungalow itself is just amazing and surrounded by beautiful lush landscape and private pool, waterfall and cascade pool was just a amazing experience and we had a amazing time and just felt a amazing peace in mind and soul. What made the experience more memorable was the amazing staff who are at the bungalow who cater to all our requirements without hesitation and we were very fortunate to also meet the owners who are a lovely family and made us feel very welcome and warm, and made us feel our stay was very homely though we were far away from it....i recommend Ashburnham very highly to anyone or group who is looking for a nice gate away with natural surroundings and a beautiful experience!!
Wishing everyone at Ashburnham estate all the best and looking forward to having a visit again very soon......thank you from all our hearts!

Shion Dewapura
title: One of the best places visited in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We came across Ashburnham estate on Instagram and booked it on a whim since the estate had two beautiful dogs. During our stay we realized that Ashburnham is a perfect holiday getaway. 
The bungalow itself is is full of light and very airy and each room is tastefully decorated. We stayed in the balcony room which as the name suggests has its own private balcony with the room. The furnishing are simple and elegant and the whole bungalow has a very homely feel. 

The staff were beyond exceptional; we were looked after by Vish throughout our stay and no ask was too big for him. We were thoroughly pampered throughout our stay of 2 days.

The meals at Ashburnham were an experience in itself . All meals were beautifully prepared and were very tasty . The portions are generous and can even be shared. Being a foodie , quality of meals is very important to me and the chef at Ashburnham did not disappoint; every meal was perfect!

To top off an already perfect stay, Ashburnham has its own private waterfall. We spent the better part of the morning exploring the waterfall and the cascade pools.

Ashburnham is the perfect getaway and is wonderful for a large group of ppl. Would highly recommend to book the whole place to yourself. 

Thankyou to the team at Ashburnham for giving us such a wonderful experience!
title: A lucky find!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an absolutely delightful stay with our family at Ashburnham. We spent 5 days but still could not get enough of the place. The bungalow itself has been renovated and decorated with warmth and care and makes one feel at home right away! The private waterfall was the BEST part but special mention should also be made of the staff managed by Amila and Vish! Food was out of this world! Even the booking process was made easy by Shalinka who was willing to answer all my questions in a prompt manner via WhatsApp! 

I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend ashburnham to my friends!

It’s an experience not to be missed!
title: Nothing short of excellent!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: A beautiful estate with lush greenery and breathtaking views. Ideal for a family getaway with ample space for over 14 adults  and cosy rooms with nice interior. Great hospitality with good & helpful staff as well as tasty local foods.
title: Great place for groups

text:
We had a very nice and personal stay at the Roman Beach Hotel. The small-scale hotel is located in the lee of the main road. The friendly staff likes to make guests feel at home whenever possible. Fresh fruit juice on arrival as a welcome drink. 
In the room, with sea view, everything is there. Space for the suitcase, tea and coffee making facilities, minibar, safe etc. The towels decorated in a special way. 
The chef, Supun, comes to ask about your wishes. As a vegetarian, I can really appreciate that. A man with a lot of experience! The pool is lovingly maintained daily by Sugath. He takes care of the garden and is ready with the pool towels as soon as you want to lie down.
Varna, the manager is very friendly and willing to have a chat and think along with you.

Мы также рады, что вам понравились особенные моменты и сюрприз на день рождения, организованные нашей командой, включая дружелюбное обслуживание Sampath. placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Есть парковка, рядом ж/д станция, и всегда можно поймать тук-тук. Покупали на рыбном рынке в Хиккадуве свежую рыбу. Повар приготовил
text: Отличный отель из 6 номеров. Все с видом на бассейн и океан. Номера просторные, есть все необходимое, кондиционер отлично работает, есть даже режим осушения воздуха, что немаловажно в тропическом климате. Отель находится на пляже, с выходом к океану. Персонал очень внимательный, выполняет все пожелания. У нас был завтрак и ужин. Много свежих фруктов, свежевыжатые соки, рыба, морепродукты, курица. Овощи, салаты, европейские или Шри-ланкийские завтраки. Чай очень вкусный, кофе не очень, как впрочем часто бывает в Шри-Ланке. Десерты разнообразные. Шеф-повар расспрашивает о предпочтениях, всегда идет навстречу пожеланиям. Есть русскоговорящий сотрудник Sampath. Внимательный и очень дружелюбный. Устроил нам сюрприз - украсил красиво стол цветами и листьями. На день рождения- сотрудники подготовили праздничный стол на берегу океана, с факелами , воздушными шарами, цветами. Садовник приносил пляжные полотенца, выносил лежаки под зонт на пляже. Лежаки  кстати с хорошими матрасами, удобные. Бассейн чистый, ухоженный, достаточно глубокий с одной стороны, с другой подходит для детей.
title: Прекрасный отдых на берегу океана

Each and every member of the team worked so hard to make their guests happy. They greeted us with smiles, were helpful and so very friendly. The manager Warna is wonderful, couldn't do enough and we loved our chats with him. Sugath's smiles around the pool, attentive at every moment to us and kind to our daughter, getting drinks, towels and balls for the pool (he even cleaned our tuk tuk rental for us!) Sampath was courteous at meal times, explaining the different dishes and Kalani made us welcome from the start as did all the staff here who helped with our bags and kept our room wonderfully clean, I wish I could name each individually as they all deserve a mention! 

We ate at the hotel as the chef took the time to talk with the guests and he put my mind at rest that he would serve Sri Lankan food that wasn't too spicy for us. The food was wonderful! It was a pleasure to stay and eat here. 
Overall, with only 6 rooms the hotel feels peaceful, it's quiet around the pool and beach, but it's not too far from the main town for the restaurants and shops. Pool is perfect with shady spots during the heat of the day, plenty of sun loungers and right on the beautiful beach. Rooms were bright and spacious with great air con comfy beds and a huge bathroom and balcony. We couldn't have wanted for more. 

Thanks to all of you for making the last 3 nights of our holiday very memorable! 

I hope we can return to Hikkaduwa and Roman Beach Hotel.
title: The BEST hotel!

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I stayed at Roman Beach for the month of February. Having been to Sri Lanka many times, this was the first time we had stayed at a boutique hotel.

The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to be on a quieter side of Hikkaduwa, slightly away from the crowds but only a short walk from the bars/ restaurants and shops. It feels very private. 

The decor is beautiful throughout the hotel with gorgeous furnishings, all creating a very cosy, relaxing vibe. The rooms are spacious and bright with an amazing-sized balcony, all with an outstanding sea view. 

The beds are super comfortable and all the room amenities make it feel extra special. The hotel has a high level of cleanliness throughout and the housekeeping staff do an excellent job in the rooms. Attention to detail is superb in all areas. 

 The pool is very well maintained and provided lots of fun for my baby boy. The pool staff, especially Sugath do an excellent job. My baby is still asking for him. His kindness will not be forgotten. Every staff member went above and beyond to make our stay feel extra special. Warune the manager was very attentive, he would go out of his way every day to make sure my family was comfortable. Supan the chef is very talented at what he does. We ate the best food we have ever tasted in Sri Lanka. We recommend the Sri Lankan Curry as it’s absolutely delicious! The restaurant staff were all excellent and again my baby will miss Bhagya, Udshion and Akalanka. Kelanee on reception is very polite and caring. Christi is also a lovely man, we can’t thank him enough for his kindness. The hotel really does have a nice atmosphere and I believe the staff are to thank for this. 

If you are looking for a warm welcome and want to be made to feel like family, do not hesitate to book Roman Beach. You will not be disappointed. We will certainly be back!
title: A very special stay at Roman Beach

You’ll not only learn a lot about tea but even get the chance to be a tea taster for a day!
 
A tip: Call ahead to arrange additional activities. They offer a guided hike around 11 AM, which takes about four hours in total. If you're staying just for a day, try to arrive early so you don’t miss the train experience.
 
Enjoy your visit!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your feedback and for sharing your experience with us. We’re glad to hear you enjoyed the accommodation, the staff, and the various activities during your stay.

To clarify the situation regarding the transfer, you arrived on November 24th and stayed until the 26th, booking through Booking.com. Upon check-out, you requested assistance with transportation to Nanu-Oya, and Mr. Vinoth, who handles the front desk, arranged a transfer with an external car service for 25,000/=.

However, due to adverse weather conditions, the train service was unavailable that day, which Mr. Vinoth promptly informed you about. You opted to proceed with the journey, and during the trip, you later requested to change the destination to Ella. Mr. Vinoth worked with both you and the driver to adjust the price, reducing it from 48,000/= to 42,000/=. We appreciate your understanding during this adjustment and are glad that you expressed your thanks for the arrangements.

We sincerely apologize for any confusion or misunderstanding during the process. Your feedback is valuable to us, and we will certainly consider it as we look to improve our service. We hope your overall experience was enjoyable, and if you visit us again, we will be more than happy to assist with any future travel arrangements.

Thank you.

Regards

Buddhika Kohona

text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. It is situation surrounding beautiful tea plantations and misty valleys. You feel like you travel back in time. Hotel is made in an abandoned tea factory. They have tried to preserve old structures as they are which adds to your incredible experience. Rooms are simple but clean and comfortable. Dinning area is dimly lit and the way they maintain things gives you a feeling of living in the colonial era. The naturalist took us on a nice hike to a waterfall through beautiful tea plantations and villages. We really enjoyed the hike and the guided tour in the tea factory. Although there was no buffet we loved their set menus and the way they served them the staff been attentive to every detail. We were glad that there was no TV cause it was all about tea, mountains, mist and beautiful valleys. It wasn't so easy to get up to the hotel through winding roads but once you get there it's all worth it. The staff were very friendly and professional. Their hospitality together with the wonderful location added to our wonderful experience.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback, and we truly appreciate your thoughtful comments. We're glad you enjoyed the breathtaking views, the unique experience of staying in a renovated tea factory, and the educational tour of the tea-making process. It’s always rewarding to hear that our guests appreciate the opportunity to learn about the "Leaf to Cup" journey!

We do want to address a few of the points you raised:

Soundproofing: We completely understand your concern regarding the soundproofing, and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused. As part of our efforts to provide an authentic tea factory experience, we’ve used tin sheet partitions to preserve the essence of the original structure. While this gives a unique, rustic touch to the property, we recognize that it may not provide the level of soundproofing that some guests expect. Some guests enjoy this as part of the overall experience, but we truly appreciate your feedback and will continue to explore ways to improve comfort in this area.

No TV in rooms: Our decision to keep TVs out of the rooms is part of our broader vision to immerse our guests in nature and the serenity of the environment. We want visitors to fully disconnect and focus on the natural beauty surrounding us, as well as the tea-making experience. That being said, we understand that this might not suit everyone's preferences, and we apologize if this was inconvenient for you.

Meal Service and Portion Sizes: We’re happy to hear you enjoyed the meals and the food quality, but we do apologize for the service-related issues you mentioned. We will be sure to review the attentiveness of our staff during meal times, especially regarding the bread basket and the portion sizes for breakfast. Guest comfort and satisfaction are very important to us, and we will certainly work on enhancing this aspect of your experience.

Arrival Times and Meal Arrangements: We apologize for any inconvenience caused by our inquiries about your arrival and meal times. Our intention is simply to ensure that everything is perfectly prepared for you, but we will review how we communicate these details to make it more seamless and less of a hassle.

We truly appreciate your feedback as it helps us continue to improve the guest experience. We hope you will consider visiting us again in the future, and we would love to provide an even better experience next time.

Thank you again for sharing your thoughts, and we look forward to welcoming you back!

Regards

Buddhika Kohona
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
This is an old tea factory renovated into a hotel. You have to drive about 5km  up a narrow mountain road which can be challenging for inexperienced drivers. It worth it for the views . Reception staff and security were very helpful. We stayed in ground floor rooms and the views were wonderful and we liked the decor. The rooms were very clean and good size. Meals are served alacarte with choices and 3/4 courses and the food was good. They gave us an educational tour of the tea making process which we really liked and was informative.

Cons : 
-Beware there are no actual walls just separators between rooms so there is ABSOLUTELY no soundproofing. Conversations could be heard clearly from the next room.
- No TV and poor lighting 
- They kept asking us the exact times we were supposed to arrive at the hotel and when we were coming for meals which was a bit of a hassle.
- Portion sizes were not adequate for breakfast, did not refill bread basket and our server was not very attentive or helpful.

Overall good hotel for a peaceful stay and beautiful views, but considering the cons it’s a bit overpriced.
title: Wonderful location on top of a hill, but bit overpriced for the facilities

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Munasinghe,
Thank you so much for sharing your wonderful experience with us! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed the tranquility of nature, the breathtaking views, and the exceptional hospitality during your stay at the Tea and Experience Factory. It's always heartwarming to know that our guests had such a memorable time surrounded by the beauty of the tea gardens and the refreshing atmosphere.

We also appreciate your thoughtful feedback regarding the narrow road and soundproofing. We're constantly working to improve our guest experience, and your suggestions will certainly be taken into consideration.

It’s great to hear that you had the chance to explore the nearby Kabaragala Falls and enjoy the birdwatching opportunities—nature lovers truly find our location to be a peaceful retreat. We look forward to welcoming you back for another serene getaway!

Thank you again for your kind words!

Regards
Buddhika Kohona
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
We spent two wonderful days at the Tea and Experience Factory, where we found ourselves immersed in the tranquility of nature. Surrounded by breathtaking mountain views, gentle mist, refreshing winds, and picturesque tea gardens, it felt like an escape into pure serenity. The food was excellent, and the hospitality of the staff was exceptional, making our stay truly memorable.

While the winding road leading to the hotel is fairly maintained, its narrowness adds a bit of challenge to the drive. However, the journey is absolutely worth it. This location is perfect for nature lovers and birdwatchers, and a drive to Kabaragala Falls is a must-do experience.

One note: since the property is a renovated tea factory, the soundproofing in the rooms isn’t ideal. I recommend booking an upper-floor room with a scenic view for a more peaceful stay.
title: Wonderful stay immersed in the tranquility of nature

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another wonderful experience soon!
Regards
Buddhika Kohona.

roomTip: Der Weg hoch ist etwas holprig, es besteht aber auch die Möglichkeit sich abholen zu lassen, sodass man nicht selber fahren muss.
text: Diese Unterkunft ist einfach Atemberaubend. Wir kamen den etwas holprigen Weg im Regen an und das Personal stand sofort aufgereiht mit Regenschirmen bereit, um uns zu Empfangen.(Wir sind den Weg mit einem Tuktuk hochgefahren, jedoch besteht auch die Möglichkeit sich abholen zu lassen) Unsere Taschen wurden hineingetragen und wir wurden mit einem Ritual begrüßt und zum Tee gebeten. Unglaublich leckerer Tee, welcher in authentischer Art in dieser Unterkunft selbst hergestellt wird. Die Zimmer, das Personal, das Essen, einfach alles war Perfekt und sogar mehr als das. Das Zimmer war sauber, geräumig, entsprach den Bildern und auch unseren Erwartungen vollumfänglich. Ich verstehe manche Bewertungen bezüglich Schalldämmung nicht, es ist eine alte Teefabrik und genau das stellt die Unterkunft auch dar. Das Personal ist sehr sehr höflich, freundlich, aufmerksam und sogar geschult in Sachen Etikette. Das Essen gleicht einem hochwertigen Restaurant zu super fairem Preis. Die Führung durch die alte Teefabrik ist sehr lehrreich und interessant und die Wanderung zum Wasserfall wunderschön. (Vielen Dank an Lakshan). Der Pool und die Teefelder waren auch sehr schön. Wir haben uns ausgesprochen Wohl gefühlt und wollten gar nicht mehr weg. Vielen Dank an das gesamte Personal für den wundervollen Aufenthalt.
title: Einfach unglaublich!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your thoughtful feedback! We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciated our warm welcome, excellent cuisine, and beautiful surroundings. It’s wonderful that you had the chance to learn about tea production and explore the mountains.

We apologize for the inconvenience regarding the bedside lamps and the soundproofing between rooms. The soundproofing issue arises because we use tin sheets for the partitions to give our guests an authentic tea factory experience. We are actively working on solutions to improve this aspect while maintaining the unique atmosphere. Many guests have mentioned that this authenticity adds to their experience.

Your comments are invaluable, and we appreciate your understanding. We’re glad you found your time with us memorable and hope to welcome you back for another unique experience in the future!

Thank you.

Regards.

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
roomTip: Prévoyez de la lecture, car la seule télé se trouve au bar.
text:
Nous sommes restés 2 nuits dans le cadre de notre circuit. 
Les points positifs :
Accueil parfait, cuisine excellente et très bien présentée. Le tea time, face aux plantations de thé dans un cadre magnifique. 
Les chambres sont très belles et bien équipées. Nécessaire de couture, mousse à raser et rasoir.
Le personnel est au petits soins et souriants. 
Nous avons découvert la transformation du thé avec un guide extra qui prend le temps de tout vous expliquer. Nous avons fait une randonnée de 3h00 dans la montagne. Un merveilleux souvenir. 
Points négatifs :
Un peu isolé mais normal pour une plantation.
Bizarrement les lampes de chevet ne fonctionnent pas car les prises ne correspondent pas au norme du pays. 
A la base, ce n'était qu'une usine. Une partie est conservé pour la transformation du thé et l'autre réaménagée  en hôtel. Dès votre arrivée le personnel vous préviens que tout les bruits s'entendent d'une chambre à l'autre. A revoir. 
Conclusion : une belle expérience dans un endroit atypique. Deux à trois jours suffisent.
title: Une belle expérience

text: Santani, what can we say. We felt well and truly looked after and we will absolutely be back.  The surroundings are breathtaking, the food completely unique, and every day something new.  We went for all inclusive, with drinks, and it was worth every penny - our glasses were never empty, and the wine and cocktails were some of the best we had our whole trip (big shout out to Santani’s bar staff who could really smash an Arrack Sour). The spa looks out to the forest and lake - like something out of a magazine. placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
From January 28th to 30th, my friend and I stayed at Satani, a luxurious wilderness retreat and wellness hotel highly rated on TripAdvisor. It was our first time in Sri Lanka, and we were drawn to the promise of refined elegance amidst raw nature. The experience, for the most part, lived up to its reputation.
        The hotel’s design was ethereal, with twenty buildings discreetly nestled in the forest, a stunning hilltop restaurant, and a secluded spa area. Every detail seemed meticulously crafted to immerse guests in the untamed beauty of the surroundings while cocooning them in comfort. The service at Santani Wellness was exceptional, with every staff member radiating warmth and hospitality. The chef, in particular, was a maestro—each meal over the two days was nothing short of spectacular.

       However, there was one glaring exception that left a sour taste, even after we checked out. The spa manager, an Indian woman with black-framed glasses who exuded an air of elegance and intellect, left us with an unsettling impression. We first encountered her in the restaurant, where she made a point of engaging with every table, enthusiastically recommending the spa and treatments—except ours. We brushed it off at the time. Later, when we visited the spa after booking treatments, she handed us a form to fill out, barely making eye contact, her attention seemingly absorbed by her nails. We couldn’t help but notice that in the restaurant, she continued to greet and chat with every guest—except us. It was as if we were invisible, even in the open, airy dining space. The contrast became starkly apparent when I returned to the spa and witnessed her interacting with a white male guest, patiently explaining each detail of the form with a warmth and attentiveness we had not been afforded.
        The disparity left us wondering: Did she dislike Chinese guests? Was it our skin color or some other bias that made her reluctant to serve us? I feel compelled to remind her that her behavior is a disservice to the hotel she represents. Moreover, as her own government actively encourages Chinese tourism to Sri Lanka, her actions are not only unprofessional but also profoundly ignorant.
title: A Blemish on an Otherwise Perfect Canvas

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed 2 nights at this very unusual hotel up in the hills from Kandy. Its design makes you feel a part of the local environment. Our bedroom was very comfortable with a terrific view of the hills opposite. The central dining and sitting area was spacious and comfortable and the quality of the food was very good. This is definitely a retreat for Yoga and Spa enthusiasts and for walkers. In poor weather ( which we experienced ) it can feel rather remote. If you are going to use the Spa facilities think about taking a package as the individual price of treatments was much higher than we had experienced in other locations. We took a guided walk with their naturalist guide and it was very enjoyable- they helped us with special socks to avoid leeches which are pretty much part of the local habitat when it is wet- don’t be put off by that though! Altogether a good stay but be careful to think through your needs to book the right length of stay and package.
title: A luxury retreat integrated with the environment

roomTip: Enjoy every second of this place
text:
Prepare for an experience that will never be matched ! 

As a travel agent , I had very good clients of mine here the year before, they still talk about Santani now, so I was incredibly excited to stay for myself.

Santani is a wellness centre like no other , it really is something that will stay with you forever.

The architecture & design beautiful and totally in keeping with the stunning views & location. 

Some of the most top notch staff I have come across in the industry from the onsite naturalist to the chefs , it’s like Santani has found the best of the best to ensure you are well looked after. 

The location is serene , the perfect place to unwind & de stress. 

Spa treatments are out of this world, possibly the best treatment I have ever had, I continue to keep trying to find another as good , but each time I am met with disappointment. 

Santani offer a great range of activities, I booked one of their walks down to the river.

I have saved the best until last … the food! 
I still day dream about the food  , it’s out of this world ! I have eaten in some really amazing restaurants & hotels over the years but  again Santani had raised the bar once more. 

If you are looking for a stay that is truly unique, whether you are looking to destress, detox or just take life at a slower pace in luxury surroundings you need to stay at Santani , a truly transformative  experience.
title: A stay out of this world

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
I arrived at Santani as a mere mortal—a bundle of stress held together by coffee, emails, and existential dread. By the time I left, I had shed my physical form and was floating above the valley as a sentient, mindful cloud.

Let me explain.

From the moment I checked in, I felt like I’d stumbled into the set of a spiritual sci-fi epic. The hills whispered secrets older than time. My room was so minimalist that I feared disturbing its zen-like harmony by blinking. The silence was so profound I could hear my soul doing yoga stretches.

The food? It wasn’t just a meal; it was a culinary cleanse. One bite of the beetroot salad, and I swear my chakras aligned like planets in a solar eclipse. Each dish was prepared with such precision and subtlety that I considered enrolling in a monastery to learn the art of soup meditation.

The spa. Oh, the spa. A therapist touched my back and unknotted problems that began in my past life. At one point, I may or may not have met a Yogi Goat who told me to “let go of my earthly worries.” I did. I released them into the mountains like confetti.

On my final day, as I stood in a bathrobe staring dramatically into the mist, I swear the clouds winked at me. A bird landed nearby and gave me a knowing nod, as if to say, “You get it now.”

In summary: Santani is not a hotel. It is an enlightenment factory. A place where stress dissolves, gravity becomes optional, and even the furniture feels more self-actualized than you. I now live on air, vibes, and the occasional memory of that quinoa bowl.

11/10—book now if you’re ready to question reality and become a sentient, blissful cumulus.
title: "I Met a Yogi Goat, Transcended Reality, and Became a Cloud"

He taught me techniques for relaxing before sleep but most importantly helped me with his advice hot to deal with negative thoughts, overcome sadness and heal. I will definetly request having sessions with Saman again when I return next year and would greatly recommend him.

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I stayed in the Mountain View Chalet at Santani for one night during our journey from Ella to Colombo. In hindsight, I would strongly recommend at least two nights—three if you have the time—to fully experience what Santani has to offer. Kandy was our penultimate stop during our 10-night Sri Lanka itinerary, and Santani promised the perfect respite we needed at this stage. While the setting and aesthetic were truly breathtaking, our experience was marred by a series of frustrating inconsistencies and service failures.

Unfortunately, our 06:37 am train from Ella was cancelled, forcing us onto a later train, which delayed our schedule and caused us to miss the lunch service at Santani. Although we provided a heads-up about our ETA, we were informed that only sandwiches and fruit could be offered for lunch upon arrival. I pleaded for a hot meal after a 6-hour journey but was met with a firm no. While I understand the need for structure around meal times, the lack of flexibility felt unnecessarily rigid, especially given that lunch was included in our package. It was a bitter start to an otherwise promising stay.

For each meal, we were offered two menu options: Western or Sri Lankan. A chef consultation was arranged to tailor the menu to our dietary requirements—my husband is gluten-free and does not eat red meat. The concept of personalisation sounded wonderful in theory, but the delivery fell far short. At dinner, the meals differed from what we discussed earlier, and when we questioned this, we were told certain items contained gluten. My husband’s dessert, for example, was swapped from Sri Lankan pancakes to a makeshift fruit salad—hardly the bespoke experience promised. At breakfast, they served granola containing gluten and suggested my husband “just eat a little,” as if his dietary restriction were a mere preference. This was not only disappointing but also felt deeply unprofessional. Additionally, previously requested items like a Sri Lankan omelette and mixed fruit smoothie were either forgotten or met with bizarre responses like “eat this first, and we’ll bring another.”

The grounds and chalet were stunning, and the views from our Mountain View Chalet, for which we paid an additional $40 upgrade, were well worth it. The serenity and natural beauty are Santani’s greatest strengths. We also had 90-minute Ayurvedic treatments, which were very relaxing. However, there was inconsistency here too—my husband received the promised consultation with the doctor before his treatment, while mine skipped the consultation entirely. The lack of uniformity was frustrating and detracted from the wellness experience.

Finally, as we were checking out at 12 noon and couldn’t stay for lunch (which begins at 12), we requested a packed meal. I specifically asked for a salad alongside my sandwich, but we were instead given fruit—again, an instance of Santani failing to meet basic expectations.

Individually, these lapses in service might not seem terrible, but collectively, they erode the sense of luxury and wellness that Santani strives to provide. While the setting is undeniably beautiful and offers moments of calm, the numerous inconsistencies and lack of attention to detail left us feeling underwhelmed. Santani has the potential to be truly exceptional but must address these service failings to meet the standard it claims to uphold.
title: Stunning Views but Inconsistent Service at Santani

Literally blissful stay at Santini wellness - and I feel better for it. We stayed two nights. Getting to Santini was an adventure in itself but very well worth it. 

The aspects of Santini we enjoyed - literally everything! The team set exceptionally high standards in everything they do. Everyone knows exactly what to do and how to do it very well. All members of the team from garden staff to the restaurant to the Spa seemed to know is as individuals and it was their mission to make sure we enjoyed every minute of our stay and indeed beyond our stay. I will explain. 

The Ayurvedic treatments we received were way beyond any expectations. I had two and several days later I feel better for it. Hard to explain without endless detail but these practitioners are hugely expert. 

Our room / cabin was beautiful with a stunning view from the balcony across the rainforest 
canopy.  

The restaurant team and all the dishes were simply perfection with choice of Sri Lankan or Western menu choices. 

When we left at 3am in the morning our driver had been provided with a place to rest. We were collected in the TukTuk and driven to departure point provided a breakfast pack to munch and drink on our way and at the airport. 

We promised to return and we will. 

I can without hesitation recommend Santini as a very high quality wellness report in idyllic surroundings run by passionate experts.

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment you arrive at Santani Wellness, a profound sense of peace envelops you. The views are unparalleled—you can easily lose yourself watching how a cloud slowly drapes over a mountain, transforming the landscape within minutes. The attention to detail is exquisite, and the food follows an Ayurvedic principle known as 'Rasa Haya,' which translates to six tastes, ensuring your body receives nutrition tailored to its specific needs.

I stayed on a leisure basis for several days, but Santani also offers a range of wellness packages designed to meet individual goals, such as weight loss, better sleep, or detoxification. There are numerous activities to enjoy in the surrounding nature, but you can also spend your day unwinding in the three-layered spa, which offers a serene escape through its beautifully designed spaces dedicated to relaxation, hydrotherapy, and rejuvenation.

Since my return, Santani has helped me to prioritize my well-being in ways I hadn’t before. I've always found it challenging to commit to activities like meditation or yoga, often viewing them as somewhat repetitive due to my fast-paced lifestyle. However, this perception has shifted since my stay. The resort’s unique ability to encourage mindful living, paired with its thoughtful design, genuinely touched me and left a lasting impact.

I want to personally thank Vickum, the visionary founder behind this inspiring project, for making me pause, reflect, and rethink my approach to self-care. Never did I imagine waking up at 6 a.m. to start my day with a 7 a.m. yoga class. The minimalist architecture and calm ambiance of the resort immediately prompt you to slow down and connect with the present moment—something that isn’t just a cliché but a lived reality here.

Santani’s mindful approach to hospitality and its commitment to creating a sanctuary for relaxation and reflection are incredibly necessary in today's world. It’s more than just a stay; it’s a transformative experience that resonates deeply and stays with you long after you’ve left.
title: A Transformative Experience at Santani Wellness

text:
I had a wonderful stay at EKHO Surf today and would like to extend my sincere appreciation to the entire team. The beachfront location is stunning, offering breathtaking views and a truly relaxing atmosphere. The staff were exceptionally warm and attentive, always ready to assist with a smile. From check-in to check-out, the service was seamless and professional.

The room was clean, well-maintained, and comfortably furnished, with everything I needed for a pleasant stay. I especially appreciated the attention to detail and the effort to create a welcoming environment. The food was another highlight—delicious, fresh, and with a good variety to suit all tastes.

That said, a few areas could use some improvement. The Wi-Fi connection was a bit inconsistent at times, and a few more vegetarian options on the menu would be appreciated. Also, the poolside could benefit from a few more shaded lounging areas.

Overall, EKHO Surf exceeded my expectations. It’s an ideal place for both relaxation and adventure, and I would gladly return. Thank you for making my stay memorable and enjoyable.

Special thanks to Front office team - Aruni, Maleesha, Chethana, Emil, Suneth
title: Recommend

placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Although Uber works in Sri Lanka, the main ride-sharing app is PickMe. Also, tipping is advised.
text:
My wife and I stayed at the hotel in early February 2024 for a week. The service at Postcard is phenomenal: the staff is always very polite and friendly, and the management is very helpful. I would like to extend a special thanks to Bharatvi, Tuhin, and Ajith, who went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We received so many beaches, tourist spots, and restaurants recommendations. They also always offered to call a tuk-tuk or taxi to take us wherever we wanted. Since Uber works relatively well in Sri Lanka, we almost always opted to call a tuk-tuk or taxi ourselves. We only arranged airport transfers through the hotel upon arrival and departure, which went smoothly.

The hotel overlooks a lake and a beach. However, it is not advisable to swim in the lake, and unfortunately, the hotel does not offer any activities such as kayaking or stand-up paddle. Furthermore, the beach is too far from the hotel and not worth visiting, as it is dirty, small, and the rough sea keeps swimmers away. On the other hand, the hotel has a nice pool to lounge by, but does not have enough sun loungers: only 3, when there should be at least 4 given the hotel's capacity. 

My suggestion to the hotel is to purchase (at least) two kayaks so that guests can better enjoy the lake, as well as an extra sun lounger for the pool area.
title: Phenomenal service, scenic setting, yet areas for improvement

text: We had a very comfortable stay in this beautiful hotel that gave us wonderful views of the sea. The two-level Attic was perfect for our family of four (though one bathroom got a little tight - but we knew of that in advance and decided to go for it anyway). The private sitting area outside the room opened out into a verandah which overlooked the pool, lush greenery and then the sea - just ideal to lounge with a book or play board games so one didn't mind the unseasonal rain on some days. Being greeted with smiles by every single staff member was a delight. Bharat, the manager, was most helpful and did all he could to ensure our stay was truly memorable. A 15-minute drive to the Galle Fort made it easy to access the hustle-bustle of the more 'touristy' area when we wanted. Half an hour away was Unawatuna's gorgeous beaches with water sports, as well as the hidden Jungle Beach. Anytime breakfast and easy late checkout were the icing on the cake - just perfect for laid back travellers like us. A point to note - while we enjoyed the food, it could have been better; but this was a small thing in light of our overall fabulous experience. Thank you!
title: Hidden gem!

text:
I travelled to Sri Lanka in Oct with my husband and three young children, and we stayed for a night at the Postcard in Galle on our back to Columbo. 
It was such a fantastic place to stay, we wish we could have stayed longer. Not only is it a stunning setting, the staff were incredible, and we were offered easy check in and check out times to suit us and upgraded us into a room which was better for us with young children. Staff made the children so welcome; they really loved it too - especially the pool too after a long day of driving. 
Breakfast was incredible; we had Indian, Sri Lankan and continental, so tried it all, everything was cooked beautifully and the fresh fruit smoothies were the best! 
Would highly recommend to anyone travelling to Galle.

text: My husband and I have traveled far and wide, explored towns and cities worldwide...and have reached a stage where all we need is a beautiful resort, some great food and hospitality, some attention to our comforts, the sound of birds and waves, a relaxing massage and some quiet evenings! From a call from the manager Bharatvir to understand our requirements before we ventured out to Sri Lanka, to a warm welcome on arrival, and a beautiful birthday cake waiting in our room!! Thoroughly enjoyed the four days relaxing in this heaven on earth...Bharatvir and Ajith were always around regaling us with stories, suggestions. roomTip: Try their local dishes, and the local cocktail, taste a little like pina colada, delicious. Take your time to enjoy this place.
text: This place is absolutely stunning.  Looks prettier in life than in the pictures. Service and staff here are top notch, detailed & attention oriented.  Room was immaculate, they did a turn down service, cleaned & cool the rooms before bed.  What a luxury. Breakfast is served at anytime of the day which was so helpful to us as we went whale watching which took 5hours+ & the hotel served us breakfast at 1:30pm.  They turned down our room, and we had a nap afterwards.  Beautiful surroundings and gorgeous view and a pool to cool down in.  Children friendly  - as we had 3 kids with us.  Hotel manager came and spoke to us and made us feel welcome, even the security guards were helpful and friendly, lighting our paths from car to inside.  We always ended the evening with drinks and games.  We had massages to rejuvenate, too. This has to be the highlight hotel of our trip.  Not at the fort area, which was too loud & touristy,  but not too far to go to for a visit or dinner. I have no complaints, not even about pressure of the shower! I highly recommended this place.
title: Stunning property with great staff

placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
text: We, a family of 5, were on a 2 week break in Srilanka from Pakistan. And stayed at various resorts in different cities. Galle was our last destination before heading to Colombo for our flight back home. Our stay at Postcard was amazing. It is not a 5 star resort but the property is extremely well furnished, the rooms are super comfortable, the lobby is warm and cosy, the food is beyond excellent and the staff including the manager are super hospitable and always smiling and willing to help you. The property is a huge bungalow with annexe and nice lobbies, hallways, garden , and swimming pool and outdoor sitting area with very artistic furniture and accessories. Lovely to just relax here for 2 days and enjoy the food and the pool. The Chef was amazing and accommodated our request to cook food for us which was not on the menu. The manager was superb and always attentive and pleasurable to talk to. However, I think the 2 years of Covid have had an impact on the property and repairs and upkeep are required here and there. Like the billiard area and the outside garden bar was not operational and the deck down at the lake also required significant repairs. I think the management is aware of this and before the busy season starts in November they should get these areas and others repaired and operational. Overall a wonderful experience and will comeback again.
title: Best in class - home away from home

placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
text: The property itself is really beautiful with nice decor and many places to sit.  The pool was nice but in the shade so quite cool.  The room was very large and comfortable.  The staff were very friendly.  We were the only people at the whole property so it felt a bit empty and it is a bit out of town - ten minute trip to Galle but we had already stayed in Galle and just stayed here for one night to enjoy the hotel.  There are nice views to the ocean etc but one cannot really walk to it from the property easily.  The food menu was a bit limited but understandable considering it is a small hotel, and unfortunately when we were there the cook was ill so they got a local person to cook and the food was fine, just limited choices.  The prices of alcohol were reasonable for this type of hotel.  Overall it's a very nice hotel in terms of decor and the building, but there is so much competition in hotels in the area that score highly on food, location and decor. There are quite a lot of mosquitos at night in the outside area even when wearing full length clothing and using mosquito coils, but it was fine in the room.
title: Beautiful property with nice decor outside of Galle

text:
My husband and I travelled to Sri Lanka for our honeymoon and during our trip stayed at the quaint Postcard Hotel in Galle.

It felt like a home away from home and we can’t wait to visit another Postcard property soon!

text: About 10 minutes from the airport.  A sizable commercial hotel.  My room was fine; everything worked. There are two restaurants, a fancy looking Chinese which did not go to and a buffet restaurant.  The buffet restaurant was fine.  Laundry service worked well returning clothes the next day.
title: Fine commercial hotel convenient for the airport.

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
The most magical space we have found in the hill country of the tropical paradise of Sri Lanka! This newly refurbished colonial bungalow is warm, welcoming, cozy and is sure to take you back to the nostalgic past amidst the backdrop of lush gardens rich in biodiversity. The house is owned by David Swannell and his family and they have added in a lot of personal touches to make the space a truly unforgettable one for any nature lover looking for a homely respite in the mountains. The property is set for evening tea, lunch by the pool, with the most perfect ambiance, music and company to add to the magic of the mountain vistas. The manager of the property Max and the staff are very friendly, and so are the estate dogs who will give you a warm welcome at your arrival. 

A minimum two day stay is recommended as the property has a lot to see with two gorgeous cascading waterfalls and the nearby One Tree Hill viewpoint for breathtaking sunset views, and Sembuwaththa Lake for a relaxing stroll among the pine trees. Guided hikes can be also arranged with adventure guide and naturalist Aravinda Rathnayake who has vast experience in mountainscapes. Cannot recommend this space enough - visit for a truly memorable experience!
title: Simply Magic!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: all the rooms in the main house are delightful
text: my all too brief stay at the Ashburnham Estate was absolute perfection .. it was a dream come true ..the house itself is so beautiful and in a spectacular location -- and it is furnished with grace and quiet elegance ... but what made it really very special was the excellent service and delicious food and especially the kindness and attention to detail of the manager and staff ...   marvellous breakfasts and delicious lunches and dinners all served on the terrace with the most wonderful views -- but what i particularly remember was afternoon tea with victoria sponge cake and reading a good book -- absolute bliss ..!! i was reluctant to leave this comfortable terrace -- but i was persuaded by the kindest of guides to go on an afternoon walk through the beautiful surrounding countryside -- well worth the effort as he was so well very well informed about the local flora and fauna .. the whole stay was redolent of more peaceful ,elegant and stylish times gone past -- a rare find and a dream come true ..!!!!!!!!
title: Perfection ..!!!!!!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I recently spent 2 nights here. Absolutely loved it!
Amazing food. Considering the remote location 3 menu options was incredible. 
The staff we very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. The tea tour and tasting with Mr Das should not be missed.
Wifi was always good.
Not like a hotel, more like home from home.
Would definitely come again!
title: Colonial tranquility

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
If you’re looking for a place to relax and unwind after the chaos of Kandy then this hotel is the place. It’s as if you’ve stepped back in time to the 1930’s.  This tastefully renovated Colonial Tea Plantation house commands a magnificent position looking out over the valley below. The view is nothing short of breathtaking. The hotel gardens are lovingly maintained by their small team of gardeners and the setting is peaceful and relaxing. The Tea Plantation tour and tea tasting with Mr Das is a must. 

Don’t come here expecting the trappings of a modern city centre hotel. The rooms are comfortable but reflect the 1930’s period style. There’s no air conditioning, mini bar, satellite TV and so forth. The sole concession to the 21st Century is the availability of WiFi for those desperate to stay connected to the modern world. 

The service is friendly and attentive. The food is excellent and, although the menu choice is limited, there’s always something to suit most palates. The lunch and dinner offerings change daily depending upon what ingredients are available at the market so what you get is always fresh and imaginative. Breakfasts are excellent also.

I’ve given it a 4 rather than 5 due to a few issues below: 

1. The random selection of plastic clothes hangers that were provided in the room were totally out of keeping with the character of the property. There’s no excuse for not providing a matching set of wooden hangars.

2. Very limited selection of alcoholic drinks available especially spirits.

3. All the prices are in U.S. dollars. Why? It makes no sense at all especially as the majority of the clientele are from the U.K.

4. Their website needs updating. I had expected to have a cooking class with the chef, Reggie only to find that Reggie had left a year previously. I did attend a ‘class’ with the new chefs but it was more like a demonstration that a cooking class and instead of the advertised 2.5 hours it only lasted an hour. Disappointing.

5. The safe in the room was not secured to anything which rendered it somewhat pointless.

That said, it is still a lovely place to stay and would stay again if returning to Sri Lanka
title: Stunning location

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They are all different but equally nice.
text:
'Though slightly rustic this lovely 1930's bungalow felt more like being part of a house party than staying in an hotel.  The food was delicious and reasonably priced.  Tea and cake served on the lawn at 4pm is not to be missed.  The pool was warm and clean. 
Our room was had a great terrace with wonderful views over the tea plantation.  The bed was extremely comfortable. Plenty of hot water in the shower and lovely toiletries provided.  Their laundry service is excellent.
There's a plethora of options for walks and other things to do.  The staff are very welcoming, helpful and keen to ensure you really enjoy and get the most from your stay.
title: Fantastic.....

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
My partner and I stayed here for just a single a night (wish it could have been longer!) and our stay was absolutely fabulous! 

The accommodation is a quaint 6 bedroom guesthouse which oozes Sri Lanka beauty and charm. Our room overlooked the veranda which boasts incredible views out onto the tea plantation. The room was perfect and we had a fantastic night sleep. 

The staff are very welcoming and hospitable and go out of their way to provide fresh iced teas, serve afternoon tea and cake down near the pool and offering summer hats for shade from the hot sun.

The guesthouse offers evening 3 course meal for $20 which a choice of food (unsure of food offered at lunch). We enjoyed an evening meal there and the food was AMAZING! I had a piece of tallabut (unsure of spelling) fish and I think this is the best fish I’ve ever eaten, absolutely delicious. The breakfast is included and again you have a choice from a large selection which was outstanding! Even the toast was amazing! 

We would absolutely recommend Ashburnham Estate as a place to stay in Sri Lanka and we will 100% return if we are blessed to find ourselves in Sri Lanka again. Thank you Ashburnham! 

Kyle & Rachael
title: Beautiful, peaceful and stunning setting!

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Just delightful. Great food. Lovely staff. Fabulous setting. One of the most beautiful I’ve ever stayed at. Can’t recommend too highly. Quite wonderful. 
We went as part of a guided tour and it has a wonderful old world feel.
title: Fabulous Hotel

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: The decor of the bungalow, the gardens and surrounding estate all served to transport us back to the colonial era. The views are amazing, the pool delightful and the estate even has it's own stunning waterfall. All the staff are helpful and friendly. We enjoyed a very interesting walk up to the ridge through the tea plantation and village with Ashwan. All fabulous!
title: Perfect retreat in the heart of the tea country

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
I came to Ashburnham in January 2020 - for the third time. Which should tell you enough. But let me elaborate:
First of all the location: Far away from any major city it is located within a Tea Plantation. The terrace overlooks the valley which already impresses upon arrival. The noisiest thing you will hear will be the birds chirping around you. 
The rooms have a lot of charisma. Not a single rooms looks like another and each one of them has their own little twist.
The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. May it be regarding your food or arranging activities for you.
The food is plenty and reasonably priced. Consider the fact that it has to be brought all the way there unless they can grow it in their vegetable garden on the property.
My purpose of this visit was to relax. And Ashburnham is ideal for that. I did not spend all day on the terrace doing nothing, mind you. Having their own waterfall on the estate is a huge bonus. And it is not one of those little springs that some hotels falsely call a waterfall. It is a proper one. It invites to explore up- and downstream. With a guide or by yourself. Go for a swim or simply hang out around it and enjoy the sounds of the rushing water.
If you prefer a mountain bike tour, some hiking or would love to learn more about the tea, there is plenty of activities to choose from. I promise, you won't be bored. 
If the weather turns bad, grab a book and make yourself comfortable in front of the fireplace in the common area. 

In summary: I loved how this hotel is different from many. You step in and are not overwhelmed with a massive reception area but with an honest boutique-style hotel. Perfect to wind down and relax but at the same time be active if you wish.
A little tip: If you are thinking of spending a couple if nights there, add an extra one. You will not regret it!
title: Perfect place to actively relax

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at this resort for a personal retreat. Best place ever! Beautiful scenary, lots of places for a quiet walk and personal reflection. Great food too!

And best of all, is the staff! The staff are very friendly and helpful. They generally stay in the kitchen doing their own work, giving me the privacy I need during my retreat. Yet they are always around and ready to help when I approach them with any questions or special requests. I feel really welcomed here. 

I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Best retreat I ever had. Thank you Ashburnham. Way to go!
title: Amazing Ashburnham

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Very friendly welcoming boutique hotel on a tea plantation - absolutely recommend spending a couple of nights here, we really enjoyed the walk to and swim in the waterfalls, tour of the tea plantation and cooking class.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for three nights in late December. It is a magnificent place, the setting is magical, over looking rolling tea covered hills. The staff are super friendly and the food is superb. The decor is very comfortable and the big fire in the living room adds a nice homely feel in the chilly evenings. We are already thinking about when we might be able to come back!
title: Magical place

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Ashburnham Estate is a small boutique hotel (6 rooms), high up in the tea producing hills, stunning views, friendly staff, pool, waterfalls and good food. It is charming, not luxurious but perfectly adequate and gives a taste of Sri Lanka as it is or used to be. Lovely for 2 or 3 days and highly recommended.
title: Tea planters house in the hills

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: A former Tea Plantation main house, now small hotel. One of the few places I would return to without hesitation; it’s a magical place: scenery stunning, service impeccable, food of the highest quality: wish we had booked longer....
title: Just Magnificent

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Our visit to Ashburnham was extremely interesting. We were greeted courteously by the staff and tea workers. We experienced picking tea, tea tasting, a tasty lunch and afternoon tea. The staff went out of their way to ensure our visit was a memorable one. It was a day trip only and we did not stay at the hotel as much as we would have liked to.
title: Beautiful environment

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: A magical day with views of the mountains amongst the clouds. Visited the tea plantation, picked tea leaves, learned about the planting and harvesting and processing of tea. Especially enjoyed the estate agricultural manager teaching us how to taste tea, a brilliant lunch with tea infused carrots , a tour of the accommodation and tower. A guided walk to and swim in the amazing waterfall. A very competent guide. The  Then a traditional English afternoon tea. We were treated regally and the smiling staff were extremely courteous and answered all our enquiries.
title: Experiencing the Splendour  of the Past

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
