placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Set in beautiful hills overlooking their tea estate, an old planters house. We stayed in the Burnham suite which was sumptuous. A great place to read, relax and unwind. A chice of places to swim, in the pool on the terrace or in a pool below the watetfall (15 minutes down). A good visit to the plantation picking and tasting teas.
title: Nice place to relax at the end of a holiday

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Adrian and his wife described trying to make Ashburnham feel like home from home.  They've certainly achieved this and more - it's a fantastic place to relax and we all felt absolutely comfortable in the serene and informal setting looked after by attentive staff. The family relaxed in the pool, played tennis and Scrabble with other guests, read books, wandered down to the waterfall (complete with wellies supplied to minimise risk of leeches!), learned about tea-picking with manager Mr Das, went on a short hike through the beautiful hills with Anuradha, sampled complementary iced tea and delicious cake on the terrace - we could have spent another couple of days here easily.  Although the menu is short there was no problem finding something the children would eat and the food is delicious.  The whole family returned from Sri Lanka with our days at Ashburnham as a particularly special memory.  Thank you to everyone there for making our stay so enjoyable.
title: Wish we'd been here for longer

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
If you want peace and quiet in an olde world setting, this is your place.
It is very isolated on top of a mountain but the setting is stunningly beautiful.
The staff bent over backwards to make our stay just what we wanted.
The food was lovely and different each day...a limited menu really well presented and delicious. All locally sourced.
 Wonderful views and local walks with guides for as long as you wanted
Very good value
title: Old world elegance

ownerResponse/text: We are delighted you enjoyed your stay and wish you a warm welcome back to the COCO BAY.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: great place
text:
I am a little late writing this review .sorry Coco Bay. We have been to Sri Lanka many , many times . Staying at a variety of resorts and hotels , really wish we had found this gem of a hotel earlier. The location is idyllic, on its own beach , sea views from all rooms . The rooms are kept spotlessly clean as are the public areas ,by the professional , friendly housekeeping staff .
From checking in to checking out ,everything is faultless . The reception staff are polite, helpful and always smiling .
There are comfortable loungers facing the sea and only steps from the pool , a plentiful supply of clean beach towels always at hand  supplied by the smiling life guard 
We opted for the half board basis for our stay . We were not disappointed . Breakfast was an excellent start to the day, fruit juice ,fruit platter ,pastries and then a choice of the cooked options . There was also a wide selection for the evening meal . all delicious . The chef was always on hand with advice and help . Would always ask if there was anything we would especially like 
We ate lunch there on a few occasions  ,the seafood platter is to die for . I would like to thank all the staff that took care of us in the restaurant  , they were all wonderful.
We will back in the very near future
title: A little gem, a perfect place to stay.

ownerResponse/text: We are delighted you enjoyed your stay, and thank you so much for the encouraging review, which is appreciated by all the staff. We look forward with pleasure to welcoming you both back to the COCO BAY.
placeInfo/address: 10/4 Roomassala Road, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book a private pool room, well worth it, and also go for their set menu if you have the option, you really wont want to dine anywhere else.
text:
Booked this resort in Sri Lanka for 4 nights after a busy Indian tour for some rest and relaxation. We were not disappointed. We booked a private pool room, which was lovely. We also had our own jacuzzi in the bathroom. And as well as our own pool we were right on the beach.
The staff here are warm, friendly and so welcoming.
I really didn't want to leave. It's a bit of a way from Colombo, but well worth it, and the hotel has their own driver for a small fee.
The restaurant onsite is amazing. We had the set menu included in our booking price and I wasn't sure if i would be glad of it as set menus are usually cheap and nasty, but oh my word, their set menus were different every day and basically 5 courses and delicious. It was pretty much fine dining on the beach. The seafood every night was fresh and amazing.
 We usually go out to other restaurants, but this place had us hooked every night.
You won't be disappointed with this resort, its boutique size, warm and welcoming and the staff treat you like family.
I found that having a smaller size resort made you feel right at home and cared for unlike all the big resorts all around the world.
It's also just a short tuk tuk ride from all the historic attractions of Galle fort and the shopping.
Try this place you will not be disappointed, and you will want to come back again and again.
And as a side note to enhance your stay here
 If you need a good tuk tuk driver, try this number 0779059175, I think his name is Lalit he took us on a day out that was amazing, his tuk tuk was clean, he was so safe, a funny nice guy who really showed us a good time for a good price.
title: Amazing, most relaxing resort.

As for the location, this is the place to be if you want it quiet and cozy. I enjoyed the Sri Lankan food at the hotel for dinner and breakfast - it was delicious.

I can only recommend this hotel and if I am in Hikkaduwa again, I will definitely stay there again.

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We ended up staying at Roman Beach quite by accident. The original hotel we had planned to stay at had to cancel a day before our arrival due to unavoidable reasons. 
The hotel itself has only 6 rooms so there is an air of privacy and you feel like you have the whole place to yourself. The rooms are very large and spacious and have a beautiful view of the beach. The hotel is located on a relatively uncrowded part of the beach, and a short walk will lead you to the restaurants and bars.
Food was exceptional and frankly of a much higher standard than we expected. The staff also must be commended for their courteousness and attention to detail. Both Pasan and Chathuranga went the extra mile to make our stay that much more enjoyable. Sugath, who helps with maintenance also was extremely kind to us and our daughter. Would definitely like to visit Roman Beach again.
title: A Hidden Gem

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel was amazing with an beautiful view and the staff was absolutely brilliant and very helpful. We all have a very nice stay. The food what Very delicious as well and the rooms were very neat and tidy.
title: Very good for meeting atmosphere

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: This was our first time in Sri Lanka so we originally booked Roman Beach for only 3 nights imagining that we’d move on somewhere else for the rest of the holiday. The hotel and location were so perfect that we stayed for the rest of our holiday. The hotel is wonderful. The room we had was amazing. Lots of space, beautifully decorated, wonderful bathroom and a gorgeous balcony to sit on and watch the sunset. Only six rooms in the hotel so every room had a similarly wonderful view. The location is great. Directly onto a lovely beach and a short walk along the beach to a large number of beach bars and restaurants. Lovely pool and a very relaxing pool area to chill out in. Wonderful breakfasts. Staff were amazing and special mentions to Bhagya who sorted breakfasts and pretty much anything else we needed, the manager Waruna who chatted to us every morning offering up suggestions when we told him of our likely plan for the day, and Sargatha who kept the pool area and gardens in amazing condition. Everyone was lovely. Everything was perfect. Nothing was too much trouble. This is how every hotel should be! We’ll be back next year for sure.
title: Perfect

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Hotel liegt perfekt am Strand von Hikkaduwa. Wenige Meter in Richtung Turtelbeach kann man Surfen, in verschiedenen Lockalen verweilen und den Urlaub geniessen. Das Hotel selber hat einen schönen Pool mit kleiner gepflegten Gartenanlage und direkten Strandzugang. Das Service/Poolpersonal ist freundlich und zuvorkommend. Der Koch versteht sein Handwerk und kocht internationale Gerichte sowie Srilankische Spezialitäten. Der Hotelmanager ist immer vor Ort und kümmert sich um das Wohl seiner Gäste. Einzig die Aperokarte muss man noch überarbeiten, wenn jemand Lust auf einen Drink hat und nicht gerne Bier ist die Auswahl eher bescheiden. 
Die Zimmer sind sauber und grosszügig. Der Blick am Morgen aus dem Bett auf das Meer lässt einem definitiv in Ferienstimmung sein. 
Sehr empfehlenswert!
title: Empfehlenswert

ownerResponse/text:
Lieber Online-Fox,

Vielen Dank für Ihre Bewertung. Wir wissen das sehr zu schätzen, da wir ein familiengeführtes Unternehmen sind und ständig daran arbeiten, uns zu verbessern.

Wir werden auf jeden Fall an den Handtüchern arbeiten und diese so schnell wie möglich ersetzen.

Bezüglich der Preisgestaltung ist es eine schwierige Entscheidung, denn wir sind stolz darauf, ein gutes Verhältnis von Personal zu Gästen zu haben, damit unsere Gäste immer rundum verwöhnt werden. Da die Lebenshaltungskosten weltweit gestiegen sind.

Da die meisten unserer Waren importiert werden und unser Talent ein wichtiges Kapital ist, müssen wir unsere Mitarbeiter entlohnen.

Darüber hinaus haben wir angesichts der Covid-Pandemie und der Wirtschaftskrise hart daran gearbeitet, viele Renovierungsarbeiten durchzuführen.

Wir verstehen auf jeden Fall, dass wir einige kleinere Ergänzungen vornehmen können, und wir arbeiten mit Sicherheit daran!

Trotzdem vielen Dank für Ihre Bewertung.

Wir hoffen, dass Sie uns noch einmal besuchen, um den Unterschied im Angebot von Roman Beach zu sehen.

Bitte schreiben Sie uns eine E-Mail, wenn Sie Vorschläge haben!

Beste grüße,

Römisches Strandmanagement
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Suchen Sie so lange, bis Sie das Zimmer unter 100,- Euro inklusive Frühstück bekommen. Zum Beispiel hier bei TripAdvisor und Agoda.com.
text:
Das Hotel hat eine perfekte Lage, am schönsten Strandabschnitt von Hikkaduwa. Garten und Pool sind sehr schön und sauber. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich. Das Frühstück war gut und wird nach Absprache zubereitet. Also Sie haben die Wahl: Kontinentales Frühstück oder Sri Lankanisch. Die Einrichtung selbst ist renovierungsbedürftig. Auch die Handtücher sind ziemlich alt. Vor allem die Pool-Handtücher sind abgenutzt. Wenn Sie das Zimmer unter 100,- Euro inkl. Frühstück bekommen, dann buchen Sie! Zum Beispiel hier bei TripAdvisor über Agoda.com 
Mehr Geld ist es nicht wert. PS: Bitte beachten Sie mehr die Gästefotos, die sind aussagekräftiger als die Originalfotos vom Anbieter.
title: Vier Tage im Roman Beach Hikkaduwa

Greetings from Waraka Udawalawe by Thema Collection!
Dear Valued guest,

Thank you for sharing such a detailed and heartfelt review of your stay at Waraka Udawalawe. It’s truly wonderful to know that we were able to reflect the warm and welcoming spirit of Sri Lanka during your visit.

We’re delighted that you enjoyed our thoughtfully designed rooms, fantastic food, and sustainable approach to building our hotel. Your appreciation for our efforts in upcycling and using reclaimed materials is especially meaningful to us, as sustainability is a core value of ours.

Thank you also for your suggestion regarding the bedroom lighting. Feedback like yours helps us to improve, and we will certainly look into enhancing this aspect of our rooms.

It’s great to hear that you’d love to stay with us again and are interested in exploring other Thema Collection hotels. We would be thrilled to welcome you back and ensure another wonderful experience awaits.

Dilshan Shirantha
Assistant Manager
placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Sadly only stayed here for 1 night, whilst visiting the National Parks and also Dilmah elephant sanctuary. The hotel is really well thought out and rooms are beautifully & sympathetically designed.
The welcome was warm, service excellent and food was fantastic… best so far in Sri Lanka!! The way they have built this new boutique hotel (opened just 5 months ago) from scratch with maximum upcycling and use of reclaimed materials whilst at the same time achieving such amazing results really is something to behold. Just one suggestion would be to double or triple the lighting in the bedrooms which can be a little difficult to see in! However… doesn’t detract from the fact that I would definitely stay here again and, if the other Thema group hotels are a patch on this and reflect what’s in the brochure… would include them too. Wonderful experience… many thanks 🙏🏽.
title: Sri Lankans seem to be so smiley and welcoming… Waraka Thema hotel made me feel the same. Simply lovely hotel!

Greetings from Waraka Udawalawe by Thema Collection!
Dear Valued guest,

Thank you so much for your lovely review! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that the attic suite and dining experience exceeded your expectations. It’s great to know you appreciated the peaceful ambiance, our special touches like the outdoor shower, and the freshly prepared meals.

We’ll look into the wait times to ensure a smoother experience while keeping the quality intact. We're also happy to hear that the spa experience and relaxing amenities like the hot tub and hammock swings were well-received by your family.

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Tucked away in a tranquil corner of the national park, this hotel is truly a hidden gem that exceeded all our expectations. Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed with fresh, cold face towels, a nice touch after a long time traveling.

We stayed in the attic suite, which boasted charming decor and was impeccably clean. The air conditioning worked perfectly, ensuring our comfort during our stay. The bathroom had a unique outdoor feel, with a shower that added a touch of nature to our experience.

Dining was a highlight of our stay. The breakfast and dinner offerings were excellent, showcasing fresh ingredients and delightful flavors. While the wait time for food was longer than average, we appreciated that everything was cooked to order, which made it worth the wait.

The pool provided a refreshing retreat, though it was slightly cold. Fortunately, the hot tub was a fantastic complement, allowing us to warm up whilst the children played of the hammock swings.

WiFi was reliable throughout the hotel, which was a nice bonus. 

My husband and son highly recommend a trip to the spa, where they indulged in the head, back, and neck experience—an absolute must-try.

One thing to note is that the rooms aren't soundproof, allowing the natural sounds of the surroundings to seep in. This might not be ideal for everyone, but it certainly enhances the connection to nature.

Overall, it is a fantastic retreat for those seeking peace and relaxation and made a nice change to our usual hotel stays.
title: Hidden gem

placeInfo/address: 224/B, Susil Mawatha, South Cannel, Udawalawe, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Family rooms are perfectly sized. They also pack a nice breakfast pack for your early morning safari tours which was such a nice touch.
text:
A true gem-seamlessly blending the very best of Sri Lankan hospitality, a homely vibe and beautiful surroundings.

 The staff are what makes this place truly special-nothing is too much trouble and they always go out of their way to ensure guests have a pleasant stay. The food is top notch and the head chef is so very passionate about his craft - always taking the time to gather direct feedback and even sharing his cooking skills via a live demonstration! The kids really enjoyed this! 

The resort is beautifully managed and the pool is great to unwind in. 

Ive travelled to a few places but non have the same warmth and friendly nature as this hotel. Being a boutique hotel with 12 rooms it's unlikely to be overcrowded which is a nice plus. The family rooms were great to be able to accommodate our children and us in one room. 

Waraka have a number of sustainability initiates as well but what caught my attention was the commercial partnership with the local community all the way from fresh produce, to the staff being picked from the community and trained, it's very special and it really is a very respectable model-this place has left an impression on our family. Would not hesitate to book again and recommend to friends.
title: Incredible Sri lankan hospitality at its finest in Udawalawe

text:
We travelled as a family of 6 during the long weekend and stayed for one night. We booked the Walawa Suite (quadruple) and a double room. We were given a warm welcome on arrival at the front office by Nadeeka and Hiruni and was ushered to the lobby. Thereafter we were treated to a refreshing cool “beli mal” drink. 
Initially I thought since it’s a small property there wasn’t much we could do in this property but we were all proven wrong. 
We had lunch and there was only 3 options for the main course since there were only a few people for lunch. However, the lunch tasted really good with amazing flavors. 
We were also greeted by the naturalist;  Dinuka who is very friendly, keen and knowledgeable about his subject. You can book a safari to Udawalawe National Park with him. 
Afterwards, we checked in to the rooms, they have taken maximum use of the space and the double room also had a small balcony. They were well maintained and spotless, equipped with all necessary amenities. Bandara does an amazing job in maintaining the rooms. 
The suite was very spacious facing the pool with a large balcony, lounge chairs and a jacuzzi. We were also welcomed by the manager by Mr. Dilshan who talked to us about the back story of the property. He was very friendly and asked us to let him know any requirements. 
After the long journey, we had a dip in the pool facing the river and relaxed in the outdoor jacuzzi next to the pool. 
For dinner, there was a variety of choices in the menu and it had something for everyone. The balcony in the suite was very relaxing with the cool wind blowing from the river so we requested dinner to the room. The dinner was flavorful and 
I was pleasantly surprised with a birthday cake also. Lalith and Aruna ensured that our four course dinner was brought separately even though it was a hassle for them to bring it upstairs several times. 
We woke up early next morning as we were keen on kayaking. We were given life jackets and explained the basics of kayaking by Lalith who also accompanied us. We had a great time for about an hour even though it was our first time and we were so glad that we did it. 
Afterwards, we had a hearty, delicious breakfast with both western and Sri Lankan cuisines. All the meals we had were well seasoned and balanced, thanks to kitchen staff along with chefs for the delicious food.
 However, In future, I would suggest to expand your menu with more choices in main courses and deserts. 
After another swim in the pool and a nap it was time to check out. On our way back we visited the elephant transit home which is just a few minutes away from the hotel. 

Overall, through my experience, I would say we had a relaxing vacation and we were well taken care of by the staff. The staff is the core in any business, specially in hospitality. Therefore, kudos to the staff for ensuring that you offer amazing customer satisfaction and building a good perception about thema resorts. Keep up the good work.
title: Relaxing Holiday

ownerResponse/text:

Dear Katie,

Thank you so much for your lovely review! We're thrilled to hear that you and your family had such a wonderful stay with us. We're also happy to hear that you found the location ideal for visiting Udawalawe.

As for the teddy bear, we’re so glad we could reunite it with your daughter! It was our pleasure to help, and we hope it brings a smile to her face. We truly appreciate your kind words and hope to welcome you all back to Waraka in the future!

Dilshan Shirantha

text: We stayed at Waraka for one night as part of a longer holiday to Sri Lanka. We had a wonderful stay - the room was spacious for our family of four, the staff were wonderful (my daughters loved making flower crowns with them) and the food delicious! It's a great location for visiting Udawalawe. When we arrived at the airport to go home we realised we had left our youngest daughters favourite teddy bear at the hotel - disaster!  Dilshan was so helpful - he found the bear and she has just arrived safely back to us in the UK. Thank you Dilshan and all at Waraka!
title: Wonderful stay!

placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: The attic suite where we stayed was high on privacy and comfort.
text:
My husband, our teen son, and I stayed at this property from April 7 to 10, 2022. It was one of the most relaxing and beautiful holidays we have had! Against the backdrop of the economic crisis and unrest in the island country, we were told by many to postpone our trip. But our correspondence with the hotel manager Suraj Chhetri assured us that we would be well taken care of and we went ahead. We are so glad we did!
Everything about the hotel is pleasing - its architecture (old colonial with teak pillars and four-poster beds), location (overlooking an estuary and the sea), the vibe (sun-dappled, breezy balconies with chaise lounges), food (curated, local and global favorites), and most important - the service!! Without being intrusive the staff is helpful and eager to make your experience a most pleasant one! The hotel is best for those who seek quiet and serenity - think of catching up on your reading while intermittently dozing off while gazing at the distant sea! If you seek some excitement then the Galle heritage precinct is just 15 minutes away! We particularly commend Suraj Chhetri, chef Abhijeet who curated each meal as per our taste, dining room staff Ajith with his many helpful tips, and all the rest of the staff too. If this is the standard at all Postcard hotels, we envisage many vacations at the Postcard from hereon! From our hearts - Thank You!
title: "A most relaxing stay in truly curated luxury!'

ownerResponse/responder: The Postcard Hotel The Postcard Hotel
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rahul,

Thank you for choosing The Postcard Galle during your recent trip to Sri Lanka.

It was indeed a pleasure having you come and stay with us and I am delighted that we made your first post-Covid trip a memorable one.

The Postcard Galle, Sri Lanka
placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
I stayed at the Postcard Galle for 5 nights in March for a family vacation. This being my first post-COVID trip I was a bit worried, but the Postcard was absolutely perfect. 

To start with, the hotel is a lovely property. It's set in a well-maintained colonial villa right on the water. Although you can't access the beach directly from the hotel due to an estuary, there's an access from the village nearby. 

The villa isn't in Galle proper, but a village called Gintota that's a short drive (5-7 minutes away). The hotel can arrange a tuk tuk for you, should you wish to go into town. The location is perfect - you're close enough to town should you wish to see the sights, but also have the peace and quiet of the outskirts.   

The villa has only 10 rooms, which are well appointed with air-conditioning, a four poster bed, a desk, a seating area, and a large bathroom. The rooms overlook the courtyard, which has a few sunbeds and a swimming pool. 

We ate all our meals at the dining room, and were not disappointed. The food is cooked fresh, and the chef made sure to personally check on the meals. I highly recommend the hoppers for breakfast, and the local fish or prawn curry. 

The best part of our stay, however, was the service. All the staff are extremely helpful. Special shout out to the manager Suraj, who made sure our stay was comfortable and took care of all requests. Ajith at the dining room was also extremely helpful, and is a great resource if you need any local information. 

Overall, a great hotel, and thank you very much to the team at the Postcard Galle for an absolutely lovely stay.
title: Lovely villa hotel and service

placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Ask for a Room on the 2nd Floor
text:
When I think about getting away to an exotic country like Sri Lanka I think of staying at a hotel that embodies the unique country I am staying in.  I am thrilled to have found this amazing hotel that rejuvenated my spirit and provided every possible amenity I could have asked for and more.

If you are looking for a large splashy resort with swim-up bars in the pool or organized programs for the kids look elsewhere.   

The Postcard is a unique ten-room boutique luxury hotel located on the top of a bluff overlooking the Indian Ocean.  Words can not adequately describe how beautiful the grounds, public areas, and high-end accommodations are maintained and decorated.

Everything is a feast for the eyes with tons of small details that embody the local culture and history of Sri Lanka.  The furniture is colonial, the artwork is full of the colonial past with interesting colors and very playful.  Take the time to absorb the furnishings and places to curl up and read a book preferably a real book with paper.

What sets this gem apart is the staff led by Mr. Ranjan Rai.  Ranjan and his team ensure every detail of your stay is customized to your individual preferences.   He will go out of his way to make sure you will feel at home and provide a level of service unheard of in today's hectic world.   

Special mentions must go to Chef Abhijit Khandual who made several items that were not part of the menu and customized my meals to my preferences.  Each day he would ask for my dinner choices so that he could time my dinner to my schedule.  All items are freshly prepared with the finest local ingredients and you could taste the love in everything he created.

Another member of the team that went above and beyond was Ajith Kumara.  Ajith provided tips to make sure we experienced the best of the local area.  He constantly spoke with us to ensure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable.  

If you are looking for a unique experience that will blow you away without compromising comfort, value privacy, and enjoy an environment that is culturally exceptional,  paradise can be found at The Postcard - Galle, Sri Lanka. 

I will be back in 2023.
title: Paradise Found - But NOT for Everybody

text: We stayed at the Postcard Galle end Jan/early Feb 2022 for three nights  and there’s only one word to describe the property, the service, the view and the food - outstanding!  The place is very charming, colonial style with spacious rooms and great views but what makes it special is the staff who are incredible especially Mr Ranjan Rai, who manages the property. He catered to all our requests and made us feel so welcome and at home. Everything was  personalized and available on demand - via a quick WhatsApp message or call - we were never turned down for anything. We travelled with two kids - 6 & 15 who had a great time especially at the pool and just idling around. All of us really enjoyed the food which was prepared fresh daily and suited to our preference. The chef is amazing and whipped up a variety of Srilankan, International and Indian dishes at breakfast and Lunch/dinner. The location is also fantastic, a short drive to the Galle Fort area and also to the beaches. All in all a fabulous stay and will surely checkout other Postcard properties for future vacations.

text:
We really loved our stay here. It’s a beautiful hotel, with wonderful and friendly staff.
We had some suggestions for the GM, Ranjan Rai, on how to improve small things at the hotel and he was incredibly responsive to all ideas, and was already aware and fixing of some of them (for example, more sun lounge chairs, robes in the room, we had I think the largest room and the furniture placement was odd, impractical and only one place to sit. The design team needs to take another look at the flow of the room) . Ranjan was a great manager steering the hotel out of Covid though. I’m sure it was a huge task.
Considering they had just reopened a month before after being shut for Covid, everything was running very well. The chef and rest of the team were the loveliest people as well. We enjoyed seeing them everyday.
The location is very convenient to get to Galle fort, about 10 min. 
We would definitely recommend this place to others who don’t want to stay on the busy streets of Galle.

The hospitality was exceptionally warm. Satvik, the manager, and his team went above and beyond to make sure our stay was comfortable. Our every request and query was addressed within minutes. 

The food was some of the best we had on our trip in Sri Lanka. Meals were curated as per our preferences and the ingredients were locally sourced. The food was certainly cooked with a lot of heart and passion, we especially enjoyed the traditional Sri Lankan fare such as the Kottu Parotta and the Hoppers. The cocktails were also fabulous, Satvik and his team always had an ace up their sleeve when we wanted to try something new.

I would highly recommend The Postcard Galle to couples, families, and groups of friends traveling to Galle.

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: We are a family of 5, including our three teenagers. The whole experience was incredible from earlier emails, wats app comms once in the country, being there to greet us at our very late 3am arrival, standard of FOOD and accomodation, STAFF, spa treatment, Yoga classes, nature walk and assistance with tracing our youngest child’s lost passport!!! The simple but high quality standard  and finer detail leaves you instantly relaxed and refreshed, without even trying! As our 17 year old lad said “you can’t help but feel relaxed here”. Bravo team Santani, exceptional patch on the earth! We hope to stay longer next time!
title: Divine!

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Santani Wellness Retreat is a truly wonderful place. Stunning views, impressive architecture, welcoming staff, incredible spa treatments, and the most amazing food. We stayed in a mountain chalet, went bird watching, enjoyed the pool, yoga, and spa. All the staff were great - but Shashi was particularly helpful and friendly. Wow! Highly recommend!
title: Wellness wonder

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: We had five incredible nights at Santana. A family of five, two adults and three teenagers.  We booked three mountain villas.  It is a beautiful oasis high up in the mountains.  The location is so peaceful and the resort design is beautiful.  The food was incredible as was the chef.  Honestly the BEST cuisine.  We were all glowing by the end of our stay!!  The staff here are just so wonderful. We were looked after so well by Shashi, he was fantastic. Also special mention to  Oshadi, Aesla, Attayanayke and Kaniska.   You all  made our family feel so  at home and looked after our every need. The yoga was wonderful as was the spa.  I will always remember the mist on the mountain with the prayer call and sun rising.   Also how you made my birthday special Thank you Santina.  We hope to come back one day  💚✨
title: Beautiful…  both the place and the people .

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: incredible experience. my mind and body have changed during this week. the staff are attentive, the rooms divine, the location breathtaking, the yoga classes with Saman perfect, the food delicious, the massages with Patmini are great. Even if the weather was not great, it was the perfect location to be. Peaceful and feeling blessed
title: Retreat

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing stay at Santani wellness! Magical, unreal atmosphere in the middle of the tea plantations. The yoga classes with Saman are just a must do !! He is very professional and dedicated. He was able to help me on my hip and shoulder issue that i've had for years. The spa is a very unique experience, never had such good massages. Let's not speak about the food which was perfect every single meal. Special mention for the Sri Lankan options, delicious!
title: A MUST DO

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Initially, we wondered if a week might be too long to spend in one place, but Santani proved us wrong! From the top-notch spa to the most delicious meals we’ve ever tasted, every moment was a delight! 
The trips through breathtaking landscapes, the pool with its panoramic view and personalized Ayurvedic health plans - all made us feel like the best versions of ourselves. 
Saman, the yoga teacher, made our stay extra special with his beautiful yoga classes. His positive energy and gentle instruction created the perfect atmosphere for relaxation and rejuvenation. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a peaceful escape.
title: Warm recommendation

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely sensational stay with Santani. The location and architecture is breathtaking, glorious views everywhere you look. Service absolutely 5*, and the food and chefs are a delight. Also recommend the yoga (included) and sunrise guided hike up Pettigala Rock. Thank you Santani!
title: 10/10 - gorgeous stay.

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Santani is a retreat from all the stresses of daily life. It’s pretty remote and takes a while to get there but when you do, you’ll find that it lives up to its billing. We stayed for two nights at the end of a 2 week tour around Sri Lanka and found it to be an oasis of calm. The staff are delightful, the food is excellent and the setting very special indeed. 
We did encounter a fairly major problem whilst we were there but the management were really proactive and sorted it out both quickly and graciously. If only all hotels could get it right the way Santani does!
title: Fabulous hotel

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s long way from Columbo airport - cheaper to book your own taxi rather than use the hotel transfer.
text: We loved Santani. The situation of the hotel is stunning - amazing 360 degree views. We had fantastic yoga practice morning and evening, and I had the best massages ever with Pradeep - incredibly talented. Finally, the food was unbelievable - the best hotel food I’ve ever experienced - different 4 course menus every day.. The chef deserves a Michelin star. I’m already thinking of booking a longer stay for next year.
title: Stunning spa/Ayurvedic hotel

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Santani is an hour and a half from Kandy, take a taxi or a tuk tuk but make sure the driver knows where you are going!
text: Santani was incredible ❤️ we were immersed in nature, started and ended the day with the most beautiful sunrises and sunsets. Yoga and 5 star meals. The daily wellness treatments were Devine. Sashi was one of the brilliant service providers but all staff were incredibly accommodating and kind. I would highly recommend Santani as a place to visit ❤️❤️❤️
title: Immerse in pure Bliss at Santani

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Here you can disconnect from the rest of the world whilst being rejuvenated and pampered from morning till evening. The meals are to die for and the service is extraordinary (special thanks to Sashi and the rest of the team - he really went out of his way! ). I will definitely recommend this place to both my clients and friends!!
title: Out of this world wellness retreat

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Santani is a real fairytale of a place - and I wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms and the views out over the mountains were simply out of this world. Couple that up with a remarkable team in both the spa (try the ajuverdic massages!) and the kitchen (the food was sublime) and you have a first-class experience. The grounds were immaculate and the infinity pool so lovely at the end of a hot day. We loved it - and hope to return one day.
title: Simply fabulous!

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: We had a magical trip filled with relaxation, the most amazing food and a unique place that has stayed a wonderful memory. We were touched by the care and thoughtfulness of the whole team… from the extraordinary chef down to the charming waiters, and the wellness team. Every day we were greeted with a smile by staff that made us feel so welcome and cared for. Thank you, Shashi for recommending the spice store , we are still cooking Sri Lankan cuisine inspired by the outstanding chef !! We are still thinking back to our magical time and the healing we experienced. We will be back and can only recommend this magical place.
title: Santani Magic

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Santani for 4 blissful nights. We were greeted on arrival by Sashi, one of the members of staff, who was delightful, as was everyone we came across here. 

It is in a beautiful setting and sits lightly in the landscape, and is both eco and health conscious. It is surrounded by a tea plantation and jungle. Our room had a magical view of the hills. It was a place where you could just sit and immerse yourself in the views, the peace and calm.

The food was delicious and the staff couldn’t do enough to serve you what you wanted.

We did yoga twice a day which was great. We didn’t feel the need for a private lesson. However, we did have a massage which was truly wonderful!

I couldn’t rate this place highly enough as a place to rest and relax as part of your trip exploring this magical country. But it is the staff that made this such a perfect place!
title: Magical few days

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wie schon beschrieben
text:
Wir waren auf einer Rundreise und waren auf dem Weg Kandy und dann weiter nach Nuwara Eliya zu besuchen. Wir buchten das Hotel weil es als eines der besten bewertet wurde. Das Problem ist, dass das Hotel in den Bergen ist und man von Kandy
jeweils eine Stunde mit dem Auto dahin fahren muss und am morgen wieder 1 Stunde nach Kandy zurück und so weiter. Das Hotel ist eine Ruheoase mit Yoga, SPA und vielem mehr. Wenn man also mehrere Tage das geniessen will ok. Wenn man aber dies
als Duchreise Hotel wie wir betrachtet, dann ist das mit den hunderten von Kurven nicht zu empfehlen. Pool, Wellness, SPA, Yoga etc. sicher alles OK. Das Restaurant geht persönlich auf einem ein, viele verschiedene Gewürze und Kräuter, meistens doch etwas scharf. Man isst bei jeder Mahlzeit Barfuss, da man die Schuhe ausziehen muss. Die eher kleinen Bungalows mit 46 m2 inkl. Dusche, WC, Lavabo für ältere Menschen und dem eingepackten Moskitonetz, eher nicht so geeignet.  Jedoch muss jeder selber wissen was er möchte.
title: SPA, Wellness, YOGA ja, Durchgangstouristen eher nein

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: Wir waren für 10 Tage im Santani und haben eine Ayurvedakur gemacht. Wer auf der Suche nach zurückhaltendem Luxus und absoluter Ruhe ist, muss dieses Hotel erlebt haben! Es gibt eigentlich nichts, was wir als negativ bewerten würden. Besonders hervorzuheben ist aber die gesamte Staff. Die Freundlichkeit und der Wille dem Gast eine angenehme Zeit zu bieten, sucht seinesgleichen. Danke dem ganzen Küchenteam, welches quasi für jeden Gast persönlich kocht! Den vier tollen Jungs im Service, den Ärztinnen, dem Massageteam (Pradeep hat doch tatsächlich meine langjährigen Schulterprobleme behoben), dem so kompetenten Yoga- und Meditationslehrer, dem super Wanderguide und all den vielen netten Männer, die fast rund um die Uhr die Anlage vom Junglelaub befreien. Wahrlich ein Ort, um sich zu erholen!
title: Top Adresse für Ruhe und Erholung

placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: The first thing you need to know about this   Hotel is the Google Map directions don’t take you to the hotel. They’ll take you to a spot 3km short of the hotel, just keep going. But when you do find it, it’s impressive with views to match. We stayed for 2 nights full board in September. Full board includes breakfast, 3 course lunch, small afternoon tea and 4 course dinner. The food was all to a good standard with service excellent. Included with our 2 night stay was the ‘leaf to cup’ tea experience and a walk to a waterfall. The leaf to cup experience was fantastic, explaining exactly how tea is picked and turned into the drink we know and love. The walk to the waterfall through the tea fields was great too. This hotel is a little off the beaten track but well worth a visit.
title: Great hotel, great experience

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
roomTip: Be Aware that there is a light sound ambiance from the washroom
text:
It had an amazing view, and it is based around a couple of mountains, so it gets darker earlier, and it was a super view from the room, Our room was in the Periya Dorei wing and just outside the room the door to the swimming pool is to the right.

The first day they first took us to pick tea leaves and after that they showed us the whole tea factory process and took us free, then they took us to a trek to a waterfall free (if we want to go vehicle, they charge us (I don't mind that)) and for free they gave us a high tea.
The view was superb and on our check-out day the wind was extreme so that if we put our hands out and we run, the wind makes such a noise I'm sure I can't even hear a dozen loudspeakers.
It was disappointing that there was no TV but the view made up to it even more.
Grand and Tasty food. Too fair for the prize.
title: Super View, Super Hotel, Super Food, all Five Star

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your detailed and heartfelt feedback! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed the scenic journey, the charm of the renovated tea factory, and the peaceful ambiance of our hotel. placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
Incredible ride to this hotel in a local party bus ! Local road so narrow ,winding and hard cornering for small bus.
This added to our wonderful experience.  
Small villages , flower and vegetable gardens, incredible scenery to view  if you were game to look out bus window! 
Stepping out on arrival, it's like you are transported back in time.
Magnificent scenery, incredible gardens , cool crisp air, and a wonderful welcome by staff.
My understanding is that the old tea factory has recently been renovated. 
This has been done by maintaining the old structures and even some of the equipment still in rooms.
I was delighted with a ground floor room in which I was able to open the windows and allow the fresh air in and gave me views of the misty valleys and beautiful gardens.
The room clean and comfortable.  Loved going to sleep on a comfortable bed with mosquito netting ..felt so regal.
No TV in room..ahhh bliss.
Rooms are not soundproofed, but honestly, I think this was part of maintaining the old tea factory charm.
This is a place for peace and quiet..
Walks , tea collecting, and production tours are available and are great.
The staff are incredibly friendly and professional .
The food and meals great variety. 
We had buffet style, which was possibly different to usual as we were a tour group.
I absolutely loved my stay here and am planning on returning so that my partner can experience this incredible location.
title: Incredible location.

roomTip: Avoid sunny season,recommend to travel during their season
text:
We had a great stay at Tea and Experience Factory to celebrate our 05th Wedding Anniversary.I must say that the staff from top level to the bottom are realy professional friendly and supportive.We experienced a hike to a beautiful waterfall called Kabaragala waterfall which lied through a scenic route filled with natural beauty.We were guidw by a well educated experienced young naturalist,he has a good knowledge about the nature and lot of animals and he shared them with us all along the journey.I must also say about the food,they are delicious,hyginicy prepared and I must thank you to the team for arranging am adorable table and bed decoration for our anniversary.The location of the property is peaceful,calm and realy beautiful.Anyone who lovea to stay peacefuly looking at a misty mountain and feel the blisfil wind,this the right place! Earlier this was the famous Kabaralagala tea factory,they demonstrate how a tea factory operate from leaf to the cup.That was very informative we would like to thank you the all staff and the Thema group for maintaining such a good quality and the hospitality irrespective of that we are locals.I highly recommemd this place anyone and we will definitly visit here not again but many times.
Also would like to recommend to visit here during its season.
Please keep up the same good quality and the hospitality in future too!
Love, Anuradha & Shiran
title: Unforgettable experience in the middle of a tea estate surrounde by a misty mountain.

text: Super experience (car c'est une expérience !). Au bout d'une route parfois cahotique, une ancienne usine de thé rénovée avec gout. Une équipe d'employés aux petits soins du matin au soir, digne des plus grands palaces. Une restauration de bonne qualité également meme si ce n'est pas la plus authentique. Et bien sûr un cadre assez incroyable avec ces plantations de thé tout autour de l'hôtel. Évidemment un bâtiment de cette age réserve quelques surprises et la pluie et le vent ont été très présents lors de notre séjour, mais cela fait partie de l'expérience !
title: Une expérience au bout de la route

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: Fantastic experience at this unique location! The hotel, converted from a historic tea factory, provides a warm welcome in the traditional Tamil style. The rooms are comfortable, though not soundproof, possibly to preserve the charming aroma of the old tea factory. The food was delicious and served as a set menu. The staff were incredibly helpful. There was an informative demonstration of the tea-making process, including the opportunity to pluck tea leaves firsthand. Highly recommend this exceptional place for an unforgettable stay!
title: Tea Factory Mandaramnuwara

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your kind words! We're thrilled to hear that you appreciated the transformation of our hotel from an old tea factory into a fine establishment. It's wonderful to know that you enjoyed our well-designed rooms and the picturesque view of the hillside filled with tea plants from our swimming pool.

We're delighted that you found our hotel worth staying for more than one night to relax and soak in the beautiful scenery. Our kitchen team will be pleased to hear that you found their offerings delightful.

We truly appreciate your compliments and hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another relaxing stay in the future!

Thank you.

Regards
Buddhika Kohona
Resort Manager
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: Compliments to the owners of this hotel. With so much love for Sri Lanka and it's history in tea  they transformed this old tea factory in a fine hotel, with well designed rooms. And a nice swimmingpool with a view on the hillside, crowded with teaplants. Worth a stay for more than one night to relax and enjoy the scenery. The kitchen offers you enough delight too!
title: A pleasure to stay

ownerResponse/text:

text: Desde el té de acogida hasta el momento de marcharnos nos hicieron sentir especiales. Un hotel de 5 estrellas sin perder la esencia de lo que fue, una antigua fábrica de té. Los empleados atentos de todo, silencio que te rodea y te invita a la desconexión y un té delicioso.
title: Un lugar de película rodeado de campos de té

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your glowing review! We're delighted to hear that you had a wonderful experience during your stay with us. It's fantastic to know that you found everything to be perfect, from the cleanliness and comfort of your room to the quality of our meals and the attentive service provided by our staff.

We're thrilled that you enjoyed our swimming pool at this altitude, and we're glad that you found the tea-picking and factory visit to be interesting experiences. Our guided walk to the waterfall sounds like it left a lasting impression, and we're grateful for your kind words about our passionate and engaging guide.

It warms our hearts to hear about the strong emotions you felt while crossing the villages and encountering the smiling faces of the locals. Despite life's challenges, their resilience and positivity shine through, adding to the beauty of our surroundings.

We're honored to have been a part of your unforgettable stay and hope to welcome you back for more fabulous moments in our serene and soothing setting

Thank you.

Regards

Buddhika Kohona
Resort Manager
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: Une expérience merveilleuse dans cet hôtel où tout fut parfait . La propreté et le confort de la chambre ,  la qualité des repas , le personnel attentionné ont contribué à rendre notre séjour inoubliable . La piscine à cette altitude fut très appréciable . La cueillette du thé et la visite de l’usine sont très intéressantes tout comme la balade jusqu’à la chute d’eau avec un guide passionné et passionnant ! De vives émotions en traversant les villages où vivent des gens toujours souriants malgré une vie difficile ….Moment fabuleux dans un cadre serein et apaisant par la beauté des paysages !
title: Expérience inoubliable

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We're thrilled to hear that you had an unforgettable stay among the tea fields. Our site is indeed exceptional and designed to offer a relaxing ambiance, surrounded by the beauty of nature. We're delighted that you enjoyed the picturesque journey along the road winding through the tea fields to reach us.

It's wonderful to know that you appreciated the tasteful renovation of our old tea factory, which retains its authenticity while offering modern comforts. Experiencing tea picking and making is a unique activity we're proud to provide to our guests.

We're glad you found our rooms spacious and pleasant, and that our staff took great care of you with their warm hospitality. Our infinity pool overlooking the tea fields offers a perfect spot to unwind, especially after the warmth of Sigiriya.

We're delighted that you enjoyed the tea and snack offered at 5 p.m., as well as our perfect catering services, including the flavorsome Sri Lankan breakfast. The walk to the waterfall sounds like a picturesque journey, and we're glad you enjoyed crossing the tea fields and receiving warm greetings from the villagers.

Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another memorable experience in the future!

Thank you.

Regards

Buddhika Kohona
Resort Manager
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
nous avons passé un séjour inoubliable parmi les champs de thé . Le site est exceptionnel et très reposant . la route pour y accéder est très pittoresque, elle sillonne parmi les champs de thé, de culture et de cocotiers.
nous avons passé deux nuits dans cette ancienne usine de thé rénovée avec beaucoup de gout tout en conservant son authenticité. Nous avons pu faire l'expérience de la cueillette du thé et sa fabrication. 
les chambres sont spacieuses et très agréables, le personnel est au petit soin pour nous et très chaleureux  . la piscine à débordement avec la vue sur les champs de thé est parfaite et sa fraicheur relative est appréciable après les chaleurs de Sigiriya. A 17 h une petite collation est proposée avec un thé d'un gout inoubliable. La restauration proposée est parfaite et nous avons pu gouter au petit déjeuner Sri Lankais un peu épicé .
la ballade jusqu'à la cascade est très pittoresque car nous traversons des champs de thé à pied et un petit village ou tous les habitants nous saluent avec leurs sourires chaleureux.
title: ce séjour restera parmi nos plus beaux souvenirs du Sri Lanka.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest.
                Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you found our hotel to offer exceptional comfort, stunning scenery, and top-notch service. While the swimming pool may be a bit cool due to the altitude, we're glad it didn't detract from your overall experience. 
               The history of our place's reconversion and the unique leaf-to-cup experience are indeed highlights that we're proud to offer. The view of the primary forest adds an extra layer of beauty to your stay. It's heartwarming to know that your time here has left such a lasting memory, capturing the essence of this beautiful region of Sri Lanka. 
              We hope to welcome you back soon.
Thank you

Regards

Buddhika Kohona
Resort Manager
placeInfo/address: Kabaragalla Estate, Mandaramnuwara 20742 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
Il y a peu d'hôtels au Sri Lanka qui ont une telle qualité en termes de confort, de paysages et de service, même si la piscine est un peu fraîche à cause de l'altitude.

Et si on ajoute l'histoire de la reconversion du lieu, le leaf to tea experience unique, la vue sur la forêt primaire, on garde un souvenir très durable de ce moment passé au bout du monde qui résume à lui seul cette belle région du Sri Lanka.
title: Un hôtel ? Non une expérience

text:
My wife & I stayed for 1 night on route from the Maldives to Australia.
We had a lovely morning swim in the pool then a very pleasant breakfast on the restaurant verandah overlooking the pool & gardens.
The very delightful & friendly pastry chef Noyel Karunarathne chatted to us about our travels & the cricket, of course!
Noyel presented us with a Bonvoyage coffee cake which was a lovely departure thought which we enjoyed.
What a lovely way to end our travels in Sri Lanka, South West India & the Maldives.
We will be back.
Farewell for now & special thanks to Noyel
title: Noyel's special farewell cake, Vivante Colombo Airport Garden hotel

The rooms were clean and nice, the gym was pretty good compared to other hotel it had free weights and machines but what the best part of this hotel was the people.

I really love Sri Lankan hospitality.

Also if anyone goes there they have to try the buffets which is affordable and the food there is delicious! Something I keep looking forward to everytime I stay with them.

I went for the Morning Buffet, for my Birthday with friends...
we  were welcomed in a friendly way with a smile on there faces, very fresh and clean and good aroma ambience, staff were also looking fresh n neat..the staff are really amazing i never felt this in any star Hotels..
really extraordinary, i have to mention there names, Chathuri, Dammika, Malisha lovely set, we didn't organize anything but they knew it's my bday and they got me a surprise cake, i was surprised, thank you to the Chef in charge on that day... i haven't experienced it anywhere. it's more than the price tag...
the buffet closes at 10:30 but they gave so much attention to 3 of us after closing, we felt like home. HOSPITALITY is Great... 101%....
Please keep it up, everywhere it's the importance for the Big money but here it's not.. Great job, lovely staff VIVANTA.. i have also been to the other restaurant as well in VIVANTA , my husband too, loves the ambience, STAFFs are well trained, mannered, groomed every time with a smile..  I LOVE THIS PLACE... You can ENJOY even family with kids also will enjoy, they have a cute play area...and great for candle light dinner also...

text:
We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for a birthday getaway with my husband, toddler, and baby, and it was absolutely wonderful. The staff here offer some of the best service and hospitality I’ve ever experienced.

A special shoutout to Duminda Gunasinghe, the Restaurant Manager, who went out of his way to prepare special meals for our baby with genuine enthusiasm and thoughtful suggestions. The buffet was incredible, with a wide variety of options including action stations, soups, salads, mains, hoppers, pancakes, waffles, and even an ice cream bar!

Our room was comfortable and conveniently located on the ground floor near the pool, just as we requested. They also provided a cozy cot for our baby, which was much appreciated. The pool was the perfect temperature, and the jacuzzi added a relaxing touch.

The hotel had daily activities for all ages > from kids’ painting and food carving to evening music and stage plays by the Animation Club. The staff involved were lovely and engaging.

I celebrated my birthday during our stay, and the team made it so special by singing for me and surprising me with a cake. It was such a heartfelt moment!

With two large pools and easy beach access, Heritance Ahungalla is a perfect spot for rest and relaxation. We’ll definitely be returning!
title: Perfect Family Getaway with Exceptional Hospitality

ownerResponse/text: Dear Sachini,…. What a joy it was to read your wonderfully detailed note. Your words capture so much of what Heritance Kandalama stands for, the architectural grandeur, harmony with nature, and thoughtful hospitality, all brought to life through the lens of your stay. Geoffrey Bawa’s vision has a way of casting its spell, and it’s clear it left its mark on you too. We're glad the panoramic view, the stillness of the lake, and even the gentle presence of the wildlife added to that sense of escape. Thank you for pointing out the subtle beauty of the hotel’s design and its on-point integration with the surroundings; it’s something we’re proud to preserve and share with our visitors. Sachini will be thrilled to hear your kind words. It’s lovely to know she helped make your husband’s birthday feel extra special. And we're delighted you took home a bit of Kandalama with you, our jams are a firm favorite with our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to share your experience in such a heartfelt way. We’d love to welcome you both back for another chapter, perhaps with more marmalade and new discoveries in store. Warm regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Heritance Kandalama is hands down one of the most pleasurable holiday getaway experiences we've ever had. This gigantic, magical architectural masterpiece, designed by the late Mr. Geoffrey Bawa, truly casts a spell on us. We find ourselves constantly dreaming of returning, especially when drowning in our busy schedules.

Perched next to the gorgeous Kandalama Lake, the structure seamlessly blends with nature, so much so that when viewed from the other side of the lake, it's virtually invisible, fully covered by lush vegetation. It's incredibly common to see wild animals roaming freely within the hotel grounds, reminding you that you're truly living in harmony within their natural habitat – so remember to be mindful and respectful of them.

Our 'Luxury Panoramic King' room, located on the 7th floor of the Dambulla wing (one of only three such rooms!), was incredibly spacious and offered a truly splendid view over the Kandalama Lake.

As always, the food was excellent and absolutely delicious, with a terrific spread for every meal. I made sure to pick up their homemade jam and marmalade as I always love to bring a taste of Heritance Kandalama home with me!

The staff were consistently amazing and super helpful. A special kudos goes to Sachini for being incredibly attentive and helping me arrange all the wonderful surprises for my husband’s birthday.

Lastly, don't forget to inquire about the various expeditions they have to offer, such as cultural tours to nearby historical sites or nature walks – they truly enhance the overall experience!
title: The enchanting spell of Heritance Kandalama

ownerResponse/text: Dear Bigtybo,…. It’s a pleasure to hear you had such a good experience at Heritance Kandalama. We look forward to welcoming you back for another peaceful getaway. Warm regards, General Manager

ownerResponse/text: Dear Sharm77,… We’re truly glad to hear how much you enjoyed your time with us. It sounds like your stay was filled with just the kind of peace and charm our surroundings are meant to offer, from the gentle rhythm of nature to the occasional curious monkey peeking in. Your kind words about the suite, the views, and especially the warm service from our team warm our hearts. We're pleased that the culinary variety, the pools, and even the gym ticked all the boxes for you. And yes, that sunset over the lake, especially with an elephant sighting, is the kind of moment you can’t quite plan but feel lucky to witness. We’re especially touched that you remembered our oriental band from 2006; it’s a rare and special thing when music from the past meets the present in such a heartfelt way. Thank you for choosing to return after all these years. We're looking forward to welcoming you again, and this time, for an even longer stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Infinity pool at sunset is the best
text:
We stayed for two nights in a suite and had a very relaxing and enjoyable holiday in this wonderful hotel surrounded by and literally immersed in nature. Check in was very quick and smooth, valet parking is very efficient, suite was spacious and very well maintained with a lovely big bathroom; it was a new experience to shower with curious monkeys looking in! Bed was super comfy and we enjoyed the views of the mountains and lake from all sides, sipping a coffee on the balcony watching birds, squirrels and monkeys in the morning. 
Food was absolutely fantastic, massive spread with great variety and very tasty at all 3 meals. Service was excellent, staff is attentive, courteous and very professional. Gym is very well equipped and the gym trainer is excellent. Pools were lovely, I specially enjoyed the infinity pool overlooking the lake at sunset - saw a majestic elephant drinking water at the lake one evening which was an added bonus. 
Best part of our holiday was the live entertainment. A wonderful traditional dance performance by very talented hotel staff, live band playing some great local tunes, and a lone flute player playing hauntingly beautiful melodies at sunset on the rocks overlooking the pools. The best entertainers were an amazingly talented, unforgettable oriental band and vocalist playing vintage Sinhala songs in the lobby bar one morning - same group that played in 2006 when we were last at this lovely hotel! The overall vibe of the hotel with lots of greenery, boulders and monkeys is very calm and soothing. We had an unforgettable holiday and will be back for a longer stay.
title: Relaxing holiday immersed in nature

ownerResponse/text: Dear Neo ….. It was a real pleasure meeting you and your wonderful family. ownerResponse/text: Dear Odyssey44399166402, …..Reading your review brings such a familial and warm feeling to all of us at Heritance Kandalama. It’s always a joy to be part of someone’s special celebration, and we're so pleased to hear your husband's birthday turned out to be a happy surprise, even for the rest of the family. Apsara was truly touched to be mentioned, and we’ll be sure to pass along your kind words to the young chef at the fried rice corner and our night watchman, he’ll be glad to know your children listened to his stories with such wide-eyed curiosity. The view of Pidurangala and Sigiriya has its own charm, but it's lovely to know that the personal touches during your stay made it more than just about the scenery. And yes, our long-time furry residents—the monkeys—certainly keep things interesting! text:
I was there with my family & four other families to celebrate my husband 's birthday (May 30) & hotel has decorated the room nicely & even prepared a surprise cake for him which was a total surprise even for us. Thank you Apsara for making our stay a  memorable one. 
Not only the scenic view of Pidurangala & Sigiriya & the tasty food but the stories told by the night watchman( sorry for not knowing his name) at second floor for my kids also made the stay memorable.
