I always wondered why all the people gush over this hotel but now I know . I will be definitely there for another celebration.

PS. Don't let anything in the balcony as monkeys tried to steal my kids wet swimwear.
title: Memorable Kandalama Escape

ownerResponse/text: Dear emel49,….We're delighted you enjoyed your time with us, especially the jungle setting and that iconic infinity pool; it's certainly one of the hotel’s most loved features. It's wonderful to know you appreciated the breakfast spread and those wide, open views towards Sigiriya. For a hotel that's approaching three decades, Heritance Kandalama has aged rather gracefully, retaining the old elegance. As for our ever-curious neighbours, the monkeys do have a habit of helping themselves to anything left unattended, part of the charm and challenge of living so close to nature. Being mindful of this fact, we leave gentle reminders to be cautious. We’re glad you made the most of the in-house dining, and we hope the peaceful seclusion added to the experience rather than limiting it. We’d love to welcome you back for another visit. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take care to take your belongings…it can be a long walk from your room to the restaurant or pool.
text: An amazing hotel set in the jungle with one of the most spectacular pools anywhere. Buffet breakfast was amazing, rooms spacious and comfy with outlooks over the valley and out towards Sigyria in the distance. It’s hard to believe this place is nearly 30 years old. The only problem was that the monkeys can be a bit problematic…they don't bother anyone but nothing can be left lying around on the balconies. Small price to pay for being surrounded by nature. It’s very isolated so don’t plan on eating at nearby restaurants…there aren’t any but there are lots of options at the hotel from snacks to full meals.
title: A gem in the jungle

ownerResponse/text: Dear Kasun,…Thank you for sharing your thoughts on your stay at Heritance Kandalama. It’s a pleasure to hear that the blend of architecture and nature created an experience that stood out to you. We’re glad the peaceful surroundings offered the kind of escape you were seeking. This architectural masterpiece stays true to its vision in creating spaces that pay tribute to their natural setting. We’re delighted you felt the depth of that connection during your time with us. We truly appreciate your recommendation, and we’d be delighted to welcome you back anytime you feel like revisiting that sense of calm and wonder. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Heritance Kandalama is more than just a hotel; it's an experience. It's a place where architecture and nature intertwine to create something truly special. It's a perfect destination for those seeking a tranquil escape, a chance to connect with nature, and a unique and unforgettable travel experience.

Highly recommended!
title: Stay at Heritance Kandalama

ownerResponse/text: Dear Katergir1…...We’re delighted to hear that your honeymoon stay with us turned into such a memorable chapter. Waking up to those views is indeed something special, and it’s wonderful to know you were able to enjoy that each morning. We're equally glad our team added to the warmth of your experience, and that you made the most of the distinctive experiences we offer, from dining in a cave to breakfast by the lake. These moments are designed to feel personal, and we're so pleased they struck the right chord. We’re truly grateful for your kind recommendation and would love to welcome you both back one day for more of the same magic. Warm Regards,  General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Visit the spa. The prices are average, but the quality and service is absolutely amazing…
text: This place is incredible. What a unique yet wonderful experience. My partner and I are here for our honeymoon and it was the best experience we could have ever hoped for. The views are INCREDIBLE. The room came with a view, so we got to wake up to it every morning.  Along with that, the staff is 5 stars. So accommodating. There are also a lot of really unique activities you can book through the hotel too, like a private cave dining experience or breakfast on the lake. 10/10 would recommend.
title: What an incredible place with an incredible view

ownerResponse/text: Dear Matt,….Short and straight to the point , and we love it. Thank you for the kind words. We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay, from the stunning views to the care shown by our team. The setting truly is one of a kind, and it’s wonderful to hear it left a lasting impression. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another visit. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Incredible Stay. Great Staff. Special Hotel built into the side of a mountain with incredible views. Can recommend booking here. 

Incredible Stay. Great Staff. Special Hotel built into the side of a mountain with incredible views. Can recommend booking here.
title: Can recommend.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Travelgirl0983, ….Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to share your experience. It’s truly rewarding to hear that your time at Heritance Kandalama was so enjoyable, from the warm hospitality extended by our team to the distinct charm of the hotel itself. We're especially pleased to know the culinary moments crafted by our Executive Chef stood out as a highlight during your visit. We’re grateful for your kind words and delighted that your stay left you with fond memories. We look forward to welcoming you back for another enriching escape. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: We spent two nights at the Heritance and we had an amazing experience. The staff were kind and attentive. The hotel is an experience in itself. The culinary experience with their executive chef was fantastic. What a wonderfully unique hotel and experience!
title: A unique experience

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest,…. It’s truly special to welcome someone back after three decades, and even more so to know that your return to Heritance Kandalama lived up to your memories. The way you've described the harmony between nature, comfort, and service captures exactly what we strive to offer. We’re especially glad our team at the main restaurant could cater to your dietary needs and still deliver a dessert that stood out during your travels. Thank you for your heartfelt words. It means a great deal to us that, even after many visits to Sri Lanka, you found something distinct and worthwhile here. We hope you’ll return again, much sooner this time. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The monkeys are most active early in the morning, other than that they generally leave you in peace (as long as you don't have food!) A good base to visit Sigirya
text: This was my second visit to Kandalama after 30 years and the hotel still delivers on unique experience and service. The integration with nature gives you an experience not to be missed while still maintaining that luxury hotel feel and with the friendly service known for in Sri Lanka. The main restaurant was able to cater for my gluten intolerance including one of the tastiest Gluten free desserts I have had in the two week trip. Even if you have been to Sri Lanka multiple times you are missing out if you haven't visited this hotel.
title: Unique experience in a beautiful country

ownerResponse/text: Dear Shane …Thank you for sharing such a genuine and memorable account of your stay with us. It means a great deal to know that Heritance Kandalama stood out as a highlight during your 19-day journey, especially for travelers who usually prefer to venture out rather than stay in. We’re glad you had the time to connect with the setting, from the early-morning wildlife encounters to the quiet moments overlooking the forested slope. The monkey-at-the-window story gave us a smile, those little surprises are part of what makes this place so alive. Thank you also for the practical tip about the balcony, advice future guests will surely appreciate. We hope your travels bring you this way again, we’d be happy to welcome you back. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Cafe does great food, keep you balcony door locked leave nothing outside even to dry.
text:
We are not resort people prefer to get out and about and mix it with the locals, when not part of a package we generally eat very few meals at our resort/hotel. 

Heritance is a destination hotel it was the one time in a 19 day tour we wished we had more time in the resort. I won't go into all the details about the place it is well documented, one of the things we really enjoyed was the wild life Monkeys and Birds at our backdoor especially in the morning. All rooms look out and are private we were lucky to be looking out to a bush covered slope full of wildlife. Not really a bucket list moment but sitting in the bathroom doing your morning business with a monkey 20 feet away looking at you is probably a once in a life time experience.

If you do stay here allow time to enjoy the resort great views, great wildlife, lovely infinity pool right next to a great little cafe and bar. Hint keep your balcony door locked and don't leave anything outside not even clothes to dry.
title: A Destination Hotel allow time to enjoy it.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest,…. Thank you for taking the time to share such detailed feedback following your recent stay with us. We're pleased to know that you enjoyed the setting, the comfort of the rooms, and the genuine hospitality of our team. It’s also lovely to hear that your experience at the open-air café added a special highlight to your stay. We’re truly sorry to hear that the breakfast buffet and à la carte dining arrangement upstairs fell short of your expectations. Your comments have been shared with our culinary team for review, as it’s important that both quality and atmosphere align with the experience we aim to offer. We also appreciate your feedback on the room's electrical setup. We're glad our team could assist with the needed ports for your devices during your stay. We recognize how essential accessible charging points are for modern travelers, and as you mentioned, we are actively addressing the maintenance and updates in some of our rooms. Thank you once again for your recommendation. It would be a pleasure to welcome you back in the future, perhaps with more time to relax and enjoy the pools and surroundings at your own pace. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Heritance Kandalama for two nights and overall had a lovely experience. 

The hotel itself is stunning, blending seamlessly with nature, views, elephants and rocks. Rooms were good size, comfy bed and lovely bathroom.

The staff were helpful and courteous throughout our stay. 

Unfortunately the breakfast buffet was not good, 2 mornings the chicken curry not cooked properly.  The al-la carte dinner was mixed in with the buffet people, worst situation, horrible atmosphere  and the meals the smallest we have seen.  My husband was very hungry after the meal.

We decided on the second night to eat at the open air cafe and this was such a blessing.  Ambience perfect, food delicious and the food was top-notch with plenty of variety and excellent taste. So much better than upstairs.

We did face an very important issue during our stay.  There are no usb ports or spare electrical outlets anywhere in the rooms. We had to unplug a bedside lamp only to find our convertor was too large as the outlets were right on the floor, so usb cables could not be plugged in.  Contacted staff and they immediately bought us a special box to plug our cables into, which was appreciated.  Next morning senior management confirmed not all rooms had been renovated and they were a number of these rooms with the same issue. So beware if you are in one of those rooms.

The views were amazing from the hotel, we got to see the pools but because we were on tour and not at hotel until late each night we were unable to utilize them.

This hotel was one of the better ones of our tour. Recommended.
title: A view o Sigiriya rock fortress.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Avinath94,…. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We're glad to hear you enjoyed the tranquil setting, the architecture, and the hospitality extended by our team. It's wonderful that the food and overall atmosphere added to the charm of your stay. We’re truly sorry for the discomfort caused by the room temperature and appreciate your understanding regarding the limitations of the central AC system during your visit. We'll certainly be looking into the performance of the cooling system in both the rooms and the Kanchana Lounge to ensure it meets guest expectations, regardless of occupancy. We’d love to welcome you back again, and next time, we’ll do our best to make sure your stay is comfortable in every way. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Heritance Kandalama for two nights and overall had a lovely experience. The hotel itself is stunning, blending seamlessly with nature, and the location is absolutely superb—perfect for a peaceful, scenic getaway. The staff were helpful and courteous throughout our stay, and the food was top-notch with plenty of variety and excellent taste.

However, we did face some discomfort during our stay due to the air conditioning in our room. It was a particularly hot season, and the AC was fixed at 28°C, which made the room quite warm and uncomfortable. Although the staff made efforts to resolve the issue, they couldn’t do much as it’s part of a central AC system.

Additionally, we noticed that common areas such as the Kanchana Lounge didn’t seem to be air-conditioned either—possibly due to low occupancy during this period—but it did make the heat a bit more noticeable.

Despite the AC issues, the hotel delivered in terms of service, food, and ambiance. With a few adjustments to the cooling system, this could easily be a 5-star stay.
title: Beautiful Property with Great Service

ownerResponse/text: Dear Yug Chaudhry,….. Thank you for returning to Heritance Kandalama and for sharing such a heartfelt account of your recent stay. It was truly a pleasure to welcome you and your group back, and we're grateful that your trust in us brought you here once again. Your words about Geoffrey Bawa’s design capture what so many of us admire about this place: the harmony between architecture and nature and the quiet brilliance in how each space reveals itself. We're glad the setting continues to offer you something new and meaningful with each visit. We’re especially touched by your recognition of our team. Mr. Thalin Malinda, Mr. Sarath, and Mr. Nalinda will be genuinely pleased to know their efforts made a difference. The situation involving your friend’s heart pump was indeed extraordinary, and we’re relieved that she was safe. Mr. Gamini’s quick action speaks to the kind of care we aim to provide, not only as hoteliers but as fellow human beings looking out for one another. Your generous words and your “award” mean more than we can say. It would be an honour to welcome you and your loved ones back on your next journey to our shores. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
I had stayed at Heritance Kandalama with my wife and friends a year ago and we had had a very special time. Because of our past experience I returned this year with my friends and family in a large group of 16 persons of whom 6 are over 70 years of age.

The design by Geoffrey Bawa is sheer genius. The unobtrusive presence of the hotel on the landscape and its apparent merger with its surroundings, it’s beautifully ventilated corridors and strategically positioned rooms along with its magnificently framed views make each visit more rewarding and revelatory than the last.

The service, the rooms and the food were as outstanding as ever. We were a large group with different dietary requirements and preferences, and the hotel took care to cater to each one of us individually. Not only this, the pasty chef Mr Thalin Malinda and the dining room manager Mr Sarath organised cakes to celebrate the birthdays of members of our group. The hotel tour by the naturalist and in-house hotel historian Mr Nalinda should not be missed. 

However, there is one incident which now endears this hotel to us even more and shows its special character. While on elephant safari over an hour away from the hotel a member of our party who has an external heart pump suddenly realised that she had only 40 minutes of battery life left and had forgotten her spare battery in her hotel room and without which she could not survive.

While she rushed from the elephant reserve to the hotel, the hotel manager Mr Gamini took the battery from her room and drove in his personal vehicle to meet the patient half-way and they managed to replace the depleted battery in the very nick of time even after the beeping had already begun.
This was service over and beyond the call of duty or any expectation we could’ve had!

If I could bestow this hotel the *best hotel in the world award* I would.

Yug Chaudhry
title: The Best Hotel in the World

ownerResponse/text: Dear olivia2127,…. What a delight it was to read your feedback. Thank you for choosing Heritance Kandalama as the venue for such a wonderful and memorable occasion. Our team had the pleasure of putting together an event that not only celebrated the union of two amazing individuals but also brought joy to everyone who shared in this auspicious time. We’re over the moon to know that everything unfolded just as you envisioned and that you left with such fond memories. Our hotel is truly blessed with the beauty and life of nature; what better backdrop to begin a new chapter together? It brings us great pride to know that Heritance Kandalama will always hold a cherished place in your heart when you look back on this special day. Thank you, from all of us, for your heartfelt words and the lovely recommendation. We hope you’ll have many more exciting moments to share with us in the future; we’d be happy to turn your thoughts and dreams into reality once again. Warmest Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We had the most incredible experience hosting our wedding at Heritance Kandalama. From the very beginning - planning everything a year in advance from abroad - the team was kind, responsive, and extremely professional. They helped us organize room blocks for our guests, finalize the venues and menus, and thoughtfully plan details for the wedding day.

Most of our guests stayed at the hotel for the week leading up to the wedding day, and it was truly a serene, one-of-a-kind setting that allowed everyone to relax and enjoy the natural beauty of Sri Lanka. The staff showed an exceptional level of care and hospitality the entire week - we’ve never experienced anything like it.

On the day of the wedding, everything went perfectly. The timeline was smooth, the logistics were seamless, and we felt fully supported from start to finish. We were able to truly be present and enjoy every moment.

We couldn’t be more grateful to the team for the experience they gave us as a couple and for the beautiful memories they helped create for all our guests. Highly recommend this venue to anyone looking for a meaningful, well-executed wedding experience.

Photos by Kēndhra Weddings.
title: Unforgettable Destination Wedding Experience with Exceptional Service in a Breathtaking Setting

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful time at Villa Rosa. The staff were so attentive and welcoming. The chef kindly took us out to the market with him to collect produce for our evening meal. This was a fantastic experience to see the local market and eat the fresh food in the evening. The Sri Lankan meal he prepared was one of the best meals we ate during our trip! Thank you to the team and of course Carl and Carly (the friendly resident dogs!) for their entertainment.
title: The place to stay in Kandy!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Family of four with two kids, 12 + 8.

We stayed here for one night, however within two minutes of checking in we wished we’d booked for longer. This place is breathtaking - the view out across the pool looking down onto the river below is absolutely unreal, a picture can’t do it justice. This is a small boutique hotel run by a lovely owner. It’s incredibly peaceful, somewhere to come and get away from it all. The food was incredible, and you can walk right into the kitchen and speak to the chef, even watch and learn how they prepare the food should you wish. Location wise it’s perched up in the hills above Kandy, a short drive down to the town - and perfect in that aspect as there’s much to do and see in Kandy. The hotel also offer a free Tuk Tuk service to take you down to town, you have to find you’re own way back up mind! This place made a huge impression on us. Highly recommended.
Family of four with two kids, 12 + 8.

We stayed here for one night, however within two minutes of checking in we wished we’d booked for longer. This place is breathtaking - the view out across the pool looking down onto the river below is absolutely unreal, a picture can’t do it justice. This is a small boutique hotel run by a lovely owner. It’s incredibly peaceful, somewhere to come and get away from it all. The food was incredible, and you can walk right into the kitchen and speak to the chef, even watch and learn how they prepare the food should you wish. Location wise it’s perched up in the hills above Kandy, a short drive down to the town - and perfect in that aspect as there’s much to do and see in Kandy. The hotel also offer a free Tuk Tuk service to take you down to town, you have to find you’re own way back up mind! This place made a huge impression on us. Highly recommended.
title: Breathtaking Views

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Die Villa Rosa liegt oberhalb von Kandy sehr ruhig. - Sehr freundlicher Empfang des deutschen Besitzers, der uns in alles einwies. - Großes Zimmer mit Balkon und Sitzmöglichkeiten. Sehr gepflegt und geschmackvoll eingerichtet. Sehr gute Betten, nicht zu weich. Gute Klimaanlage. Großes Bad mit viel Platz unter der Dusche. - Sehr gutes Frühstück, auf Wunsch auch Sri Lanka Style. Man sitzt sehr schön am Haus oder auf einer Terrasse mit Blick ins Tal und Fluss. Auch das Abendessen sagte uns zu. - Kleiner Infinitypool mit Blick ins Tal. Ca. 8 Liegen. - Der freundliche Besitzer zeigt uns auch noch einen Aussichtspunkt und wo wir in der Stadt gute Gewürze etc. kaufen konnten.
title: Ausgezeichneter Aufenthalt oberhalb von Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Es gibt auch Zimmer in einem Nebengebäude, diese haben vermutlich keine Aussicht. ggf danach fragen
text: Villa Rosa ist ein kleines Boutique Hotel, von einem Deutschen geführt, und liegt oberhalb der Stadt Kandy mit einer großartigen Aussicht. Im Rahmen einer Rundreise waren wir für 2 Nächte dort. Der Besitzer führt das Hotel mit einem eigenen Charme, hat z. B. eine offene Küche, wer möchte kann beim Kochen mal dabei sein oder auch beim Markteinkauf am morgen. Das Essen (wir haben Reis und Curry gegessen) war auch sehr gut. Das Hotel hat eine wirklich schöne Atmosphäre, das Haus vermutlich eine Vorgeschichte aus dem britischen Empire mit viel Charme. Unser Zimmer war groß, auch das Bad, wenn gleich manches einen "Shabby Chic" hatte, das hat aber nicht gestört. Wir haben uns dort sehr wohl gefühlt!
title: Boutique Hotel mit Charme und toller Aussicht.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Great spot in Kandy away from the Hustle and Bustle of Kandy city. Great views and very peaceful. Easily accessible by tuk tuk or car. We had 2 rooms over the course of a 3 nights stay due to a late check out and both rooms were excellent. First room was a little warm but would have been fine but the air-con was switched off during the room service which allowed it to warm up but nothing excessive. Great pool to cool off in and the food being breakfast and or dinner was first rate. Very helpful, friendly and attentive staff. I thought overall this was great value and would happily stay here again
title: Fantastic Location and value

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try to get a room in the old building
text: The location is beautiful with stunning views and serenity, much appreciated after busy downtown Kandy. The food was beautiful, both at breakfast and dinner. It turned out that the AC didn’t work in the room we were given, so the first night was hot and uncomfortable. The room we were moved to had an odd bathroom where the whole bathroom got wet when you had a shower. Also, the mosquito net around the bed did not have a top, which was quite bizarre. However, staff was lovely and everything else was great.
title: Beautiful location

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Would be hard to walk to and from town so be prepared to use Tuk tuks
text:
We are so delighted to have found Villa Rosa. Quite hard to find so make sure you’re driver has good instructions…once you get there it’s an oasis of tranquillity.
We received a warm welcome, a tour of the public areas and then were shown to our amazing room (number 3). Dual aspect widows, huge wrap around balcony and a tasteful interior with a great bathroom. The pool area and veranda are heavenly, with a view over the trees and distant city, hard to believe that you’re only a 10 minute Tuk Tuk drive from the business of Kandy. The staff were all so polite and professional, the breakfast was super, fruit and eggs with toast…and great coffee. We ate there one night, a beautiful vegetarian curry with choice of dessert.
We don’t hesitate to recommend Villa Rosa.
title: A sanctuary in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You need the services of a tuk tuk to take you out and bring you back. These are cheap and plentiful so never a problem.
text: A beautiful small hotel whose emphasis is on calm, tranquility and wellness. Kandy is a very busy town and coming back to the hotel sets you back to a relaxed being. Lovely food, home cooked, fresh and beautifully presented.  The staff are exceptional and hard working.  A lovely caring owner who is extremely informative.  The views from the pool are breathtaking. Highly recommend.
title: An Oasis of Calm

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: De ligging is prachtig, buiten het drukke centrum van Kandy. Met een fantastisch uitzicht. Wij hadden de kleinste kamer, maar die vonden wij ruim genoeg. Een bed, een zitje en kleine badkamer. Alles wat je nodig hebt. De infinity pool is geweldig, heerlijk afkoelen na een warme dag! Je kunt op verschillende plekken zitten om te ontbijten (inbegrepen) of te dineren (tegen betaling). Het hotel biedt een gratis service om je met een tuktuk naar het centrum van Kandy te brengen. Terug regel je zelf. Het hotel ligt boven op een berg en er is verder niks te doen in de omgeving vandaar dat deze gratis service prettig is. Het personeel is zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam!
title: Mooie en rustige ligging buiten het drukke centrum

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get directions as not easiest place to find
text: We were Relaxed within 2 mins of walking in after the chaos of a Kandy rush hour !. Incredible views both day and night from your room, sunbed, pool and dinner table. Chefs curry was as promised fantastic. It’s about 15/20 mins outside of the centre so if your planning on going in/out a lot perhaps not ideal, but if you’re spending a relaxing afternoon or evening after a busy day it’s perfect place to relax and swim. Staff as per everywhere else in Sri Lanka excellent and friendly.
title: Stunning views, curry and an ultimate chill

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We loved Family Suite no.4 with its wonderful views
text:
Villa Rosa hotel is a lovely colonial style house, with attractive communal areas including a library and gorgeous infinity pool with views over the river valley.  You feel right out in the peaceful countryside when staying there, even though Kandy itself is just a very short drive back down the hill behind.  It's in the perfect location, and so high up that the Brahminy kites and eagles are circling below you!
The property is accessed via an incredibly steep narrow but tarmac road, which our driver managed to traverse with baited breath!  The hotel also organised for a tuk tuk to pick us up one evening (offered to guests as a complementary service) so we could explore Kandy town and we found our own for the return journey, which cost about 1,000SLR (= £2.70).
We were allocated wonderful room 4 , which was huge, with double aspect windows with stunning views out over the valley and also with a long balcony down one side with seating, so it was lovely to sit out there with a drink at dusk.  Big bathroom too, with roll top style bath and powerful hot shower.  It was actually a family suite, with a separate twin room alongside which we didn't need for the 2 of us, so this was locked off from the main part of the suite when we were shown around.
Food was good - quite a short dinner menu but we opted for the Sri Lankan curry which was excellent - lots of little vegetable curry dishes alongside our choice of fish curry, and it was idyllic sitting looking over the valley whilst dining.    Breakfast options were a bit more limited at this hotel too, but still nice - either a curry with rotis or milk rice, or "English" which was eggs cooked as you wanted them plus toast and jam.
We'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a base in the Kandy area, and the infinity pool and loungers are the perfect place to cool off after exploring!
title: Idyllic peaceful boutique hotel - the perfect base to explore the Kandy area

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
What a beautiful building. The architecture is stunning and loved the use of wood throughout. The views from the terraces and our room were breathtaking. 
All staff were so polite and helpful, very eager to please. 
Our room was very spacious and the bed very comfortable. 
We were disappointed with the selection, portion sizes and presentation of the food at breakfast and dinner. After staying and eating in many similar standard accommodations we expected better.
title: Stunning Views

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: What a gem this place is. Just outside the hustle of Kandy, set on a hillside with amazing views over the river. The rooms very very large. Had ate breakfast and dinner here for the entire 3 days of our stay. The Sri Lankan dinners were excellent as were the breakfasts. The owner was very pleasant and offered us some local knowledge.
title: Hidden Gem near Kandy.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Stylish hotel with beautiful views of Kandy river.  Extremely comfortable bedrooms and communal areas.  From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel welcome and went above and beyond to make our stay truly wonderful.  The front of house manager, the chefs and all the other staff seemed genuinely proud of their hotel.  Its small size and comfortable communal areas enabled us to meet and have many interesting conversations with other guests from all around the world.  We would highly recommend this hotel and are hoping to return.
title: Quality boutique hotel with friendly, professional staff

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a lovely place tucked away on top of a hill. 
Peaceful & relaxing.
The view from the infinite swimming pool & sunset is beautiful.
Excellent food & service.
The rooms are spacious; however we didn’t have any tea/coffee making facilities in ours which was disappointing.
Bring some mosquito repellent !!!
Great location.
title: Excellent!!!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely, quiet hotel with amazing views over Kandy, great breakfasts (lots of choice), a free tuk-tuk into Kandy (but you will need to pay for the return journey, around 900 LSR) and, as everywhere in Sri Lanka (our experience, at least), wonderful, friendly and helpful staff. The ride up and down the steep hairpins is great. We loved our short stay here.
title: Lovely hotel, staff and views of Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Friendly, well-kept, unpretentious and very comfortable hotel, in a beautiful location with great views in two directions. It’s easy to get to and from the centre of town, but you still feel that you are tucked away in a quiet spot away from the busyness of the city. The owner and staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay, and the food is excellent.
title: Lovely hotel, great location.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Wir haben zwei Nächte in der Villa Rosa verbracht und würden jederzeit wiederkommen. Das Anwesen liegt in den Hügeln von Kandy und bietet einen wunderbaren Ausblick mit Pool auf die Stadt. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Volker, der deutsche Inhaber, ist ein hervorragender Gesprächspartner und weiss auf jede Frage die passende Antwort. Er tritt gerne mit den Gästen in Kontakt. Wir durften mit ihm eine kostenlose Stadtführung geniessen und einen seiner Mitarbeitenden an den Markt begleiten, wo alles Notwendige für das abendliche Curry eingekauft wurde. Das Essen wird frisch und mit Lebensmitteln von hoher Qualität zubereitet.
title: Juwel am Hang von Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We loved our stay at Villa Rosa. Stunning views and spacious comfortable rooms with everything you need, including a balcony to enjoy the surroundings. The team were friendly and the service exemplary. I would highly recommend eating dinner at the hotel. The best curry we have had in Sri Lanka so far.
title: A lovely stay

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a one night stay at Villa Rosa and loved it. The hotel is right on top of a hill with a sweeping view. The infinity pool was beautiful and a dip before breakfast was the perfect start to the day. The water did run a bit cool after a long shower, but soon heated up again. Very good food and service. cuddly dogs.
title: Breakfast with a view

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Mega schön mitten in der Natur am Ufer Rand am See , 5 Meter entfernt ... gemütliches Luxuszelt .. Klima Lautstärke nervt ein wenig aber man sieht darüber hinweg .. sehr gutes Essen ***** ein Paradies zum entspannen und erholen ... Personal ist sehr freundlich 👌🏼
title: Ein Paradies

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Bring the following 
Ear plugs 
Mosquitoes spay 
Comfortable shoes
text:
What can I say other than truly excellent!

We stayed for two nights towards the end of February and we were sad to leave.  I would not hesitate to recommend or return to Flameback.

We chose Flameback as it was a smaller hotel, and felt more local than the big hotel complexes nearby.  We also wanted to experience the Safari/tent accommodation. 

The resort has three wild dogs there, who mainly slept under the trees in the shade, but came and greeted guests with a friendly face, wagging their tails.  They were very friendly and we really enjoyed having them there, one even snoozed on our porch one morning. 

Staff and Service 
The team at Flameback made our staff memorable.  With only a small team we felt like we were part of the Flameback Family and they could not have done anything more for us. 

Ahead of our trip, correspondents with the hotel receptionist was quick and easy, she arranged transportation to and from the hotel plus our itinerary for the 2.5 days we were there ; this included two half day safari’s and a cooking demonstration with lunch. 

Upon our arrival we received a warm welcome, with a cool towel and welcome drink.  After a short initial look around the reserve we were taken to out tent, our bags were already there when we arrived. 

The hotel staff were just fabulous, each team member did their job exceptionally well and make us feel like special guests.  No requests was too much and the chef even kindly made me their Sri Lankan Prawn dish for dinner one even, which was outside of the set dinner menu. 

Our waiters were extremely personable and we looked forward to seeing them for breakfast and dinner.  

Our safari guide and driver were fabulous, incredible knowledgeable and also very respectful to the animals, not crowding around like other jeeps did! 

I can honestly say, the service we received and how the team treat their guests is exceptional!  You can tell they have so much pride in their jobs. 

Food
We ate at the resort each evening; there was a set menu for $20 and it was delicious!  

Breakfast was included and we received fresh fruit, fruit juice, coffee, pastries and a cooked opinion (many choices on offer). All was cooked well and tasted very good.  The chef came to introduce himself and check all was well, which was a nice touch. 

The food was excellent!  The setting for dinner was also lovely, lots of candles and soft music.  The perfect way to unwind at the end a busy day. 

Accommodation and amenities 
We stayed in one of the deluxe tents, which we really enjoyed. It was the perfect size and decorated tasteful, in keeping with the surroundings. 

-Each tent had a working toilet, air-con and shower with both hot and cold water! 
-The bed was very comfortable with nice pillows and lovely soft linen. 
-Towels, robes, hairdryer and toiletries were provided 
-there was amble space to hang or fold your clothes. 
-the tent also came with a secure safety deposit box and a lock and key. 
-Drinking water was provided daily, a nice and welcomed touch. 
-WiFi is provided for free and considering the remoteness of the location, it was very reliable. 
-There were two plug points, perfect for charging your phone. 
-the pool was refreshing, clean and fitting in well with the surroundings. 

Flameback offer a range of additional services and trips, all good value and well organised. They really have something for everyone. 

Overall we had a wonderful stay at Flameback and wholeheartedly thank the team for being so wonderful.  Please support this excellent oasis, rather than the big hotels in the area. 

Points to consider 
Bring ear plugs!  
The first night I found the air-con loud, plus the noises of nature can be intense when trying to sleep.  I had a disturbed sleep and was woken up by monkeys running across our tent. 
Thankfully my husband carried some spare ear plugs, these worked brilliantly and I had a wonderful nights sleep on the second night. 

As you are close to the lake, bring mosquitoes spray.  We didn’t have any issues with bites, but came prepared and covered ourselves in repellent daily. 

As Flameback is on a nature reserve, expect to see lots of birds, a couple of lizards, monkeys and even maybe a small snake on the grounds.   We also had some ants in our lodge mainly in the shower up the wall, but this didn’t affect our stay at all. 

None of the above would stop us recommending Flameback, but worth mentioning.
title: An oasis of calm and tranquility.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our first experience in a boutique type property in Sri Lanka and Flameback  Eco lodge was the best choice we made. It's next to the stunning Werawila lake which we had our first fishing experience. We were in their family suite.It was maticulasly clean and a beautiful property.Highly recommended.

The location is easily accessible from Colombo with a 3hr drive via Southern highway. The staff is freindly and courteous and went over and above, accommodating our requests.

You can do number of in-house activities including bonfire, dinner at the boat and fishing at lake Weerawila, birds watching etc. Our favourite  was fishing.Thanks Flameback for making our holiday memorable.
title: Nature at its best and friendly staff..

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book more than one night here. You won't be sorry!
text:
This place was so tranquil! Set amongst nature, surrounded by birdlife. The tents were very comfortable. The food was delicious 
Best service I have seen. Prompt  and nothing was too much trouble. Would have loved to stay longer and gone on their birdwalk.
title: Beautiful tranquil stay

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: A piece of paradise.  Just outstanding.  This was glamping at its best.  The food was outstanding and the staff so helpful.  We can not fault our time here and wished we spent another night here rather than in Ella.  I can highly recommend this experience if you want to get away from the normal hotel experience.

text: A nice location, on a lake surrounded by the noise of wildlife. The restaurant offers a good selection of Sri Lankan and western food dishes. The tent was very well equipped. Lovely hot shower and really quite chic. Lovely, helpful staff, we enjoyed our stay. Thank you

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: We had doubts about ‘glamping’ before we arrived, but needn’t have worried. Our tent was spacious and very well designed and equipped, in peaceful surroundings with a great view. We soon got used to all the zips when leaving the tent. There was a good pool with plenty of shaded sun loungers. Dinner the first night was rather disappointing as the Sri Lankan menu option was completely bland, but we explained that we eat lots of curries at home to  the waiters and the food was much better on the following evenings. We both had excellent massages in the spa here.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just go and enjoy the Oasis of calm...
text: What a fabulous find to stay at.  This is an amazing place to stay in a stunning set.  The tents are, in my opinion, beautiful and for something completely different to experience in Sri Lanka.  The staff are so welcoming and friendly and couldn't do enough for us.  The food was tasty, best sri Lankan chicken curry we have had during our time here.   Yala safari was arranged and our guide was great, very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.  Would highly recommend a stay here.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful time at this unique setting on the shores of the lake. The accommodation was really comfortable and the evening meal and breakfast were delicious. As it was my birthday the staff had gone to the trouble of decorating my bed with flower petals and had even made me a personalised cake! How kind of them! This is the perfect place to chill after a safari trip to Yala. A big thank you to Sanduni and his team for making our stay so enjoyable and unforgettable.
title: Peaceful lakeside retreat.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Ein toller Ort! Sehr weitläufig an einem See gelegen ist diese Anlage. Alle Zelte verfügen über einen Meerblick, Terrasse, natürlich Klimaanalge und sind alle überkomplett ausgestattet. Das Baden ist im Pool als auch im See möglich. Das nette Personal und das leckere Essen machen darüber hinaus den Aufenthalt perfekt. Idealer Ausgangspunkt für Safaris in die umliegenden Naturparks.
title: Absolut sehenswert!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: This is a small tented lodge situated next to a lake.  The tents are luxurious with air conditioning and a comfortable bathroom.  We selected it because of  its proximity to Bundala National Park and two of the less busy gates to Yala National Park.  We particularly liked the fact than after an early morning safari you could have breakfast "anytime".  The food itself was very good and the staff helpful.  The only downside is the occasional noise from the Hilton next door disturbing this tranquil place.   Fortunately it is not every day and when we were there ended by 4pm.
title: A great stay

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
We’d only booked one night here - a place to rest between travels - but it was so nice!

We could see lots of wildlife around the lodge, and I believe they offer a birdwatching walk too. The food was amazing in a beautiful little restaurant overlooking the lagoon.

The rooms didn’t look like much from the outside, but they were incredibly clean, and offered all needed amenities! Thank you!
title: Lovely little place - wish we’d stayed longer!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Hier wohnt man im sauberen Zelt mit Air-condition, super bequemem Luxusbett, Dusche und Toilette. Kleiderschränke und Schreibtisch sind ebenfalls vorhanden. Wir hatten einen wunderschönen Blick auf den See. Ein Pool mit Liegen zum Relaxen ist ebenfalls vorhanden. 
Das ist ist einfach,  aber geschmackvoll und man kann von der Speisekarte wählen. Das Personal ist wie überall in Sri Lanka super nett und zuvorkommend.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring loads of bug spray
text:
Little I can add to the fabulous reviews already on here 

Location superb - views lovely 
Food - top notch - excellent chef 
Staff really friendly with good English 
Once inside tent could be inside top class hotel room . 
Pool excellent and refreshing with great views over the lake 

They have addressed any potential noise issue ( see earlier comment) with ear plugs provided . 
I would say this wasn’t an issue at all when we stayed .

Lovely young man does free hour bird watching tour - suggest you go 5ish and also get some fabulous views of sunset over the lake .

Negatives - bugs ! Surely some natural big repellant could be used to enable guests to sit out in late afternoon
title: Excellent location . Some of best food in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They can also assist with any transfers / additional services that you require!
text:
We had the best time staying at Flameback Eco Lodge - the location is beautiful, the food amazing and the staff very friendly & helpful! 

We booked a full day safari and a half day (afternoon) across both national parks with Thushan and were extremely fortunate to see a leopard! The tent accommodation was very impressive, spotless, cool with A/C and immaculate. 

We will 100% be returning on our next trip to Sri Lanka!
title: Amazing place to stay!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take ear plugs and insect repellent!
text:
On first impressions we were very impressed with this Eco Lodge, where we based ourselves for 3 nights in order to visit Yala and Bundala National Parks.  Our African style safari tent (each named after birds - ours was Monarch) had everything we could wish for.  Amazing air con, great hot shower, comfy bed (though it was very hot even at night, so the duvet was a bit much and a sheet would have been better) and WiFi.  It also had its own deck and seating with views out over Weerawila lake which is a bird reserve, and there were always water birds on the lawn in front too.  
The two issues we had here were: 
a) Bug - mosquito type insects were literally swarming all the time immediately outside our tent, so we felt like we were taking our life in our hands entering and exiting each time, and could not enjoy the outside seating (although no issues first afternoon).   It was a similar situation at dinner, with them attracted to the lighting (albeit muted by staff to try to mitigate the situation).   The manager apologised and said it was just the time of year and had only just started to be an issue.  
b) Noise from outside the property.  The first night (Friday) there was booming music with a deep repeated base until 10pm  (we had gone to bed early due to a 5am start for Yala safari the next day!) and the second night (Saturday) this went on until 1am.  On the third afternoon when  we could hear it at 4pm we went out to the road to investigate and found a party bus with flashing lights and locals dancing around it just across the road from the Lodge.  Thankfully that night (Sunday) it went quiet by 7pm, I think the manager may have put a call in after guest complaints.  He advised that unfortunately, local regulations only restricted noise after 1am at weekends and after 10pm on other nights!  He agreed this was not good for a bird reserve and advised he was in a local association with other hoteliers pushing for further constraints, which suggests this is an ongoing issue.  We would therefore not recommend staying on a weekend, or take good ear plugs!  In general, the lodge is not as isolated as it appears, with a busy road nearby which passes across the lake.
Food was nice, and they had the largest international menu of all the properties we stayed at, with some really good dishes, but it was not the best - perhaps trying to offer too much choice. It was Valentines Day when we arrived and they laid on a special set menu which was a nice touch.
The lodge had a good pool near the lake but only 3 pairs of sun loungers, which was sometimes not quite enough for the 7 tents, when guests returned from their morning safaris.
The Lodge's naturalist took us on a walk in the grounds and he was very good at identifying birds for us.  Each guest receives a free 10min foot massage which was a lovely bonus, and we also paid for full body aromatherapy massages which were very good - although the monkeys running over the spa's roof were a bit distracting:-)   We loved watching the torque macaques and grey langurs playing in the grounds though - just make sure you keep your tents locked and don't leave food in them!
Communication was a bit confused on occasion - when we checked in we were advised a complementary local Arrack cocktail was available before dinner and we thought this was each night (as had been the case in our previous hotel) but it transpired this was just the first night and we had to pay after that.  We were also not advised that there was a campfire each night down by the lake, where you could have your pre dinner drinks sitting on bean bags - which we discovered and enjoyed on our last evening.
If you're on an extended trip, you can get your laundry done here which is handy - this service is outsourced to the Hilton hotel next door and returned next day, which was useful for us towards the end of our travels, and with clothes getting so dusty on safari.
We've also put a video of our experience of this Lodge on our NoBananas Youtube channel.  Overall a nice stay - we really enjoyed our days and the scenery, but some frustrations in the evenings and at night which stopped us being able to relax and sleep.  Some of these issues were obviously outside of the management's control, but you should be aware.
title: Peaceful Days, Poor Nights

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed here with friends for three nights to visit Yala and Bundala National Parks. Flameback Eco Lodge was the perfect base. Our "tents" or lodges were more glamping than camping  -  they each had air-conditioning, showers with constant hot water, and a loo. They were extremely comfortable, especially the beds, and had many thoughtful touches such as rechargeable torches, and universal sockets.  Each lodge was raised up on its own deck, and slightly angled and  positioned far enough away from the others for privacy and all were really close to the lakeside so we could sit out on our front decks and watch the birdlife in utter peace. 
The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Special mention for the nature guide who took us on an hour's walk around the grounds and nearby to help identify the bird species and the plants. He was extremely knowledgeable and interesting. 
We also enjoyed massages at the simple spa up among the treetops, and the excellent small restaurant also up at tree level, which was open-air but under cover. Breakfasts up there were a lovely way to start the day (or to enjoy on return from a very early-morning safari). 
The lodge has found a great balance between being ecologically aware and thoughtful about the environment, and comfort and relaxation. It's only about a 15-minute drive to Bundala national park (highly recommended, especially for bird-watchers) and about 40 minutes from Yala national park.
title: Superb private lodges in a lakeside setting

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Beautifully located luxury tents (only 7 of them) feet from the edge of a lake, with its cooling breezes. The accommodation has everything you want for comfort and convenience. Once again the staff were fabulous; friendly and efficient. One morning we had the place to our self and spent 2 blissful hours by the shady swimming pool. There was a local wedding party but music stopped at 11 so no problem at all.
title: Luxury lakeside glamping.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely wonderful stay! The hotel exceeded all expectations. The room was clean, modern and very comfortable. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Would definitely come back!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
There’s no words to express the experience we had in this hotel. One of the best boutique hotels in Sri Lanka I came across so far and a must place to visit. 
It is located inside Galle fort and minutes away from restaurants and shops. 

The rooms were clean, spacious and cosy.
The food was extremely good and you will never get disappointed the way they treat you. Hats off for the incredible staff for being nice, pleasant, supportive and always with a smile. 

A special thank for the incredible chefs Mr. Sanka and Diamond for preparing lovey meals and the servers Farath, Nethmi and  Tharindu for treating us well and making us special not as their guests but as their own family members. Also I would like to thank Ishara and Sagar (front office) and Lakmal (food and beverage manager) for their hospitality.
Wish I can change 2 nights to 3 nights because you will not get this experience everywhere! Hope to visit again soon :) Cheers!! (Jude Jayawardane from Wattala)
title: Great food, Excellent service!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: As the hotel is conveniently placed inside the Galle fort, sightseeing and visiting all the notable places around was just a minutes walk away. The hotel itself is beautiful and exuded a serene ambience eventhough it was within the bustling Galle fort. The staff was courteous, polite and always with a smile which added to the charm of the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The food was incredible, flavourful and exceeding expectations. This right here is indeed a little piece of heaven.
title: Friendly Staff, good food, great stay

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:

Must try place in Galle.

roomTip: They give so much food at breakfast. We learned to just ask for specific items instead of the full set that they provide.
text:
Yara Galle Fort is an excellent place. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is very comfortable.  The bed is great, firm but not too hard. The breakfast is delicious and a lot of food. The place is clean and all amenities are provided in the room.

We got the big king room with a separate living room. It is a lot of space. 

The dinner was so delicious. One of our best in Sri Lanka.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Très bien situé à l'intérieur du fort de Galle, parfait pour tout visiter à pied. Boutique hôtel de style colonial, très bien rénové et joliment décoré. Très bon petit-déjeuner. Personnel agréable. Lit en 160 seulement mais bonne literie. Un petit bémol pour la vue de notre chambre sur des toits vétustes, mais ce n'est pas grave car nous sommes restés seulement 2 nuits.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for one night at this lovely boutique hotel within the fort. It is well situated, with all the sights and restaurants within walking distance but what sets it apart is the genuine hospitality of the staff. In particular, the manager Luckshaylan was outstanding in the warmth of his welcome and throughout our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Galle Fort.
title: A positive experience

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for your thoughtful review! We’re so pleased to hear you enjoyed the hospitality, especially from Bhagya at the front desk. Your compliments on the food, friendly service, and the scenic views truly mean a lot to us.

We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back for another relaxing stay.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: I always loved Galle Face Hotel as it has an old world charm and a colonial feel yet modernised. Srilanka may have many many new hotels but people understimate the value of good service (backed by execution). Here, it delivers. This morning we missed our buffet - but we were served the bits of breakfast we needed in the Venrandah, and “Kapila” was phenomenal. It’s as if visiting a relative and being made at home. Keep up the good work Galle Face Hotel - service and execution ALWAYS makes the cut.
title: Galle Face Hotel delivers

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka

text:
This hotel oozes quality and class. It has an array of restaurants, a pool, a beachfront aspect, a gym and is in a prime location on the seafront in the middle of the city.

We stayed in a junior suite. The bed was enormous and the bathroom luxurious.

We tried three of the restaurants - the food was good and the staff friendly.
title: Well worth treating yourself

roomTip: Go for the rooms in the renovated wing please. Also don’t forget to visit the small private beach in the property.
text:
The views are fantastic. Breakfast is fresh and tasty. The likes of Nuwan. Krishma, Sunil. Nethali, Ranjith and Dimasha at the service areas make you feel hospitable and at home. 

The bar, the food and ambience is great. 

The rooms are a bit worn down and the property needs some serious renovations. Apart from that, it’s lovely.
title: Sea Side Fantastic

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Galle Face Hotel is a historic gem in Colombo, and we thoroughly enjoyed its beachfront location and the stunning ocean views from the Firebeach pub. The atmosphere, enhanced by live music and colonial charm, made our stay especially memorable.

The service throughout the hotel was warm and friendly, including from General Manager Suresh Abbas, who was often visible and engaging with guests.

However, there were a few areas that could be improved. Although we had booked three rooms, the front office declined our request for a late checkout on just one room unless we paid half the room rate, which felt a bit inflexible. Some parts of the hotel are showing signs of age—for example, the carpet along the corridor is quite worn and would be better removed if it can’t be replaced.

We also had a safety concern with the shower setup over the bathtub, as there was no anti-slip mat provided. Fortunately, the hotel responded promptly and moved us to another room the next day upon request.
title: Hotel with a colonial charm

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Had a great stay. Staff were amazing. Room stunning. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the sea. Belinda, Manuka,Dinushi and Ivoni were so helpful. Guys at Firebeach lovely. All in all a great start to our trip.
title: Great stay

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
My six months of travelling in Sri Lanka sadly draws to an end. During that time, I’ve stayed in private villas, hostels and family homes. For my final two nights in the capital city, I wanted some luxury with a colonial touch. An iconic landmark that would hold a lasting memory. 

For over 160 years, Galle Face Hotel has blended colonial charm with modern elegance, earning its place as the Grande Dame of South Asia and the most iconic destination in Colombo. Celebrates such as Steven Spielberg, Che Guevara, Earnest Hemingway, Sting, Sade, Robbie Williams, Lord Mountbatten and Richard Nixon have stayed here. 

The buffet is fantastic and I’m not a fan of these at all. Service is impeccable and staff go above and beyond to ensure you have a memorable stay whilst here. They’re proud to work here. The pool is unfortunately salt water and not chlorinated. The views are spectacular and for once I never left the hotel. This very unusual for me. 

The passionfruit frozen daiquiri is to die for as is the cheesecake. The mutton Rogan Josh was delicious, the sweet selection, gin & tonics and of course the Lion draught beer. This was impulsively booked right at the last minute. My room was fit for a prince, overlooking the Indian Ocean and Galle Face Green. Spectacular and what an outstanding front of house team. A touch of class, sophistication and elegance.
title: A Touch Of Class.

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka

text: It was excellent hotel, really good to in our heritage. Most of time I was out from Hotel due to my work commitments but I Love to go back there. It is a history take me to 18 Century.  Staff was good and well mannered. Well maintained building. Try to get back in.

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Beautiful hotel on the mountain with a view of Kandy. 
We really enjoyed our stay and felt very comfortable.
Our room was large, clean and nicely furnished. 
The hotel pool is not very big and only has a few loungers, but the view from there is nice.
The hotel has a restaurant and an extra rooftop bar. For breakfast there was a buffet with various things (fruit, toast, curry, waffles, egg,...). For dinner we had a buffet once and a 4-course menu on the other evening. The food was always very tasty and the service very good.
Unfortunately, what annoyed us was the constantly repeating melody in the hotel and the construction of the neighboring building.
Kandy Lake was about a 10 minute walk away and the town about 30 minutes. However, there were also tuktuks.
title: Hotel with a nice view

ownerResponse/responder: Room division manager Grand Serendib Hotel
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We appreciate the time you have taken to write a review on trip advisor and we take this opportunity to thank you once again for choosing the Grand Serendib - Kandy for your holiday.

Thank you for your positive feedback and we are delighted that you had a memorable time.
We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Grand Serendib – Kandy.
Thank you,
Management Team - Grand Serendib Kandy
placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be patient and the pool will free up. It's only small but people don't spend all day there.
text:
The view is the absolute best thing about this hotel. The view and the food. And excellent service.
The view, the food and the excellent service... and the rooftop bar.
And the infinity pool.
OK so this hotel has a lot going for it.

We'd booked in advance and paid a little extra for a (what we interpreted as) better room. We were a little disappointed to discover our family room was on the sub-level. Once we spoke to the reception they understood and installed us into a top floor room with amazing views over Kandy.
The food is great here. Chef will come out and say hello during dinner service. Breakfast is also excellent and swift.
Make sure you get a chance to enjoy the pool. Being on the edge of the world and looking into the busy green city is not to be missed. The pool is small and cute and only a few loungers so you need to be friendly with your fellow guests.
Also make sure to enjoy the evening sunset views from the rooftop bar. The music is good, the barmen are good, the vibe is good. It's just a good time!

Highly recommend this hotel for families and saw many couples enjoying it too.

Make sure you tip the bellboy. He's a good dude.

The rooms have international plugs, AC, minibar, hairdryers etc... the bathrooms have toiletries and everything you need.
Definitely get a tuktuk or taxi as its up a big hill.
title: Luxury with an amazing view

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Reservar un rato de vuestro tiempo a disfrutar de un baño en la piscina con vistas a Kandy. Bonito lugar para hacer fotos
text: Maravilloso hotel en Kandy. De construccion moderna enclavado en la montaña con unas vistas increíbles. Destaco especialmente su piscina infinita. Os recomiendo dedicarle un rato pq es maravillosa. También  recomiendo cenar en  el Sky Lounge

text: Staff, rooms, views, food everything superb. We traveled as a family with teens and this is a superb location and hotel to be spoilt. Amazing views allow for prime photos from the room, bar, restaurant and pool! We received a free upgrade on arrival without request although all rooms seem superb and very spacious. All staff are very attentive and helpful. We used the a la cart menu which was varied and lovely. They also gave my husband a lovely father's Day treat! Thank you Grand Serendib Hotel 😍

text: An amazing service, made us some amazing cocktails! I would 100% recommend this place, the guys are amazing! I would fully recommend this hotel it’s modern with the best staff!

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 2 nights at the Grand Serendip and a good comfortable stay. 
It was good location to Kandy we happily walked down to Kandy and caught a Tuk Tuk back. We were on a dinner bed and breakfast rate, where the food was good the brownie we had one night was particularly tasty. 
The staff were attentive and the hotel was generally well kept and very pleasant. The smell in our room was very odd though, like a powerful cleaning smell. I’ve never had a problem with room smells before so found this odd! So much so that whilst in the room we had the patio door open and didn’t have any room service the following day to avoid it heightening any more.
Just a note that taxes and service charges are added on to all food and drink!
title: Pleasant stay in Kandy.

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed one night on only; was the 5th property we'd stay in during our tour around Sri Lanka and while lovely was not the best, Reception staff very smiley and polite; restaurant staff seemed quite reserved and didn't interact although we talked to them. Small pool with amazing views but not enough seating around it.  Breakfast was a good selection- buffet style; not huge but more than enough.  Big rooms and loo with a view! All rooms faced the view and had lovely balconies. Can walk down to the lake but step hike back again.

text: I went to Theva with a big group of people in the middle of June. All of us had a superb experience. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay spectacular. Thank you to Iresh and the team for making our visit so memorable. The attention to detail at this hotel was world class, from the food and beverage offerings to the rooms everything was amazing. The view from the property was truly stunning as well, especially in the mornings. There is no better place to stay in Kandy. Theva should be an essential stop for all of the town’s visitors.
title: Amazing experience at Theva

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
We stayed 4 nights at Theva Residency up the Hantana Hills away from the sort of polluted city air down below.  Theva provided me a brilliant haven during my first Sri Lankan adventure, they made an everlasting impression on how I looked at Sri Lanka.  
Everything was superb, from the management to the team of male staff, they were cheerful, friendly, respectful and they all worked in unisent.  
Upon arrival we were welcomed with a glass of refreshing amarella fruit drink (salty but sweet at the same time).  I used to eat this fruit in Chinatown in Houston, New York or while traveling in Southeast Asia but never as a juice, from that day on I had one made for me everyday.  
We were given a room next to the pool, it was filled with sunlight and very spacious with a big balcony but there was a minor leak from the ceiling down the wall to the floor, we informed the management and they moved us to another room which has a jacuzzi by the glass window.  It was an upgrade as the manager put it though it’s a tiny bit smaller with no balcony but it was a very beautiful room, the spacious shower is better designed aesthetically also more practical; the floor didn’t get wet when I shower like the room before the upgrade.  THANK YOU!!!
Very comfortable, AC worked perfectly and not noisy, plenty of hot water for the shower and the jacuzzi.  They also a hot sauna which I used one time (ask them to turn it on one hour before) it was at 60 according to the thermostat, hot enough to relax  and sweat some.  They even had an hourglass of 15m in the sauna, I’m a sauna girl and that was a very thoughtful detail.  
Theva Cuisine is the name of the restaurant they have on site where we had breakfast, dinner and lunch sometimes, loved their breakfast with fresh homemade bread and pastries.  Their dishes are versatile made to please all guests from different cultures/countries.  There was a lot of umps in every bite, an explosion of emotion in each morceau.  
They even went out of their way to prepare dishes my way or fruit drinks that I would make for myself at home.   Once they learnt that we like our food authentic and spicy the game was on.  
Words cannot describe how we enjoyed our stay at Theva with amazingly spectacular views from either sitting at their infinity pool or sitting by the windowsill in the room.  
The management and the staff run a tight ship show, well trained, well disciplined.  
Ms. Dheeshana, the owner/management director, was on site when we were staying at the residency, we share the same opinion that she should open a business in training hotel staff, we were so impressed with her staff.  Me, personally, I felt as if I was in a grand hotel like Hôtel Negresco in Nice on the Promenade des Anglais.   
By the way, loved her herb garden, I even had fresh spinach soup, it was out of this word.
title: A True Gem in Kandy Sri Lanka 10 out of 5 stars service

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
roomTip: Walk down the hill get a Tuk Tuk back up
text:
Overall an excellent hotel with excellent service. We had a room which ended up having a small leak in the wall and they gave us an upgrade to a better room with a jacuzzi which was very nice but honestly the other room was nice as well. 
As it’s ultra low season there was never many people in the hotel so the staff couldn’t be more helpful 
Things  to be aware of It’s quite a way up the hill from town you can walk down in 40 mins if you don’t get lost  but it would be quite a slog up . I got a tuk tuk up for 700 Rupees which is just over 2 dollars. 

Ok what about the food ? …,overall excellent. Wonderful breakfasts dreamy dinner love the possibly  too small  portions of meatballs with so many flavour profiles and the black pork curry was fantastic maybe could have been a bit more spicy but I guess they are catering for a very international audience.  If anything wasn’t quite as you wanted it you they did this best to change it. 

They could have mean more generous with the free water in the room rather than 2 tiny bottles ( but when asked they always provided them free of charge . The mats for the sun beds need to be replaced as they slip off all the time as all the straps are broken These though are very very minor points

So would I stay here again definitely and for what I paid due to the season excellent value. Food is a real positive. Definitely high end Asian fusion 

The range of juices all freshly made are all excellent. 

Great hotel glad we decided to stay there and will certainly come back next time I’m in Kandy. The Staff make it. 

One final point up so high on the hill the air is much much  cleaner , there is a lovely breeze and it’s much calmer than down in the town. For an extended stay this for me is the only location I would stay in
title: Top Class Boutique Hotel

roomTip: You need transport to get here from the town.
text: This a beautiful boutique hotel nestle in the hills above Kandy. The room was a good size, but not huge. All the things available that you would expect from a good hotel, there were no bedside tables though which would have been useful. The views from the room and hotel terrace were amazing. The swimming pool (if a little cold) and sunloungers were welcome after a day sightseeing. Drinks and dinner on the terrace over looking Kandy was a great way to end the day. The food was delicious too.  Would recommend this hotel as a good base to explore Kandy and surrounding areas away from the heat, hustle and bustle of the town.
title: A beautiful hotel in a wonderful spot.

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
We stayed here for three nights, and really enjoyed it. Our room had an excellent view over the city, and the restaurant terrace had an even better one! Really spectacular, especially as the sun went down. Drinking a cocktail there after the meal was a real highlight of our trip.

The food was excellent, with a good choice of both Sri Lanka and International meals, and the staff, particularly as they got to know us during the stay, were friendly, professional and efficient. They made an extra effort on the evening of my wife's birthday, with flowers and chocolates in the room.

It is quite out of the way, up a narrow twisty road, which might be an issue for some people, although it is on the right side of town for the railway station which is a benefit.

The room was very spacious and comfortable, but some of the furniture seemed a bit dated and due for refreshment. Apart from that we had no complaints at all. A lovely place to stay as a base for visiting Kandy.
title: A lovely place to stay when visiting Kandy, although a little out of the town.

Theva is a hidden gem! 
My room had the most amazing view I've ever seen. The bed was large and so comfortable. I'm vegan and the restaurant made me such high quality food. The hotel is located about 10 minutes from the train station and you could easily get here with a tuk tuk for about 1000LKR. The stuff was really sweet too. I would recommend staying here if you want to get out of the city for some relaxation.
title: Hidden gem in the nature

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: I had a wonderful stay at Theva Residency. The hotel is located in a quieter part of Kandy with lovely views and easy access to the city center, as it is well-known among drivers in the area. I especially loved the small alcove above the pool where I had my meals, the small balcony attached to my bedroom, and the delicious food! Theva's in-house restaurant makes everything from scratch, even the pastries, and the menu has some unique items that are not always easy to find elsewhere on the island. The staff is kind, hospitable, and helpful as well. I definitely recommend stopping off at Theva during your travels to Kandy.
title: Lovely 1-night stay

text:
I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Ashford in Nuwara Eliya! The location is absolutely stunning — waking up to the scenic Seethakoyal viewpoint from the hotel room was a magical experience. The lush greenery, misty hills, and peaceful surroundings truly made it feel like a nature lover’s paradise. The buffet was exceptional – a wide variety of both Sri Lankan and continental dishes, all fresh and flavorful. The staff was courteous, attentive, and made us feel right at home. From breakfast to dinner, the food experience was a highlight of our stay.

Rooms were clean, cozy, and well-maintained with all the essentials. The ambience was calm and perfect for a relaxing holiday.
title: Hotel Ashford

text:
Beautiful resort with friendly staff and a spacious layout.
There are two large pools, and the view from the main pool is simply amazing.
The resort boasts a huge, clean beachfront, though the sea is quite rough, so swimming isn’t really possible.

We tried both the dinner and lunch buffets, which offered a nice spread of local and international dishes. However, the lighting in the restaurant could be improved — it feels a bit dark and uninviting.
That said, the staff were consistently friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Rooms are nice, comfortable, and well-maintained.
title: Beautiful resort
