placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Glamping at its best!
Set in well tended grounds by lake.  All the staff were extremely welcoming, helpful and professional.   

It was quiet and relaxing with a boutique hotel feel - only 5 yurts sharing the facilities  of Skylark restaurant and swimming pool.

A welcome cocktail by the firepit with fire flies dancing around the trees was enchanting the first evening. 

An ideal place to stay if on Safari at Udawalawe and Yale National Parks.

Would definitely like to visit again and stay for a couple more nights to take advantage of the complimentary bird watching early in the morning and may be a yoga or cooking class.

Just remember your bug spray for outside in the evenings.
title: Glamping at its best!

title: Un petit paradis zen en bord de lac

text: We stayed for 2 nights over 2 tents as a family group. Everything was perfect. The service was wonderful, it was our trip highlight. We planned everything with the lodge before we arrived so all our game drives were perfectly organised. The food quality was very good, great pool and so much bird life to see from the lodge. I wish we stayed longer,
title: Outstanding stay

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Un accueil vraiment très chaleureux et un guide pour le safari au top ainsi que pour la découverte des oiseaux. Nous nous souviendrons toujours de cette belle parenthèse enchantée. Nos enfants ne voulaient plus partir. Entre la piscine, les animaux, que de choses à faire!
title: Magnifique

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently enjoyed a 2 night stay at the fabulous Flameback Eco Lodge. 
On arrival we were met with smiling faces, a refreshing towel and a delicious cool drink. 
Our accommodation was comfortable and the air conditioning a welcome feature. 
The service was first class. The wait staff in the restaurant were professional and attentive. The driver and the guide for our safaris were keen-eyed and extremely knowledgeable. 
The added touches of a packed breakfast for our very early starts and a person with a torch outside our tent at 5.15am to safely see us to our vehicle were greatly appreciated. 
Everyone at the Flameback Eco Lodge did their very best to make our stay memorable
title: Fabulous

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Tout est pensé afin que votre séjour soit à votre guise, sportif, détente …
text:
Originalité, raffinement, extrême gentillesse de tout le personnel.
À quelques dizaines de minutes des lieux de safari, venez découvrir ce paradis d’eco lodge.
Les 8 tentes climatisées, l ameublement et l équipement remarquables saurons vous enchanter. 
Ajoutez à cela une cuisiné maison inventive et excellente,
Mais tout cela serait uniquement très bon, si l accueil et la prise en charge par tout le personnel n était pas si exceptionnelle. Exceptionnelle de discrétion , d efficacité mettant tout en œuvre pour rendre votre séjour inoubliable
title: Paradis sur terre 😇

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Our guide Ishak suggested we take the quiter route away from other vehicles and it suited us. Saw all we wanted to which included elephants and leopards.
text: Really enjoyed our stay at the Flameback Lodge. Ishak and his staff made us feel very welcome. The birdlife around the lake and in the grounds was amazing. The food and attention to detail was excellent we really felt looked after. We had an excellent visit to a small farm where we had breakfast. Again fabulous birdlife and a great ride in an electric tuk tuk. We have done similar homestead experiences but this one was excellent. The drive to Yala Park was quite long but I think on balance the setting for Flameback Lodge easily compensated for that.
title: A great stay at the Flameback Lodge.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Alles unkompliziert!
text: Wir haben eine wunderbare Zeit hier verbracht. Das Team der Flameback Ecolodge ist sehr, sehr nett, bodenständig, immer gut gelaunt und stets hilfsbereit. Wir haben zum einen einen birdtrail am frühen Morgen unternommen auf den wir selbst als völligen „Vogel-Neulinge“grossen Spass hatten, viel gesehen haben und super Erklärungen von unsrem Guide bekommen haben. Auch die Fischer-Tour und natürlich die Safari im Yala Nationalpark waren super. Die Lodge selbst wunderschön, gemütlich und familiär. Ein toller Pool, ein super Massageprogramm im Spa  und ein gutes Restaurant lassen einen komplett erholt wieder abreisen! Absolut empfehlenswert!
title: Perfekt für Bird-Spotter, Safari-Lover und aller Erholungsuchenden

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't expect luxury. If you enjoy camping, you will probably be fine!
text:
This has been a difficult review to write. We have given it 4 stars but maybe 3 and a half would be fairer, if that were possible. My instinct would be to give it 3 stars, but the other 3 star reviews of this place are far more critical than our experience would justify.

There is much to like about this place. The views of the lake shore and birdlife just feet from your deck are beautiful (if you frame your photo correctly) and the team are charming and helpful as individuals (but confused and disorganised as a collective). The safaris, which are a key feature of the lodge, are beautiful, but involve a long drive there and back, and they do not appear to have worked out how to coordinate meals with the safari schedule. 

Some other reviews have been critical of the 'glamping' tents, but they were one of the positives for us. The bed was very comfortable and the air con was efficient (but obviously noisy) and the showers were efficient with plenty of hot water. The deck was a pleasant place to sit at times but the flying things became a nuisance as dusk settled. This is understandable given the location, and not a complaint. 

Another positive has been the quality of the meals we had (I will talk later about the meals we did not have). We had a Sri Lankan meal on our first night, and a 'European' meal the second. Both were really enjoyable and served with good humour. Breakfast was tasty and filling. 

The pool area is welcoming and very enjoyable. 

As for the negatives, the proximity to the main road cannot be ignored. The traffic noise is a constant and occasionally even drowned out the air con. The site is also shared with a large hotel. This did not impact on us but the publicity for Flameback Eco Lodge does imply a more secluded location. The birdwatching walk with the naturalist consisted largely of the Hilton hotel car park. To be fair, it was quite a rich environment for birds, but it wasn't quite what I was expecting. 

The restaurant and lounge area are a bit tired. The cushions on the sofas are quite dirty, the glass table tops need a clean and everything needs a little attention. 

We were not impressed by the service overall which was a bit disorganised. We assumed that our room would have been straightened by the time that we got back from an early safari, but it was untouched until I asked for it to be done and even then, empty drinks glasses were left uncollected for the duration of our stay. They close the window blinds at night as part of the turn-down service but they do not open them again. This might sound trivial but rolling up the blinds involves balancing on the edge of the deck, finding something to stand on to raise the zip to the top, getting soaked by rainwater/condensation run off, and disturbing a swarm of flying things. Getting water replenished required several requests. Not exactly 5 star!

We went on an (excellent) safari getting up at 04:15 for a 04:45 departure. A snack of 2 small bananas, cake and water is provided. When you get back about 10:30, we had breakfast which was welcome. About 12:30, we asked about a light snack before the 13:45 afternoon safari but only full lunch meals were available which we did not want, having only finished our breakfast 90 minutes earlier. No snacks were available  (crisps nuts or fruit and crackers would have been fine). By the time we got back from the afternoon safari at 18:45, we were ravenous. This needs thinking through. 

Overall, the publicity for this place implies an atmosphere of seclusion, exclusivity and luxury that is not borne out by the reality.
title: A mixed picture🤔

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Si vous êtes sensibles au bruit (des oiseaux uniquement) prenez des bouchons
text:
Nous voulons chaleureusement remercier toute l’équipe du Flameback ecolodge!

Des tentes de grandes qualités avec un très bon confort.

Des activités variées avec notamment une magnifique piscine.

Nous avons fait avec eux : 
- Cours de cuisine avec le Chef
- Observations des oiseaux 
- Yala Parc 

Nous avons tout adoré ! Et surtout nous avons énormément apprécié la gentillesse du personnel et son dévouement. 

Avec des plats de grande qualité.

Une magnifique parenthèse dans notre voyage au Sri Lanka. Nous repartons des étoiles plein les yeux!
title: Expérience unique!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing stay- couldn’t have been better. Small property with individual “tents” which were very luxurious. Service was incredible- we were here for honeymoon and made to feel very special. Staff were very professional and had very high standards. Food was some of best we have had in Sri Lanka. In a good location to get to multiple parks- this means there is a road nearby but didn’t affect our stay
title: Book here

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: What a wonderful place to stay,great to wake up every morning to beautiful bird song and fabulous views. The staff were amazing,Sanduni and Ishan couldn’t have been more helpful and accommodating and Dilan our waiter was wonderful. Thushan took us bird watching early one morning and the treatments at the spa were just heavenly.
title: A beautiful tranquil place.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Flameback Eco Lodge was the highlight of my trip to Sri Lanka. Firstly, all of the staff are AMAZING and so so so attentive. They went above and beyond to make sure I made the most out of my stay. 

The deluxe tents are great. The beds were super comfy, facilities were all in great working order and the view over the lake was incredible. 

I used there in house service to do 2 safari mornings, both of which were fantastic. My guide was so knowledgable and I got to see a variety of animals and my favorite animal, elephants! They packed a beautiful breakfast of fruits and cakes for me. 

In the afternoons the manager took me on 2 village based tours to see different varieties of birds, which were all beautiful! He knew every type of species and we must of seen over 30 different types! 

The breakfast was the best I had in Sri Lanka and the candlelit dinner was also very tasty. 

The pool is perfect to relax in the afternoon sun after a morning safari. 

Also as a solo female traveller, I felt completely safe at all times! 

If you're looking to be out in nature, nestled with the birds but still have a luxury feel and service then this is the place for you. I could not recommend it highly enough and will definitely be visiting again in the future!
title: Highlight of my trip! A beautiful stay by the lake

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderfully located on the edge of the lake, very peaceful , with lots of opportunities to view local wildlife. The staff were marvellous- attentive, friendly and professional. The  eco-lodge was surprising luxurious- comfortable bed, lots of storage space, and well equipped.
title: Luxurious glamping with a view

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There are occasional 'sounds' you can hear from the surrounding area, but that's normal.
text: This is a lovely place!  The staff is very attentive and friendly. We stayed for two nights and loved the feel of the tent.  It was clean and tidy and had a great feel to it.  The food is delicious, especially the local curries!! I would highly recommend staying here.  It is a great location if you are planning a Safari.  All three of us tried the spa facilities and it was great!! All round an excellent experience!
title: Something different - highly recommended!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: We had a lovely time staying at flameback eco lodge. The setting is beautiful, the staff were friendly and attentive and it had a very peaceful relaxed atmosphere. We were on the breakfast and dinner package and the food was delicious, especially the Sri Lankan curry and ranged in choice. Our kids did the nature activity which they enjoyed and the staff were knowledgeable about the birds and local wildlife. The tent was clean and nicely laid out and everything worked. We visited yala and udawalawe, so the location of the lodge was great as it was about an hour to both. We were very happy and would recommend them.
title: Friendly staff,  beautiful view of the lake

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: The level of service at Flameback Eco Lodge was exceptional. The staff were highly attentive and always ready to assist. I can't speak highly enough of them all. The accommodation was superb and offered privacy from other guests.  A truly relaxing stay.
title: Wonderful staff. An exceptional service.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Un endroit magique au milieu de la faune sri lankaise, l’accueil y est chaleureux , la nourriture excellente et le logement super original nous fait sentir encore plus proche de la nature. Cet havre de paix est idéalement situé si l’on désire se rendre au parc de Yala pour un safari.
title: Expérience authentique loin des grands hôtels

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Un véritable havre de paix au cœur de la nature ! Les lodges sont superbes, le personnel est aux petits soins, et la cuisine est exceptionnelle. La vue sur le lac et les activités comme l’observation des oiseaux rendent l’expérience inoubliable. Parfait pour se ressourcer. Je recommande à 100 % !
title: Un paradis au cœur de la nature 🌱❤️

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Cet établissement a beaucoup d’escaliers
text: Le lieu en haut d’une colline au dessus d’une rivière est magique Le personnel adorable est à l’écoute des clients Les petits déjeuners les dîners les en-cas sont tous hyper bons et variés La piscine est petite mais parfaite si les clients sont respectueux du calme ambiant
title: Un petit coin de paradis

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Nous avons adoré ce lieu pour son positionnement en haut d’une colline et la tranquillité autour Notre chambre dans l’annexe était grande et confortable Les petits déjeuners sont très frais et copieux Quant aux dîners avec le choix entre cuisine internationale ou sri-lankaise nous avons opté pour la deuxième les 2 soirs car tellement bonne Le personnel est adorable La piscine est petite et si plusieurs familles avec enfants squattent…. ce lieu peut devenir peu agréable Dommage
title: Un bel endroit avec une délicieuse cuisine

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We would recommend having dinner at the hotel - lovely views.
text: Villa Rosa is the oasis of Kandy. The villa is slightly out of Kandy town, but this is one of its charms due to the peacefulness of the setting and the superb views. The villa also provide a free tuk tuk service down to the town, so getting around is not a problem. The owner and staff are all very helpful and attentive, and the meals served there were also lovely (we had breakfast,  dinner and lunch!) Overall, would thoroughly recommend this as a place to stay in Kandy - not to be missed!
title: Sweet like Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: A lovely small guest house that feels like a hotel. The staff are all very welcoming and make you feel settled immediately. The food is excellent and would highly recommend asking to spend time with the chef in the kitchen as he makes the dinners. The staff also go out of their way to help you arrange sites to see and tourist visits around the area. If we are ever back in Sri Lanka, we will be staying at Vila Rosa again!
title: Friendly, welcoming, excellent food, excellent location, a great find!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: L’albergo è situato sopra la città di Kandy. Siamo arrivati tardi la sera, ma ci hanno accolto con un sorriso. La nostra camera è spaziosa con un grande bagno, un letto a baldacchino e una grande terrazza. Al mattino vediamo le scimmiette camminare sui fili della luce. Molto buona la colazione che viene servita in terrazza. Frutta fresca, uova, succhi freschi. Bellissima piscina a sfioro, pulita. Aggiungerei qualche sedia a sdraio. Personale molto attento.
title: Un bel posto tranquillo

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Villa Rosa is absolutely gorgeous, sitting up in the hills above Kandy and looking out over the river. The staff were friendly, helpful and very professional. The Sri Lankan breakfast included in the rate was delicious. They gave us a packed breakfast to take when we left early to visit Sigiriya. The rooms were really comfortable, great in room amenities, tea and coffee.
title: Beautiful Villa in the hills

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for four nights in the family suite at the start of Perahera. The location was just perfect. The views over the forest, across to the mountains and down to the river breathtaking, Villa Rosa is a lovely peaceful retreat not far from the hussle of central Kandy . The food was probably the best during our month long stay in Sri Lanka. Thank you Volker and the team for making it so memorable.
title: Villa Rosa - a special place in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Cet hôtel est très charmant avec une magnifique vue . Les chambres sont spacieuses . Le personnel est adorable . La piscine est splendide . On y mange bien . Bref pas grand chose à dire de négatif hormis le fait qu on nous demande de partir tôt le matin car une famille arrivait après nous et on n a pas bien compris pourquoi nous n étions pas prioritaire par rapport à cette famille ….
title: Une superbe vue

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Wunderschönes, kleines Hotel oberhalb von Kandy. Hier stimmt einfach alles: unfassbar schöner Ausblick, grandioser Pool, stilvoll und mit Liebe eingerichtete Zimmer, tolles Personal und sehr gutes Essen. Für uns war es mit Abstand das beste Hotel auf unserer Rundreise durch Sri Lanka!
title: Hier stimmt alles!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
It certainly is a very original place to stay. We really enjoyed it! It's a bit tricky to get to as the roads are winding up in Kandy, but at the bottom of their steep road, we called Villa Rosa and two staff with TukTuks picked us up with our luggage.

The rooms are spacious with high ceilings, they are clean with nice outdoor areas around them, and the family rooms were next to each other with a balcony where the young people hung out and played cards.

The bathrooms are spacious with a nice rainforest shower.

It's very green and cool, there are several areas where you can chill and relax, it offers a great pool, a little library where you can read a book or borrow cards or a board game and a water fountain to refill bottles.

Staff are very friendly, there is authentic food with new fruit like mangosten, a delicious salad named malun (herbs with coconut), Sri Lankan or Western dinner and breakfast.
title: For a slightly different experience, go to Villa Rosa!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The food here is really exceptional
text:
A beautiful colonial home with several boutique bedrooms with stunning views over the river valley below.

I must mention the food here.  It was gourmet first class and possibly the best food we had in all of Sri Lanka (and we had some great food).  The chef is exceptional and whilst there isn't a large choice on the menu, this is a good sign as it means the chef cooks everything fresh for you.  

If you let them know in advance then at no cost you can accompany the chef and watch him as he prepares the evening curry meal.  Knowing now how good this chef is, we wish we had done this.  Next time maybe.

There is an infinity pool with stunning views over the river valley and lovely to refresh in after a hot busy day.

The German owner also lives at this property and so it has the feeling of staying in a rich colonial family home.  It is a short tuk tuk ride into Kandy town centre which costs hardly anything.
title: Beautiful colonial mansion with first class food

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: The most spectacular views you could hope for. A wonderful welcome with incredible food and service. It felt like a real treat to stay here. Thank you to everyone who made us feel so welcomed. Facilities are great - swimming pool was awesome.
title: Gorgeous!!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was a second visit to Villa Rosa having stayed at this delightful little hotel back in 2016. We loved it then and we loved it even more this time around. 

The disruption of the pandemic allowed Volker to make a great improvements to the hotel with the construction of a divine infinity pool overlooking the river. After a hot day in Kandy it's a real luxury to take a dip with an ice-cold beer.

Volker and the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Food is delicious too and you can visit the kitchen to see the chef at work if you're interested in Sri Lankan cuisine.

We had one of the river view rooms on the upper level which was large and tastefully furnished. The view is absolutely incredible and you can watch the monkeys and birds for hours! 

Well recommend Villa Rosa.
title: Kandy without the hustle and bustle

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent choice in a lovely quiet position high above the Mahaweli River just outside Kandy.  The views from our room at the top of the hotel were spectacular.  We had a large private terrace and spacious room with bathroom.  There is a friendly vibe and the hotel is run by the charming and very efficient owner, Volker.  The food is delicious and there is a homely feel, making the hotel feel like a private house (which is once was).  Nice pool and lovely terraces for eating out.
title: Hotel with Spectacular Views and Homely Feel

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
What a beautiful place with some of the most spectacular views i have ever seen. The room was lovely and opened up to views of the valley, river and infinity pool that took my breath away. 

The hotel has lovely staff who cannot do enough for you and are  genuinely interested and (rightly) proud of the service they offer.  The food was good and reasonably priced with a good range of drinks.  

I would have liked to have stayed longer and tried one of their massage/aruyvedic treatments but time didn't allow. 

Would definitely recommend
title: Breathtaking views and lovely staff

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Prefer the main building accommodation
text:
It may be hard to get to via Kandy’s winding road network, but one’s perseverance is very well rewarded at Villa Rosa.

What views! Well above the hustle and bustle of Kandy is this haven.  Volker and his team have created a peaceful oasis above the city with breathtaking views up and down the Mahawali River valley.  

The rooms are spacious and splendidly original. The food is of an excellent standard, serving Western and Sri Lankan fare.  Staff were unfailingly helpful and enthusiastic.  Pool and views from it are worth the trip alone!
title: Hard to get to, but really worth the effort

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: A superb boutique hotel with a marvellous location overlooking the river.  Lovely new pool was superb.  Owner and staff were amazing giving great service.  All meals were first class and the best coffee in SriLanka!  Quiet location - room, shower perfect.
title: Like a home from home

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the superb Villa Rosa for 2 nights but wished it had been longer.When driving up the impossibly steep and narrow road to the very top you do wonder where you might be going but then when you arrive at this beautiful building in fantastic grounds with a simply awesome view over the river way way below it truly is special.We had the good fortune to have the honeymoon suite which sits even higher overlooking the river and giving us one amazing sunset and indulge in some birdwatching with the eagles soaring below.The food was exceptional where I had the Sri Lankan chicken curry both nights which comes with 5 additional curries and had only one repeat dish.Make time to come back after your travels and enjoy the views from the infinity pool over the river and hills beyond watching the many birds or the kites flying.
Really special.
title: Amazing Villa with matching views and food

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Initially very difficult to locate (Google maps a little confusing for our driver), outside of the city centre and up a very steep, poorly maintained road. However upon arrival the resulting views down to the river and across the valley made the search all worthwhile. We were warmly greeted and shown around including an introduction to the chef in the kitchen.

Our room (number 4) was well appointed, comfortable and with fantastic river views including a balcony with separate dining capacity which we used for breakfast both mornings. The bathroom was massive and included a large walk in shower (pressure a bit low though) and free standing bath tub.

We ate the Sri Lankan curries on both nights and enjoyed them a lot. Apparently the spices are toned down for Western taste buds! Disappointing that they had no red wine at all on the first night although they had corrected this by the following evening.
The pool is small but welcome in the hot weather and frequently visited by a troop of mischievous monkeys who turn on the poolside taps for a drink!

On our second day it was noticeable that there were some staff shortages although those working did a great job to plug the gaps including finding our missing laundry!
title: Great views

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Like going back in time - may not be for everyone but loved the atmosphere and views of this small boutique hotel.  
If you can ask for cooking experience not lengthy but a great introduction to Sri Lankan cooking  
Rooms are lovely and spacious with wonderful
Views. Small but perfect infinity pool with great views
title: Like going back in time

ownerResponse/text:
Dear aptivas,

Thank you for your kind words and for highlighting the picturesque beauty of our gardens and surroundings. We're especially pleased to hear that Yoga’s attention to detail helped you capture the best of Kandy’s scenic backdrop.

It was a pleasure having you with us, and we hope to welcome you back soon for more breathtaking views and memorable experiences.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: Breathtaking views & artwork throughout. The gardener Yoga paid attention to detail to ensure we got the best pictures of all angles in his garden with picturesque Kandy in the back 🌷🏞️
title: Picturesque garden views

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Oscar S,

Thank you so much for your glowing review! We're truly delighted to hear that your experience at Amaya Hills was exceptional across every category. It’s wonderful to know that our team, especially Chamil, made a lasting impression with their warm hospitality.

We're also glad you enjoyed the mango smoothies—one of our favourites too! We deeply appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back for another superb stay in the hills of Kandy.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Amaya Hills, Sri Lanka a Superb place to stay in Kandy, the service has been great, from arrivals all staff were really smiley and kind! Especially Chamil in the restaurant!

I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough, what an experience!

The mango smoothies were amazing!
title: I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough, what an experience! 5 stars for all categories, service, facilities and staff!!!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear 131charliel,

Thank you for taking the time to share such a thoughtful and detailed review. We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the breathtaking views, warm Sri Lankan hospitality, and the comfort of your room at Amaya Hills.

It’s wonderful to know the welcome drink, scenic pool area, and terrace breakfast all contributed to a memorable stay. We truly appreciate your kind words about our service and food quality, and we’ve noted your feedback on the buffet variety and location in relation to Kandy town.

It was a pleasure to have you with us, and we hope to welcome you back for a longer stay in the future.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The hotel stuns immediately with the spectacular views from the reception area! We were greeted with the famous Sri Lankan hospitality, a welcome drink while overlooking the amazing views of the hotel grounds, mountains and Kandy area. The pool area has a similarly incredible view as did the balcony of our lovely and well-appointed room. Service was excellent and the food similarly great quality, though a slightly smaller selection than we enjoyed at sister hotel Amaya Lake perhaps. Eating breakfast on the terrace was wonderful. Wish we could have stayed longer but we were on a pre-arranged tour and couldn't have been happier with the choice of hotel. The only note really is that it was a little way out of Kandy itself so you are unlikely to wander into town on foot!
title: Spectacular views and luxurious stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear JimM229,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We’re delighted to hear you enjoyed our amazing staff, great food, and superb views during your stay.

We appreciate your honest feedback regarding the mezzanine room layout and lighting. Your comments are valuable and will help us consider ways to enhance guest comfort in the future.

It was our pleasure to have you with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another enjoyable stay.

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/address: Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
roomTip: Views from pool area are superb.
text:
Stayed here for a short stay whilst touring Sri Lanka, the staff are amazing, food great.
Room stayed in was a bit weird, with a mezzanine bed room, perched above the living space, toilet upstairs as well. Living space was quite dark as a result. The room however contained everything needed, safe, mini fridge etc.
All the staff go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable, sorelax and enjoy your stay.
title: Superb hotel, superb views

text: Beautiful hotel located on top of a mountain. Rooms have the best views, you can see clouds below the hotel level sometimes. text:
We had a fantastic 3 night stay at Amaya Hills. It really did feel like a palace. Spectacular views and the service from all staff from check in to check out was unfaultable. We loved meeting the young staff completing their hospitality degrees and the pride they had in their work. Shout outs to Sanchitaka, Ridmi and 
Racmal who never forgot our orders and had great customer service. We had a nice walk with Manohar one morning and utilised all the facilities including the pool, gym, squash and billiard room. The buffet was also 👌 so many options especially gluten free and vegetarian. The only fault if any was the service tax on everything when the price was already above what you'd pay else where and slightly outdated bathrooms. But overall great stay, room clean, wifi every where, air con worked well. Thanks for a great stay
title: Fantastic stay, staff very attentive no complaints here

text:
Wat een fantastisch hotel met een goede rustige ligging, net buiten Kandy,  en GE-WEL-DI-G uitzicht!
Kamers zijn prachtig, schoon, comfortabel  met goede bedden!
Het ontbijt is zeer uitgebreid en erg lekker. Veel verschillende soorten fruit! 
Het diner is ook erg uitgebreid! Wij hebben gebruikgemaakt van het buffet maar je kunt ook a la carte eten.
Het zwembad is heerlijk en ook de Spa is de moeite waard! Lieve mensen en een heerlijke olie massage gekregen. Als je hier inchecken zeker een behandeling reserveren!
Ons verblijf hier was zeker de moeite waard!!

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful historical building dating back to 1864, right on the seafront with several attractive eating and drinking options. Lovely to walk out onto the Galle Face Green at Sunset and enjoy the scene. Comfortable rooms, an army of friendly and helpful staff and good aircon in the summer!
title: Beautiful old Colonial era charm

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: If you are like me, and seek out unique experiences that reflect history and cultural in the place you visit, then the Galle Face Hotel is for you. Step into over 150-years of history, culture and island-hospitality. Previous guests include the late Queen Elizabeth II, late Prince Philip, and even Sting. Whether royalty or not, you will be treated with a great deal of care. Enjoy wonderful architecture, unparalleled ocean views, and an oasis of tranquility in a busy city.
title: Culture, History, Tranquility with Island Hospitality

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: booked long room for a family fun function.  Amazed by the hospitality and friendlies of the staff.  Specially Mr Ranjith who is so proud of his job and the legacy of the hotel.
title: Absolutely amazing

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: I left my baby  blanket and Pubudu found it, took care of it and had it sent to me in dubai.  The love and care I received was extraordinary.  My dear blanket is on its way!  Thank you Pubudu and Manoj for all that you did for me!  This is next level care and really paying it forward.  Thank you, stephanie.
title: Pubudu and my lost blanket

title: Ivoni guest relations officer

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Cheapest way to get around Colombo is via Tuk tuk on Uber App (if you're adventurous enough!) Obtain SL sim card for phone to preserve data.
text:
What a wonderful warm welcome we received upon arrival at the Galle Face Hotel. The staff remembered us as we stayed here last year to help plan our son's wedding.
This is a beautiful iconic hotel from the Colonial era and a refreshing change from modern corporate. Some aspects of the hotel are tired, consistent with it's age and under investment but it is clean and comfortable with good air conditioning in the bedrooms.  The pillows are fabulously fluffy and the beds firm but comfortable. 
The Travellers Bar is a great space to relax with the sound of crashing waves and a sea breeze. The food and service in the bar is also very good. We had particularly great service today from Kaushi and Kapila, thank you both!
title: A refreshing change from modern corporate!

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: It was a great experience overall. Customer service and care was top notch. The food was prepared appetising and tasted brilliant. Me and my family were so fortunate to have had such a great stay. However, the salad corner left us unsatisfied and definitely could be improved. Other than that everything was great! Thanks Galle Face Hotel! - Pulara Gunaratne
title: Our experience at the Galle Face Hotel

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: We had a fabulous lunch at Galle Face hotel Colombo. The staff was very welcoming and the environment was fascinating. We highly recommend this place to anyone who wishes to spend time with their loved ones.Excellent food, with a first-class breakfast and extensive meal options. The breakfast buffet is often cited as a highlight, offering a wide range of items. It offered a serene, colonial-era atmosphere with vintage charm, ocean breezes, and timeless elegance. The ambience blends historic grandeur with seaside relaxation, especially during sunset on the terrace. It's ideal for those who appreciate heritage, calm, and a touch of old-world romance.
title: First class Experience..👍👍👍❤️

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: The best property to stay while in Colombo. Ambience to sea side restaurants and great food, everything makes yours stay a memorial one. The only thing hotel can work is housekeeping. We had to call housekeeping multiple times to get used plates collected from our room and then eventually had to keep them outside our room. Thereafter also it took them a lot of time to clear it.
title: Final stay in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We found this amazing English like pub linked to the hotel. 
Happy hours from 17:30 to 19:30, a good selection of drinks and foods. 
Service was on point and Kalum was super friendly and helpful. 
Definitely worth and visit or a revisit in our case.
title: In on the Green

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a truly lovely stay at Galle Face Hotel. The location is exceptional — right by the ocean, with stunning views and a unique historic atmosphere. Our room was comfortable and elegant, and the overall setting perfectly balances charm and relaxation.

The staff were warm, attentive, and professional throughout, and the food was excellent — especially cocktails by the sea. Despite a complicated start with the booking, the team resolved it with grace, and we left with only positive memories.

Highly recommended — a timeless Colombo landmark worth experiencing.
title: A Memorable Stay at a True Colombo Icon

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't book rooms with garden views; you might end up with a street view room.
text:
I stayed with my family for three days in this fantastic hotel. It offers excellent service, and the staff is exceptionally polite and helpful. The breakfast buffet offered various food, and we had a chance to try local dishes. We had a great time making our cocktails in Travellers bar (thanks to Shehan🍹) and trying some tasty food and cocktails in the Cuban bar. The pool is lovely and wasn't crowded, and we had a magnificent view of the Indian Ocean. Firebeach bar offers a variety of drinks and food. 
The beds are comfy, and the rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel's interior is breathtaking. 
Overall, our expectations were completely met. Thanks to everyone who made this trip unforgettable.
title: Fantastic time at Galle Face hotel

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: The Verandah restaurant offers delicious food with an ocean breeze. On the night I visited great sservice by Thilakshani Lots of Sri Lankan choices of food - fresh hoppers made by the chef and fresh fruits. Saxophonist playing in background
title: Good verandah vibes

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka

title: Great experience

placeInfo/address: 3,2 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:

A few little issues as follows:
Food service in the bar was a little slow mid afternoon.
We could not switch off the ceiling lights or switch on the air con in our room. Only noticed at bed time and were only there one night so did not raise it.
Had been checked in under the wrong name so a little embarrassing when I tried to sign for our meal with family and they questioned it.

But it’s very expensive (8000LKR) for the buffet + a soft drink and a coffee

roomTip:
Double-check the hot water and A/C when you check in, just to avoid surprises later.

If you're planning to eat in, ask the staff what's freshly made - some items are muc
text:
Stayed at Grand Serandib Kandy recently, and while it has its charm, it definitely has a few areas that could use some attention.

The location is great, really peaceful, with lovely views of the hills, which makes for a relaxing atmosphere. The staff is friendly and welcoming, but sometimes a bit slow to respond to requests, which can be a little frustrating when you need something quickly.

The room I stayed in was decent, but could use a little updating. It felt a bit dated, and the bathroom had some minor issues, like low water pressure and inconsistent hot water. However, the bed was comfy, and the air conditioning worked well, which is always a plus.

The food was good, though not mind-blowing. It’s solid enough, but I’d suggest stepping up the variety a bit.
title: Decent Stay, Could Use Some Improvements

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel splendide , ouvert il y a un an donc d un modernisme et d une classe sans égale. 
La vue des chambres et du restaurant est panoramique et magnifique sur tout les alentours du lac et sur le temple de la dent….
La piscine, même petite, est un joyau triangulaire à débordement, l effet de la vue quand on se baigne est spectaculaire et saisissant.
Les chambres sont spacieuses, modernes et bien agencées, avec grand balcon et immense baie vitrée coulissante, elles sont toutes avec vue. Literie parfaite, transat et fauteuils confortables sur le balcon, clim silencieuse, douche spectaculaire (à découvrir) , luminaires, décoration , rien n est laissé au hasard !
Seul manque un meuble pour poser la valise…
Il y a l’espace, mais pas le meuble.
La réception a l air libre ou presque est bien intégrée, le personnel partout souriant et accueillant.
Le restaurant est dans la même lignée, le buffet du petit déjeuner et du dîner est parfait , les cuisiniers et les chefs toujours aux aguets pour vous mitonner un plat supplémentaire avec le sourire. Seule la musique d ambiance mériterait une plus grande diversité et surtout plus actuelle !
Je ne regrette vraiment pas mon choix et je conseille à tous de séjourner ici, loin du tumulte et de la pollution du centre-ville accessible en tuk tuk (10minutes / 500 Rp, soit 1,50€).
title: Séjour parfait dans un hôtel splendide !

Consigliato a chiunque di qualunque età !
title: Una bomboniera a Kandy ♥️

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This charming and fairly small hotel on the edge of Galle Fort is very well located.  It is on the edge of Galle Fort so a little quieter than some other hotels but yet is in easy walking distance of anywhere that you are likely to want to visit.  I had a lovely ground floor courtyard room which was very well appointed and extremely comfortable.  The staff are very helpful and pleasant.
title: Excellent location and high standard of comfort

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Très belle endroit, idéalement situé.
L’accueil est chaleureux.
Le restaurant est très bon, les chambres sont grandes et propre.
La terrasse extérieure est parfaite pour boire un verre à l abri du soleil avec un courant d air rafraîchissant.
title: Excellent

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful boutique hotel in a great location (only 10 mins walk from Galle train station). Bed was super comfy and Sri Lankan breakfast was delicious! Only wish we could’ve stayed longer, 1 night was not enough. Would thoroughly recommend!
title: Wonderful stay!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Perfect place in the fort to enjoy all the touristy things. Very fortunate that  the hotel accommodated us due to a booking issue.
Rooms are fabulous, although food offering is limited.
Disappointed that early check-out breakfasts did not materialise!
title: Sri Lanka tour

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were  group of 6 who had booked 3 rooms for 5 nights in this wonderful hotel. We were really happy with our choice. 

This quaint & authentic hotel is perfectly situated in a slightly quieter part of beautiful Galle, still within easy walking distance from all of the sights & sounds. Rooms were immaculately clean with large modern bathrooms. We were extremely well looked after by the hotel staff, particularly so by Sithija & Akanasha who couldn't do enough to help. They were a great credit to this lovely hotel. 

Sithija set our outside table up for breakfast every morning so that we could all sit together. Breakfast was fantastic, huge choices cooked to perfection - with a Sri Lankan breakfast option also on offer. As we were staying for 5 nights we were all treated to a complimentary 3 course dinner, it was superb and once again served on our favourite outside table. 

We absolutely loved Galle and this hotel played a key part in our enjoyment, wonderful staff, great food and a perfect location. 

If we ever come back to Galle we would definitely book this hotel again. Perfection!
title: Simply stunning hotel in a perfect location

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms are so beautiful, beds comfy & the pillows were great. 
Service was exceptional, the staff were so obliging & kind. They couldn't do enough to make sure our stay was comfortable.
The meals were also delicious, fresh & plentiful. 
Beach access just across the road
title: Amazing hotel close to the Centre of Galle

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Yara Galle Fort was an amazing place to stay at and the place is very well done and modern but authentic. The hospitality and welcoming from the General Manager and his team was second to none. The food there was also great, absolute no need to leave the place to go have dinner elsewhere.
title: Yara Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel, in a well designed historic building with tastefully furnished and very comfortable rooms. Good location. Very nice and polite staff.  It feels like a haven away from the heat and pace of Galle, even if it is right in the centre.
title: Beautiful and comfortable in Galle.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent place; very nice , quiet. All the staff very helpful and kind. I didn’t put 5/5 because our room was very small and the air conditioner fully focused on the bed.
but it seems we have been unlucky : all the other rooms were bigger and nicer. So we encouraged to go go at Yara Galle fort hotel ; just avoid room 207😉.
title: Very nice well located, excellent staff

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s a beautiful town but gets very quiet after 21.00
text:
This is an amazing boutique hotel in the middle of galle fort! The rooms are clean and modern.
It’s the amazing friendly staff that makes all the difference and they can’t do enough for you!
The breakfast is amazing and served to your liking!
Definitely stay here if you are in Galle and want a special experience
title: Amazing boutique hotel in the middle of galle fort

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff! We stayed 1 night at Yara Galle Fort and had a great experience. We had a spacious, well air-conditioned room with a very high ceiling. Breakfast was great as well. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Galle!
title: Beautiful classic hotel!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Dont walk from the train station
text: Lovely quaint hotel, very good location and staff very friendly and helpful! Injured my leg on the way to the hotel and they helped to clean my leg and applied first aid. Rooms were clean and very spacious great value for money. Highly recommend
title: Must visit!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Les chambres sont confortables, le personnel est au petit soin, le petit déjeuner est un délice. Nous sommes ravis d’avoir séjourné dans cet hôtel. Nous le recommandons sans problème lors d’une venue au Sri Lanka pour visiter Galle et son fort
title: Hôtel très cosy

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were here to celebrate our son's birthday at Yara Galle. We had a lovely dining experience. Entire staff was warm and courteous.
They planned for a lovely surprise by arranging delicious cake.
Special thanks to manager Lakshan and staff Nihati for making our day special.
title: Nice dining experience

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Although the hotel is on the ‘main’ road it is quiet, but I would ask for a room at the back of the hotel where you feel more ‘away’ from th
text:
This hotel belies its street frontage. Once you step inside you can see that it has been very tastefully decorated and a lot of care has been put into its appearance. It looks homely and comfortable and is just that. The rooms are spacious but cosy and the beds and pillows very comfortable. The bathroom is well set out (just make sure you don’t turn the hot water switch off if you want a hot shower!), towels are lovely and fluffy and the whole room just feels like home.
The restaurant serves delicious foods for both breakfast (where you have a choice of Sri Lankan or English foods) as well as dinner and the staff are your typical welcoming, friendly Sri Lankans who go out of their way to look after you.
They offered a very good and cheap laundry service.
If we return to Galle, this will be our place to stay again, highly recommended.
title: Very comfortable hotel, central and friendly

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hôtel propre et très bien placé, personnel très attentionné et à l'écoute. Le repas et le petit déjeuner étaient très bons.
Les chambre sont propres et fonctionnelles 
Nous avons beaucoup apprécié notre séjour dans cet établissement et le recommandons avec plaisir
title: Super

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location and with lovely service. Our room overlooking the courtyard was spacious and nicely finished. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was large with hot water and good water pressure. Sri Lankan breakfast was great (although large) and would opt for this over continental, although the cakes with the continental were lovely. Overall really impressed and would recommend.
title: Beautiful hotel perfect for a stay in Galle fort

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: After driving through a very congested Galle,we arrived at our hotel. Located just outside the busy streets,near the fort walls and near a small park,where kids play cricket. Very friendly hotel,lovely welcome and rooms are spacious and clean. Locstion is perfect for Galle centre,just away from the bustle. Breakfast is good,did not eat dinner as there was soo much choice in town.
title: Fab place,Fab location!

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Great hotel, nicely located near the historic fort, very nice and welcoming staff who always try to help. Nice and comfortable rooms, very rich breakfast. Great nicely city streets within walking distance. Highly recommend for couples and families
title: Great hotel in Galle

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Great location, very good stuff, nice hospitality.   We had a very good time,  the breakfast was good. But the main thing is the location. It’s in the middle of the Galle fort and near you have all the treasures. There is very nice area near includes shops restaurants and anything you need
title: Great location.  We had very good time in the area and the fort.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Senandhi …. Thank you for sharing your experience. We're glad the quiet beauty of the surroundings gave you the space to unwind, and even more so that the warmth of our team helped you feel right at home. It’s always a pleasure to welcome guests who appreciate the slower rhythm of this place. We’d be glad to have you with us again someday; there’s always more to experience here, and we hope your next visit will be just as relaxing as the last. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful stay at Heritance Kandalama. The hotel is beautiful and peaceful, surrounded by nature, and offers a perfect escape from the busy world. The staff were always welcoming with warm smiles, making us feel truly at home. Truly a lovely experience, would love to visit again!
title: A peaceful and memorable getaway...

ownerResponse/text: Dear Pasan …. Thank you for sharing such a thoughtful reflection on your time with us at Heritance Kandalama. We’re delighted that the lake views, surrounding wildlife, and open architecture added a special atmosphere to your stay. It’s wonderful to know the infinity pool and the variety at the buffet were to your liking during your visit and that our team’s hospitality added to your comfort. We hope your time here brought a sense of calm and connection to nature. It was a pleasure having you with us, and we’d love to welcome you back for another quiet escape and to enjoy the beauty of Kandalama. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at Heritance Kandalama was truly unforgettable. The hotel’s location is breathtaking, nestled in nature with stunning views of Kandalama Lake and Sigiriya Rock. The architecture blends seamlessly into the environment, and strolling through the open-air corridors with monkeys and birds around was such a unique touch. Our room was clean, spacious, and offered a spectacular view of the lake. The infinity pool overlooking the water was a definite highlight—peaceful, scenic, and ideal for unwinding. The buffet offered a wide variety of delicious dishes, and the staff were consistently friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a peaceful, refreshing escape.
title: A Perfect Blend of Luxury and Nature

ownerResponse/text: Dear Don J,…. Thank you for your generous feedback. We're glad to hear you enjoyed your time with us and that our team's warmth and service stood out throughout your stay. It’s always encouraging to hear guests notice the consistency of our long-serving team members, and we're equally pleased that our newer colleagues are making their mark. We'll certainly pass on your appreciation to the kitchen staff and to Mandy. She’ll be glad to know she could assist you with your dietary needs. We’re grateful for the recommendation, and it was a pleasure having you with us. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Kandalama! Great hotel with super service, friendly staff. Good food. Needed to mention a few names but couldn't remember. The senior staff who has a long standing service still stands the same. The new staff is also good remember one girl from the kitchen dept was very helpful in helping me out since I am allergic for some ingredients. If I could remember her name right it was Mandy from the kitchen staff. 
All in all it was a pleasant stay. Will always recommend Kandalama.
title: Present stay in Kandalama

ownerResponse/text: Dear Himakara….  We’re delighted you chose to pause your journey with a lunch stop at Heritance Kandalama. It’s wonderful to hear that even a short visit left such a wonderful impression, from the variety and flavor of the buffet to the setting and service. Our team takes great pride in creating a welcoming and thoughtful experience for all our guests, whether staying overnight or just passing through. We're glad we could be part of a memorable moment during your family trip. Thank you again for your kind words, you're always welcome back. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
On our family journey from Kandy to Dambulla, we stopped for lunch at the iconic Heritance Kandalama, a true masterpiece of architecture tucked into the jungle. Even though it was just a lunch stop, the experience was unforgettable.

The buffet offered a wide spread of delicious dishes, beautifully presented and full of flavour. The warm hospitality from the staff made it even more special, and the serene atmosphere with views of the lake and forest was a real treat.

We had a lovely time, thank you to the entire team for making it such a memorable part of our day!
title: Great lunch with a view at Heritance Kandalama!

ownerResponse/text: Dear Loretta …. We're so pleased you enjoyed the unique architecture and natural surroundings. It’s always rewarding when guests take time to discover the many spaces tucked into the landscape. It’s great to hear you found a peaceful poolside spot and appreciated the comfort of your room and the warm service from our team. Dining in the restaurant on your own must have given you a lovely sense of coziness and privacy, and we’re delighted you enjoyed the food. The impressive breakfast spread clearly seemed to have stood out to you. Our culinary team takes great care in creating such a meticulous arrangement so that guests can begin and end their day on a high note. We do hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back on another visit. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful building hunkered against the rock and jungle.  So many different areas to discover… 3 pools easy to find one with no one in it! friendly helpful staff, comfortable rooms.  We ate twice in the restaurant on our own great food while everyone else ate in the buffet.  Hugest breakfast spread I’ve ever seen…
title: Stunning  building

ownerResponse/text: Dear Menso,….Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your kind words. We're so glad you enjoyed the design and setting of the hotel, Geoffrey Bawa’s vision truly makes this place one of a kind, and it's lovely to know it resonated with you. We're especially pleased to hear Apsara took such good care of you during your visit, and your appreciation of the entire team means a lot. text: I had an amazing stay at Heritance Kandalama. The hotel is beautifully integrated with nature, offering breathtaking views of the lake and surrounding greenery. text:
From the moment we arrived at Heritance Kandalama, we felt completely at home. The hospitality we experienced was simply next level! A huge thank you to Ms. Apsara, who was with us every step of the way — from the moment we checked in until we checked out. She truly went the extra mile to make sure we were comfortable, happy, and well looked after throughout our stay.

Mr. Sarath at the dining area was just as wonderful, always greeting us warmly and making sure we had everything we needed during every meal. The entire team made us feel genuinely cared for.

We stayed in both the Sigiriya Wing and Dambulla Wing, and each side had its own magic! If you’re a nature or wildlife lover, you will absolutely love the Sigiriya Wing. It’s surrounded by beautiful forest and feels like you’re part of nature itself. The Dambulla Wing, on the other hand, gave us breathtaking views of Kandalama Lake — a view we’ll never forget!

The food was absolutely delicious with a wide variety to choose from — every meal was a treat.

This was truly a memorable experience and we can't wait to come back! Thank you, Heritance Kandalama, for making our stay so special.

Nossa recente estadia em casal no Heritance Kandalama foi uma experiência verdadeiramente única e memorável. A estrutura impressionante do hotel, perfeitamente integrada à exuberante paisagem natural do Sri Lanka, proporciona um ambiente de serenidade e beleza incomparáveis. Desde a arquitetura inovadora até as instalações de lazer de primeira classe, tudo foi pensado para oferecer o máximo de conforto e bem-estar.
O que realmente elevou nossa estadia a um patamar superior foi o excelente atendimento de toda a equipe do Heritance Kandalama. A atenção aos detalhes, a cordialidade e a presteza de cada membro da equipe foram notáveis e contribuíram significativamente para uma experiência relaxante e agradável.
Gostaríamos de dar um destaque especial à Mahesha do restaurante. Sua atenção e cuidado durante um momento delicado foram verdadeiramente excepcionais. Ao me sentir mal do estômago, Mahesha demonstrou uma empatia e profissionalismo admiráveis. Ela se prontificou a preparar diversas comidas especiais, leves e reconfortantes, demonstrando uma preocupação genuína com o meu bem-estar. Sua dedicação em garantir que eu tivesse opções adequadas e saborosas foi simplesmente perfeita e fez toda a diferença em minha recuperação.
Em resumo, o Heritance Kandalama oferece uma combinação perfeita de uma estrutura hoteleira impressionante, imersa em uma natureza deslumbrante, e um atendimento de excelência.

text:
Heritance Kandalama – A Masterpiece of Luxury & Nature
My stay at Heritance Kandalama was nothing short of extraordinary! Designed by the renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa, this eco-luxury hotel blends seamlessly with its natural surroundings, offering a breathtaking experience in the heart of Sri Lanka’s cultural triangle.

Location & Ambience
Perched on the edge of the Kandalama Lake, this stunning hotel is surrounded by lush greenery, rocky cliffs, and abundant wildlife. The architecture is a masterpiece—built into the mountainside, making it feel like an extension of nature itself. The views of Sigiriya Rock Fortress in the distance add to the magic of this place.

Rooms & Comfort
The rooms are spacious, elegantly designed, and offer spectacular lake or jungle views. The floor-to-ceiling windows bring nature right into the room. I woke up to the sound of birds and the sight of monkeys playing in the trees outside my balcony. The luxurious bathroom with a rain shower and a deep bathtub made my stay even more relaxing.

Dining Experience
The buffet at Kanchana Restaurant was one of the best I’ve experienced, offering a mix of Sri Lankan and international cuisine. The quality of the food, fresh ingredients, and live cooking stations made every meal special. The rooftop dining experience with panoramic views of the lake was truly unforgettable.

Facilities & Activities
Infinity Pools – The iconic infinity pool overlooking the jungle and lake is breathtaking, perfect for a relaxing swim.

Ayurvedic Spa – A must-try! The treatments were rejuvenating, set in a serene environment.

Nature Walks & Bird Watching – The hotel is home to many bird species, making it ideal for nature lovers.

Cycling & Excursions – The hotel organizes tours to Sigiriya, Dambulla Cave Temple, and Minneriya National Park for wildlife safaris.

Service & Hospitality
The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive. Every request was met with a smile, and their hospitality made me feel truly welcome.

Best Time to Visit
The hotel is beautiful year-round, but the dry season (May to September) is ideal for sightseeing and wildlife experiences.

Overall Verdict
⭐ 5/5 – Heritance Kandalama is not just a hotel; it’s an experience. Whether you’re looking for luxury, nature, or culture, this hotel offers it all. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sri Lanka!
title: Highly recommend

ownerResponse/text: Dear Heidistock,….. It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciated the way the hotel blends into its surroundings. Taking a dip in the infinity pool is truly a special experience, and we’re glad you had the chance to enjoy it along with our other pools. The breathtaking views from the Sigiriya Wing, the variety of dining options, and the warm hospitality of our team are all things we take pride in, so knowing they added to your experience means a lot. And yes, our curious little visitors do like to make themselves at home—thank you for the reminder to keep the doors closed! We’d love to welcome you back for another relaxing and nature-filled stay. Warm Regards, General Manager

roomTip: Explore the surrounding area. The hotel will help book a tuk tuk if you dont have a driver.
text:
We stayed for seven nights at the Kandalama hotel. What an amazing place! The bedroom was roomy, cleaned daily  and the bed was very comfortable. The food was great with lots of different dishes  to choose from every day- I'm vegetarian and there was lots for me to choose from. There was masses for meat eaters too. 
All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly- nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks to Asanka and Modasanka who made sure our room was comfortable and clean- all the staff were gracious though, we just didnt catch their names!
 We tried all 3 swimming pools and found them all fab but would have appreciated some shaded areas around the poolside, but that is a small quibble as the ambience around all the pools was calm and peaceful-the views were good too. 
We really enjoyed seeing the monkeys ( macaques and langurs) from the balcony (and made sure to keep our balcony door locked when we were out as the macaques were very clever and determined little critters!).
We went on the jungle walk with Narinder, the resident naturalist and on another day took a tuk tuk to the Cave temples at Dambulla which are so beautiful. We also went to Pophams arboretum (near Dambulla) and thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. Just taking walks around the hotel and to the eco area  was enjoyable too.
We appreciated all the wildlife ( eg lizards, birds, butterflies) around the site and for us that was the 'icing on the cake' and ensured our stay gave us memories to last a lifetime.
title: Amazing hotel, fantastic food and gracious staff.

placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
I have to say, I was blown away by Theva Residency. The winding roads leading to the hotel are a bit eyebrow raising, and even when you pull up to the driveway, it's still very unassuming. But we were immediately welcomed into what would become a highlight in our Sri Lanka trip.

Theva Residency is a nicely adorned boutique property in the hills of Kandy. An easy 15-20 minute drive to Temple of the Tooth and Kandy city center proper. The service was warm, friendly, and genuine from the moment we checked in. We were assigned room 7, and it was a beautiful mountain facing room, that was exceptionally large. The bed was super comfortable, and the hotel had all of the major amenities you could need in the bathroom. 

What really sets Theva apart is their ability to be boutique, but have all of the bells and whistles of a luxury hotel. While we didn't use the pool, little touches like turn down service and someone bringing chocolates before bedtime were nice touches. The food was INCREDIBLE - we had the set menu for dinner and the options were fantastic, presentation was impeccable, and service was stellar. It also helps that this property has more staff than guests so they're always looking to enhance the experience. 

I was especially blown away by breakfast - a multi-course affair with a fresh fruit plate and bread basket to start. All of which were fresh and super tasty. Coffee your way - I asked for a regular drip (filtered) coffee and it was served in a French press!

Theva is in a league of its own, and for someone who regularly stays at 5* luxury resorts, I was so incredibly surprised by how lovely this stay was. Would highlight recommend to anyone visiting Kandy and looking for a boutique / local stay with genuine care and service.
title: A Gem In The Hills of Kandy

text:
Our journey to Kandy was a long-waited family trip for few months. All were busy with their agendas and waiting to take a break.
This time we selected Theva Residency, it was a perfect choice!!!  An ideal location up in the mountains with an amazing view throughout the day.  The uniqueness was you are able to enjoy the mountain view from your room, pool and the restaurant.
The staff were exceptionally hospitable, and they always look for opportunities to anticipate our needs and exceed those. Food was excellent.

A great location for Equilibrium and a fun filled holiday experience.

We will definitely be back.

Suranga, Tharanga , Thaviru and Vihansie
title: For an exceptional hospitality experience in Kandy

text: Staying at Theva was like going to a second home. You are made to feel at home from the time you arrive until the moment you leave. The staff are warm and friendly. The cuisine is exquisite. The view is breathtaking. I'll definitely go back to Theva.
title: Excellent service, food and location with very comfortable lodging.

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Endlich schaffe ich es, diese Bewertung zu schreiben: Wir waren mit unserer kleinen Tochter im August/September 2021 zu Gast in „The Teva Residency“ (soweit reicht die Tripadvisor-Datumsangabe leider nicht zurück). Während dieser Zeit gerieten wir in einen mehrwöchigen Pandemie-Lockdown und waren irgendwann die einzigen Gäste. Wir hatten ein sehr schlechtes Gewissen, allen so viel Mühe zu bereiten. Dennoch haben sich die Mitarbeiter einfach rührend um uns gekümmert! Sie waren unglaublich freundlich und der Service blieb auch in dieser Zeit einwandfrei. Das Team hat uns immer wieder mit neuem, ausnehmend gutem Essen überrascht (nachdem wir die sehr leckere Speisekarte mehrfach durchprobiert hatten) und hat wirklich alles getan, um uns den Lockdown so angenehm wie möglich zu gestalten. Der Einsatz des ganzen Teams und auch ihrer Chefin war wirklich außergewöhnlich! Vor allem unserer kleinen Tochter wurde wirklich jeder Wunsch von den Lippen abgelesen. Obwohl die Lebensmittel zu dieser Zeit im Land immer teurer wurden, schaffte es das Team immer wieder, ihr die geliebte Teva-Schokoladentorte zu backen. Als wir dann endlich abreisten, bekam unser Kind Spielzeug geschenkt und eine Torte als „Wegzehrung“ überreicht. Die Puppe wird auch heute noch in Ehren gehalten und meine Tochter mag seitdem keinen anderen Schokoladenkuchen mehr, weil keiner so gut schmeckt wie die „Teva-Torte“. ;-)  
Die Menschen in Sri Lanka sind alle unglaublich freundlich, aber das Team von „The Teva Residency“ gehört für uns wirklich zur Spitzenklasse!
title: Spitzenklasse

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
roomTip: Parking available
text:
From my recent gateway to Sri Lanka I went to Theva residency. 

The food here was great. It was authentic, aromatic, delicious. The taste of the food was just amazing. 

The hotel was on top of the mountain so the view from the hotel was just mind blowing. The ambience of the hotel was excellent. 

The staff was so well mannered.

Recommended food: Thai green curry with rice, Soup of the day served in the bread bowl, baked white onion with cheese toast soup, Theva special rice and curry served with 17 authentic srilankan curries, Theva wattalapan pot, Home made Icecream, Battered fried fish with salad. 

Most highlights of the visits are Soup of the day served in the bread bowl, Theva special rice and curry served with 17 authentic srilankan curries.

Highly recommend this place to visit.

Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
title: Had Best Food experience at Theva

It is a lovely spot with a fantastic view. 
We booked the penthouse and the view and space was lovely. 
The hotel is nice and small, however the penthouse main room doesn’t have curtains all the way which was an issue for us as our kids were sleeping in that room.
The bathtub could also do with some refurbishment it is falling part. 
The breakfast was nice and fresh (despite the fact you have to pay extra for a cafe latte) however we wouldn’t recommend the restaurant. We thought it was overpriced for the quality of food / menu available.
title: Lovely spot with fantastic views

text:
This property over looking the sea offers a buffet to die for and an implacable service provided  by the staff.
While I was present lobster was offered in the buffet. Crispy prawns were offered to me  when I said I did not see it, for a mistake made by me. Finger sandwiches of variety was offered at breaky which was a nice touch !!!
Request a room close to the lift if you have difficulty in walking. Rooms have been well
maintained with all modern facilities though it is an old resort. Evening entertainment there as well. 
Staff extremely friendly ready  to help anytime. They helped me to get great shots of the resort, also did not forget to say goodbye at my departure. 
No loyalty program yet in place which is a draw back for frequent visitors. 
Will recommend this place to anybody who seek great food and implacable service in hand. Will I go again  - most definitely.
title: Amazing stay at Heritance Ahungalla !!!

We spent 12 day vacation with family staying at this hotel. First of all very nice and friendly staff. Hotel with very tasty food and variety of cuisine.The hotel  has 2 large swimming pools and gym. People who like loud parties and animations will be disappointed because this is not this type of hotel and we were very comfortable with that.
The beach very close about 200 meters from the hotel bu unfortunately a lot of trash. The sea is very dangerous because of very strong current and there were red flags throughout our stay. We can highly recommend this hotel.

text:
We had an excellent stay at The Heritance Hotel, Ahungalla.
The hotel interior, the view, the location, everything was impeccable. The rooms have a great view and offer a lot of different activities and games for all age groups.
But most of all we have to commend the services provided by all the staff members. We have to especially thank the kitchen team, the chef and especially Mr. Chamuditha. We are a Jain family of 11, hailing from India, with a lot of food restrictions that are generally unheard of in Sri Linka. We were able to personally coordinate all our meals with the chefs and the trainee chefs with Mr. Chamuditha as our mediator. We had a total of 6 meals at the hotel and not a single one was disappointing. They have accomodated our every need with a smiling face. Coming to Sri Lanka we were already worried about the availability of Vegetarian food let alone Jain, but we can now go back and say with surety that no such issue can occur at The Heritance.
Thank you to the whole team for making our stay such a memorable one! Hope to visit again soon!
title: Amazing experience!!

placeInfo/address: Galle Road, Ahungalla 80562 Sri Lanka
text: I really liked the low level design of this hotel layout, with it's stunning, open reception, roofless courtyards with typical plants and tress, so you felt right in nature. That was one of it's selling points to me. I wanted a relaxing holiday and that's what I got staying here. I was very pleased with my room on the third floor, over looking the 'quiet pool' with the India Ocean in the back ground, it was a view to die for. My housekeeper Lasan kept my room very clean and tidy and entertained me each day with his towel origami and restock of bottled water.  I did have a minor issue at the beginning of my holiday in the Jutes restaurant with the waiting staff, as they are not assertive or aware enough when you sit at your table of asking you if you want water or drinks, I had to keep asking and I wasn't the only one (maybe more training needed?) but this was quickly sorted by Supervisor Chamuditha, whom I was very impressed with, by his professional manner of rectifying this issue and on my every visit to Jutes for the rest of my holiday I was well looked after by him or in his absence his colleague Supervisor Waruna. The buffet style layout is large over two areas with a lot of verity, which I found good and plentiful. I was on the All Inclusive package, which suited me, but  'Western Branded' alcohol is chargeable.  The evening entertainment was ok, but could be improved upon and there was no native entertainment. All, in all I have to say I really liked the relaxing vibe of this hotel and the staff's way of a slower pace of life, which you do have to get used to, but I do think they could take their customer service up a level, and it's not 'Western world' standard 5*, but it's very clean, comfortable and very unique in it's architecture and the staff were professional, polite, helpful and friendly.  For me personally, as a female solo traveller I felt very safe at all times.  Would I return? yes I would.
title: Just what I needed.
