roomTip: Take bug spray for evenings - go and enjoy!! Village farm visit (curd making and farm breakfast) was wonderful
text: Top top notch place !! A little bit of heaven on earth. From meeting Saduni on reception (lovely girl, couldn’t do enough to help you) through to Ishan who helped guide our village visit, and helped us at meal times (so friendly and helpful), to  chaminda (resident and truly wonderful naturist) every single member of the staff went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful visit. The glamping tents were SO comfortable- superbly comfortable bed, AC, loo, brilliant shower - everything and more that you could wish for - all the sounds of the outdoors, but in cosy luxury indoors!! The food was amazing - 7 courses and totally delicious. Lovely pool area, right close to lake, birds xx everywhere and land monitor lizards all around! We went on a couple of guided bird walks around the camp which we loved, and also went to Yala and were lucky enough to see a leopard close up, relaxed and personal!! What a thrill!! Great Spa on Stilts, too…. Cool and wonderfully tranquil and relaxing . If you get a chance to go to this camp - definitely go!!
title: A little bit of heaven on earth! We loved this place!

The staff organizes safari which are really nice. 
Calm and peaceful for everybody who wants to relax.
title: Just wonderful. Safari, relax, nice food. I can recommend this place. Wonderful

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Le personnel est attentionné et souriant. Toujours prêts à aider. Ma chambre était merveilleuse, très bien climatisée et le lit était très confortable. Les petites attentions comme les cocktail de bienvenu et le massage de bienvenue étaient super aussi. 

Tout était simple aucun stress. Très agréable. 
Félicitation

Ma chambre était très bien climatisée,
title: Je recommande c’était fantastique !

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Highly recommend this Eco lodge 
Beautiful tented lodges with every home comfort impeccably furnished and cleaned 
Fabulous staff who were not only professional but keen to please and warm. 
Experts in nature combined with lovely catering and service. 
Chef liked to dabble so expect some creative presentation as well as flavours! Enjoyed our bird walk / spotting even in the rain and a fun Jeep safari. Chammi the nature guide is also a good photographer so I could concentrate on looking 👀 rather than trying to take photos.
title: Exceptional experience!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Eine exzellente Lodge mit sehr freundlichen und aufmerksamen Personal. Wir haben den Aufenthalt genossen, wenn auch nur eine Nacht - im Rahmen unserer Rundreise eines Highlights.
Essen absolut spitze! Zelt modern eingerichtet.
Werden wiederkommen mit mehr Zeit...
Danke!
title: Exzellente Lodge

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do give yourself enough time to enjoy your surroundings.
text: We stayed overnight at the Flameback ecolodge and had a fabulous stay. We loved the luxury safari tent with en-suite facilities, the view over the lake watching the birds was delightful, the swimming pool was wonderfully warm. The staff were very attentive and the food delicious.
title: Delightful overnight stay.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Wunderschönes, traumhaft idyllisches Erlebnis! Absolut zuvorkommender Service! Romantisches und sehr leckeres Essen! Wunderschöne Aussichten und sehr komfortable Unterkunft, dennoch naturverbunden! Ein einmaliges Erlebnis!
title: Traumhafte Naturidylle

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful experience at Flameback, beautiful peaceful surroundings and outstanding attentive service and welcome from the team. We booked for 5 days and enjoyed having a base to explore the amazing wilderness and wildlife. Highly recommended.
title: Wonderful experience

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Das kleine aber feine Resort bietet aktuell 7 Zelte für einen komfortablen Glamping Urlaub. Die Zelte sind top ausgestattet (mit Dusche/WC getrennt, Klimaanlage u Tee/Kaffeekocher) u kleiner Terrasse mit herrlichem Blick über den See. Ein schöner großer Pool, ein Spa u ein Restaurant (auch Floating Restaurant wird angeboten) runden das Angebot ab. Die Mitarbeiter u das Management sind ausnehmend freundlich u zuvorkommend! Sehr empfehlenswert für alle, die die Natur nur durch ein Zeltdach getrennt erleben möchten, und trotzdem nicht auf einen wissen Komfort verzichten wollen.
title: Komfortables  Glamping Erlebnis direkt am See

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Großartig geführtes Glamping Erlebnis! Die Zelte sind mit WC und Dusche, Warmwasser, Airco, Ventilator, Café/Tee, WLAN ausgestattet! Sehr, sehr schöner langer Pool!
Alle Mitarbeiter extrem freundlich und erfüllen jeden Wunsch! Alles sehr comfortabel und trotzdem ein Hauch von Abenteuer!
title: Absolut empfehlenswert!!!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here when on a visit to Yala Safari for one night. The lodge was beautiful and the service excellent however, beware of the midges as is it around a large lake and there are No mosquito nets around the bed or around the open air restaurant.
title: Yala safari stop over

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Sehr freundliches Personal überall. Das Zeltzimmer ist mal was anderes vom Flair her.
Die Lage ist sehr schön und ruhig.
Das Essen hat uns sehr gut geschmeckt! Die Küche ist 1A!
Der Pool mit 31 Grad ist fein zum Schwimmen.
Gutes Internet(Wlan) am Gelände.
Leider wegen Safari müssten wir um 4:45 auschecken... sie haben für uns sogar ein nettes Lunch vorbereitet!!!
title: ein verstecktes Juwel am Natursee

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Highly recommend to get up early and watch the sunrise over the lake. If you’re interested, also join the bird watching tour.
text:
We arrived after the safari and were welcomed by the friendly staff. The accommodation was wonderful and had a great dinner. The tent had airconditioning, which was really needed due to the humid weather. All facilities (shower / toilet) were very clean. 

We were woken up by the birds…  They recommended to get up early to watch the sunrise and join the complementary bird watching tour. What a great recommendation and magical way to start your day. The breakfast that came after was a perfect closing of our visit.
title: A magical stay at the lake side

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Perfect location, superb food, excellent staff - what else can you ask?

The tents are super well equipped, located in front of the lake and close to Yala National Park. 

The running manager even surprised us with a cake for our honeymoon at dinner, they’re really kind and looking after a perfect customer service. Based on our experience, they achieved it: one of the best hotels we stayed at Sri Lanka (taking into consideration that we stayed overall in different luxury hotels around the island, incl. Jetwing, Amaya, etc).
title: Best quality stay within nature at Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: What a special place this is. From the moment we arrived we knew we had made a good decision staying here. It feels so different from the chain resorts just down the road.  Incredibly relaxed, attentive and friendly staff, amazing location right in the middle of the wildlife. We had two lodges as we were a family of 4 and they were well appointed. The food was excellent and there were a number of things the resort offered for free, like a foot massage, complementary cocktail, morning bird watching estate tour etc. We would happily have stayed longer but please remember you are in the natural habit of the monkeys, water buffalo, numerous beautiful birds. This is their home and it’s a privilege to share it with them, if you don’t like wildlife then look elsewhere.
title: A very special place

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Have a massage - he has magic hands!
text:
Tent beautiful and so clean! Staff lovely and helpful.

We stayed for one night, and enjoyed every minute of it. The tent is superbly set up, lovely big bed, toilet and shower with toiletries.
Food was delicious and the staff couldn’t do more for us. We had a lovely cocktail by the bonfire and great food and service in the restaurant.
title: Great place to stay!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
What an excellent experience! We stayed at Flameback Eco Lodge for 2 nights, and wished we could have stayed for longer. 

We got the Staffs' undivided attention. The Staff are incredibly professional, friendly and can not do enough to help you. The Chefs were outstanding - the menu caters for Western tastes, however if you ask him to cook locally he can let his colours shine and produce some exceptionally tasty curries and condiments if you can handle the spice.

The setting of Flameback Eco Lodge is on the lake shore and boasts a stunning array of wildlife in and around the the lodges (mongooses, water birds, monkeys, eagles. If you want to go further a field the hotel can arrange for dawn/dusk/all day Safaris to seek wildlife in the National Parks (leopard, elephants, buffalo, jungle fowl.....) The pictures displayed really are exactly what you can expect to get. As expected accommodation is modern, clean, tidy and full of personal touches. You will be spoil for choices of where you can dine (in your tent/private floating pod/communal terrace). The tents are very spacious excellently air conditioned, and feature immaculate fully plumbed bathrooms. 

We can't give enough praise and thanks to the team for making an especially memorable stay at Flameback Eco Lodge. I recommend bringing a decent camera and pair of binoculars with you!

Simon & Tamara.
title: Lovely stay under canvas experience  - surrounded by wildlife!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed one night @ Villa Rosa, Kandy during our Sri Lankan trip. The drive to the hotel is pretty steep but well worth it for the view. The view @ sunrise is stunning & you can have breakfast watching the mist rise from the river below. Breakfast was good but not enough variety. There was a nice fruit platter & eggs to order with toast but nothing else. Could be better for the price they charge. We stayed @ the Annexe overlooking the hills. The rooms are well designed with a large bathroom.
title: Gorgeous view @ sunrise

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room Tip: The rooms in the main hotel have the best views
text: Similar to an earlier reviewer, the moment we checked in here, I wished we had booked for longer than 2 nights.  There were six of us, four of whom had rooms in the annexe but all were spacious and with balconies and views.  Our view from the main hotel was just stunning, over the pool, the river and the countryside beyond; and it was so peaceful sitting on the balcony, just absorbing it all.  The owner took a great deal of trouble to show us round on arrival and there was plenty to enjoy, from the library on the first floor with its large open windows to the gardens and pool.  We also took a yoga class in the studio under the pool, which was spectacular as there was a rainstorm throughout and we were safely tucked away watching it come down outside.  The breakfasts were delcious as was the dinner we had on our first night, and the staff very efficient and helpful.  The hotel is a peaceful and cocooning retreat from the hustle and bustle of Kandy and we loved staying. I hope to be back one day!
title: Stunning retreat on the hills above Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: This is our 3rd time at Villa Rosa and it never disappoints. We always choose the Honeymoon suite because of its lovely big terrace that looks down onto Kandy and the river, which is magical at night. It’s a perfect escape (but near enough) from the hustle and bustle of Kandy. There is a lovely new pool to sit by which is heavenly. Delicious food and great staff, in true Sri Lankan style always happy and smiley - especial thanks as always to Nilanka Silva who always looks after us so well. Can highly recommend.
title: Peace and calm above Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
The views were outstanding coupled with fantastic accommodation and perfect service from the team this is a must visit if you are in Kandy.

The team couldn’t do any more to make our visit perfect including delicious food and drinks.

Outstanding 👍👍
title: Perfect Views

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The main house rooms have the best views
text:
Had a pleasant two night stay at this hotel
It is a beautiful colonial.house. We were in room 3 in the main house 
The main house rooms have the best views over the river 
Our room did not have a television but was large. There was not much storage to unpack our clothes   Tea and fresh coffee facilities. Desk and wifi. Lovely large bathroom with bath and shower. We didn’t use the bath as we found the hot water in the shower ran out fairly quickly and didn’t want to risk running a bath 
The pool was the highlight and in fact why we booked this hotel. It was new having been built within the last year. Fairly chilly but refreshing. And those views !!! We felt this hotel’s pricing was a little on the high side for the facilities but having the pool area, for us, made up for that.  
Not a huge choice of Sri Lankan food choices for dinner if you are staying here for a while but plenty to please if you are only staying a few days. 
Good service.
title: Beautiful view good service

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights at this lovely hotel which overlooked Kandy. The staff were so helpful and friendly and the food was delicious. We arrived at night, so it was a wonderful surprise to wake up to the amazing view, which I enjoyed painting (sam1_olivia on insta if you want to see more of Sri Lanka) A very peaceful, comfortable stay and would highly recommend.
title: Lovely stay in peaceful hilltop hotel

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: What a beautiful retreat this is, perched at the top of a steep hill, overlooking the river and far from the hustle and bustle of Kandy city centre (which is a short 5-10 min drive away). We slept so well on the 3 nights we were there and, after afternoon and evening rain, woke to the sun peeking through the early morning mist clearing above the river. The pool was lovely (if a bit “refreshing”! first thing). We chose the Sri Lankan breakfast each day, and ate in the hotel one night. The food was delicious. Our room (no 4) was upgraded as the hotel was quiet, so we had a huge bedroom and bathroom with tub. The service was polite and discrete. It was hard to leave.
title: Gorgeous relaxing oasis

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The hotel offer a free tuk tuk service into the town
text: We absolutely loved this friendly boutique hotel which was so warm and welcoming. The location is high above the city yet near to the centre. The views are beautiful. The service is really personal. We were upgraded when I mentioned to the friendly owner that it was our anniversary. The food is very good and the setting is very romantic. I would highly recommend this place.
title: This is a gem boutique hotel. Very personal service.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Steep small road heading up to it but we'll worth it
text: My husband and I stayed in the amazing honeymoon suite on our recent motorbike tour. WOW there are no words for how truly breathtaking this place really is. From bathing outdoors, to stunning views, to gorgeous wood furniture, great staff that took amazing care of us, and the Buddha out the bathroom window.
title: WOW

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Fantastic property in Kandy. Most beautiful views from the terrace and the hotel's swimming pool. Room very comfortable with great bathroom. Overall  - a lovely property in a beautiful setting. Very friendly staff and owner. 100% recommended.
title: Great stay

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bei Möglichkeit Zimmer im Haupthaus buchen. Aus unserer Sicht bieten die Zimmer einen schöneren Ausblick und sind etwas besser ausgestattet.
text:
Wir waren drei Nächte in der schönen Villa Rosa. Wir können den Besuch absolut weiterempfehlen. 

Besonders positiv aufgefallen ist uns:

- Der Blick von der Villa in das Flusstal des Mahaweli Ganga hinter Kandy ist grandios und lädt zum Verweilen und Entspannen auf den angrenzenden Terrassen oder im Pool ein.
- Die Zimmer im Haupthaus waren mit Tresor, Klimaanlage und Moskitonetz super ausgestattet und stilvoll eingerichtet. 
- Volker Bethke, der freundliche Gastgeber mit deutsch-hanseatischen Wurzeln, hat uns mit Tipps und Tricks bzgl. Kandy und lokalen Gepflogenheiten (z.B. Tuk-Tuk Preisen) versorgt.
- Die Freundlichkeit der Mitarbeiter, die aber durchaus auch verstanden, wenn man gerade mal nicht ausschweifende Gespräche sucht. Letzteres war in Sri Lanka manchmal schwierig zu finden. 
- Wir haben den Koch der Villa Rosa bei seinem Markteinkauf begleitet und viel über regionales Gemüse und Obst gelernt, das dann für den Abend frisch zubereitet wurde. Schöner kann man den lokalen Markt in Kandy nicht erleben. Man sollte sich nur nicht von den Verkäufern zu Einkäufen drängen lassen; nur weil der einheimische Koch dabei ist, bekommt man nicht unbedingt faire Preise.
title: Herzliche Gastfreundschaft mit tollem Ausblick

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Der Aufenthalt in diesem feinen kleinen Hotel war ein einziger Genuss! Für mich die schönsten Tage unserer 3 wöchigen Sri Lanka Reise.

Alles hier atmet Heiterkeit und Schönheit, ich kann es nicht weniger poetisch ausdrücken.
Der Blick über den Fluss ist spektakulär und der Sonnenuntergang schlicht atemberaubend. 
Jedes Detail in der Villa Rosa ist mit Bedacht und Schönheitssinn ausgewählt, von den Möbel aus antikem Holz über den wundeschönen Pool (kühl, bietet tatsächlich Erfrischung) bis hin zu stets frischgewaschenen Baumwollsets beim Essen. 

Das landestypische oder westliche Frühstück und Essen ist hervorragend und wird an Tischen serviert, von denen jeder den fantastischen Blick bietet, abends sehr stimmungsvoll bei Kerzenlicht.

Der Hausherr kümmert sich charmant und mit hanseatischer Zurückhaltung um seine Gäste.

Wir hatten eine große Familiensuite mit riesigem Bad.

Bei der Buchung darauf achten, dass die Zimmer in der (günstigeren) Dependance den Blick in die andere Richtung haben!

Wir fanden das Boutiquehotel insgesamt noch schöner als auf den Fotos, ein Genuß für Ästheten!
title: Ein Traum!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Questo posto ci ha incantati!
Dislocato su una collina di Kandy siamo arrivati ed appena entrati siamo stati rapiti da questa vista mozzafiato! 
Il posto è magico...veramente.
Il personale è attento e cortese.
Ristorante buonissimo.
Le camere belle, spaziose e pulite.
L'unico problema è che ci siamo fermati una sola notte.
Consigliatissimo
title: Che vista!!!!!!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: A highlight of our trip, this gorgeous boutique villa was a favourite.  The host Volker is so welcoming and accommodating and the service from the staff the best in our trip.  Special thanks to Dillon who took care of us so well.  Beautiful Sri Lankan breakfast and dinner, and stunning infinity pool overlooking river, away from hustle and bustle.  Rooms very authentic and charming.  Amazing sunsets.  A must stay when you are in Kandy.  Thank you so much ❤️❤️
title: PERFECT STAY IN KANDY

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We arrived at Villa Rosa at the end of July 23. A family with four children to celebrate my 40th birthday. The place is perfect! The view is breathtaking! Ilanka the cook cooks wonderful food according to the guests' request! and hosted us perfectly with personal attention. He picks the ingredients from the large vegetable garden on site and prepares simply divine food! He prepared vegan Western food for the children and for us an excellent vegan Sri Lankan meal! You can connect there with nature, and the Sri Lankan story. The pool with the beautiful view was my children's favorite place in the hotel. This is a boutique hotel with personal attention. A wonderful experience! In addition, the hotel is clean and polished and gives a homey feeling. The peace that the hotel offers cannot be found anywhere else. Highly recommend!
title: Dont miss!

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This place is quite amazing. It’s a little out if the way but still close to the centre of the city. It’s position is the real blessing though because it generates a quiet calm atmosphere. 

Our room was beautiful. Comfortable and well appointed. The property is sensational and the views are unbeatable. The meals were also like a fine restaurant. Imagine eating a top notch dinner with an unbeatable view…we are lucky to have experienced it.

To top it off the service was outstanding. Attentive and professional but not overbearing. You should absolutely stay at Villa Rosa.
title: A beautiful property with an incredible view.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
As soon as we set eyes on Villa Rosa we were blown away. A beautiful house with friendly staff, and a quietly luxurious, wooden floored  connecting family room. The views from our balcony were insane.

Swimming pool is fresh and probably has one of the best views of any pool in the world. And the food - lunch was good from the a la carte menu but the thali dinner was simply sublime and one of the best of the holiday. Fish curry in particular delicious. Breakfast by contrast probably the weakest of the places we stayed but still absolutely fine.

Volker was incredibly friendly and always checked in on us to find out our plans or to chat. Really nice, cheerful man. He has a stunning place that he is rightly proud of.

Kids absolutely loved roaming around (table tennis table a nice plus!) and were made at home by all the staff. Our van driver could never get up the hill so the lovely staff would happily take out the tuk tuk to run us to town or drop us at the bottom of the hill. On our last day they even ran us down in the awesome old Beetle!! 

Location is excellent for both seeing Kandy and surrounding areas. 3 nights was a perfect length of stay - Kandy itself probably doesn’t warrant a vast amount of time but Villa Rosa is a treat and there are some lovely places to drive to for the day. 

Children were initially scared of the dogs but they are in fact the cutest, most friendly animals around. A pleasure to share the house with!! 

Highly, highly recommended, and amazing value for the quality on offer.
title: Fantastically good

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: What an oasis of calm away from bustling busy Kandy!  Perched high above the town with fantastic views, it was lovely to relax after a busy day.   Volker, the owner has really created a great hotel with fantastic service, food and lovely interiors.  The great reviews (my brother in law came here 10 years ago and it was fab then too) are much deserved as a lot of love has gone into this hotel.  Recommend highly!
title: Oasis of calm

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book the Honeymoon Suite! It's a stunning room with an outdoor tub and gorgeous view of the sunsets!
text: Oh wow! From the moment our three-wheeler dropped us off at the top of the hill at Villa Rosa, we knew we were in for a treat. The views are spectacular and our room was incredible (book the Honeymoon Suite! You get your own outdoor patio and tub which we  enjoyed watching the sunset every evening with a glass of wine). The team at Villa Rosa were very friendly and attentive. After helping us arrange a fun day of touring the highlights of Kandy, we relaxed by the gorgeous pool. We loved going through the extensive library of books (especially on the birds of Sri Lanka!) and wished that we could have extended our stay a bit longer at this magnificent oasis. Thank you to the team at Villa Rosa for making our stay so special!
title: An Oasis with a View

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Very comfortable stay in a luxurious house over the river near Kandy with a beautiful view, great breakfast by the house chef, great service by the very attentive personal and a friendly German host.
Well worth the price if you need a place to recover from the busy streets of Kandy.
title: Luxurious stay far above the busy streets of Kandy

text:
This was one of our favourite hotels of our trip.
All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a deluxe room and it was perfect!
The view out from the balcony was breath taking and it was a great place to sit and chill. The breakfast and evening buffet was excellent, lots of choice.
We went to the roof top bar in the evening and again the views were amazing and so were the cocktails!

text: We really had a nice time at this beautiful hotel. food,rooms and mostly the hospitality and the customer care is amazing we would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. The in house service was pretty fast and they helped us with technical issues as well pretty fast.

text: Had the most relaxing time in our journey here and the place is really wonderful. The staff are friendly and the food is amazing, all complemented by the view of the city and hillside. The rooms had an ample amount of space and in house service was really fast as well.
title: Simple and Relaxing!

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Maybe eat elsewhere
text:
We stayed in the Grand Serendib for one night on our tour of Sri Lanka. 

Firstly the stay was great. Checkin wonderful, the room was really spacious and clean, with fantastic views over Kandy from the balcony. 
The infinity pool was fabulous but too cold for swimming in the day we visited. 

The restaurant however was not up to try same standard. One of the meals we ordered was a burger which arrived cold. We complained and it came back seconds later, but clearly the whole plate had been microwaved as the coleslaw was now also warm. The restaurant needs to be brought up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel.
title: Hotel great. Restaurant ok

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: I had the pleasure of enjoying the high tea, and it was absolutely delicious! The selection of  sandwiches, pastries, and desserts was top-notch, with something for every taste. A thank you to Sujith, the Restaurant Manager, for his friendly and welcoming service. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to indulge in a wonderful  experience!
title: HIGH TEA BUFFET

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: #12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Grand Serendib is a lovely hotel. The staff are friendly and efficient, the view from the infinity pool and the bar areas is amazing. 
The bedrooms are spacious with great showers. The whole ambience is quite luxurious.
Breakfast very nice, and we particularly enjoyed the evening buffet, all the food was well cooked and well flavoured.
title: A lovely 3 night stay at The Grand Serendib

This hotel really surprised us. As a family group of 12, our needs are difficult to meet but the GSH really worked for us. 
It is compact and has a very tight entry. However, the public spaces are good, rooms are bright and spacious and the hill-top views are fantastic.
 We found the staff very professional and helpful.
 We basically stayed in 5 star hotels but found that the GSH provided superior service and better eating options than other pricier hotels.
 The position is not great ...but Candy is a bit like that. There is no real hotel strip and it is very hilly.
title: A LOVELY SURPRISE

Love galle fort!

text: An extraordinary accomplishment. This 7 floored building is deceptive as it sits quietly within the landscape. Unobtrusive yet magnificent in so many ways. Another splendid example of the brilliance of Sri Lankan architect, Geoffrey Bawa, whose designs were driven by a wish to sit a building within nature. Natural light and natural ventilation are found in general areas while the bedrooms have AC as required . The hotel is full of  furniture he designed which again displays an elegant simplicity.  There are 3 swimming pools all cleverly located including one which is built on a rock.

ownerResponse/text: Dear Peter …Thank you for your heartfelt and honest feedback. We truly appreciate your kind words about the unique landscape architecture, the tranquility of the surroundings, and the opportunity to unwind at our pools, each with its own charm. The experience of having resident monkeys visit your balcony must have been quite a delight. We’re glad our team’s quick response helped resolve your room issue and that their warm hospitality made your stay more enjoyable. It’s also great to hear that you found the bar pricing reasonable and that your transport arrangements were handled smoothly. While the hotel’s popularity draws many visitors eager to experience its distinctive design, we understand that this may not always suit those seeking complete privacy, and we appreciate your understanding.  Your feedback regarding the dining options on the second and third nights has been noted, and we will certainly review how we can enhance both variety and quality. Continuous improvements are always in progress to ensure our facilities align with evolving guest expectations while preserving the character that makes Heritance Kandalama so special. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for recommending us as a place to visit. We would be delighted to welcome you again and ensure your stay is just as wonderful and filled with cherished memories. Warm Regards, General Manager

roomTip: Book early as it sells out due to large tour groups. Take the half board option, and try to secure a room in the Sigiriya wing.
text:
We stayed three nights in a Luxury Room in the Sigiriya Wing. The Heritance Kandalama is a massive and incredibly unique hotel - over 900 metres from one end of the Dambulla wing to the other end of the Sigiriya wing. 

The hotel is incredibly popular with large tourist groups (coaches and coaches worth) so if you are planning to stay here, book very early. We had a lot of difficulty securing a room at the hotel and were unable to book directly as they were sold out. We secured a room via a third party site, but not the one we were hoping for. We were on the third floor and had a partial lake and Sigiriya view. 

We had an issue with our room upon arrival (despite at least five pre arrival emails to the hotel), however it was resolved quite quickly after check in. 

The rooms are dated, but very comfortable and with good amenities. Everything worked fine and the AC and the bedding were great. The different types of resident monkeys visited our balcony and outside our bathroom daily which we quite enjoyed. 

The property and gardens / landscaping are beautiful and extremely unique. The infinity pool has incredible views over the lake and towards Sigiriya and the rooftop pool with the base of the pool the bed rock the hotel is built on is extremely unique and very cool. 

As the hotel has so many tour groups, it is very busy early in the mornings and in the evening, but super quiet and peaceful during the day when they are out.

We did the half board option which is highly advisable considering the isolated lakeside location. Breakfast was great every day, even when very busy with a good range of options. Dinner was great the first night, however the quality and range of options was a little poor on the second and third nights. 

We arranged transport out to Sigiriya for sunrise and for an elephant safari through the hotel and both were fantastic with good quality drivers and vehicles.

We found all staff at the hotel absolutely exceptional and friendly. The hotel bar charges in rupees which makes drink prices quite reasonable. 

We would absolutely recommend the Heritance Kandalama and really enjoyed our stay.
title: Heritance Kandalama brilliance

ownerResponse/text: Dear Gjoz…. It’s wonderful to hear that your return to Heritance Kandalama after nearly two decades was just as enjoyable as you remembered. We’ll be sure to pass along your kind words to the gentleman working on the lacquered railings near room 407—our team members love sharing their craftsmanship and anecdotes that make our property unique with guests. We truly appreciate your support and look forward to welcoming you back whenever the opportunity arises. Warm Regards, General Manager

ownerResponse/text: Dear Ruth and Priya,….Thank you so much for sharing your wonderful experience at Heritance Kandalama. We’re thrilled to hear that your stay was such a memorable part of your Sri Lankan journey. We’re especially glad that the architecture, food, and service remain such a cherished memory. It’s great to know that you enjoyed the natural beauty surrounding the hotel, including the pools, wildlife, and stunning sunsets. We’re also delighted to hear that your cultural experiences, such as walking with the monk and exploring the historical sites, were meaningful and spiritually enriching. We truly appreciate your kind words about our staff and their commitment to providing you with excellent service. It’s wonderful to hear that their hospitality made your stay even more special. We hope to welcome you back to Heritance Kandalama for another unforgettable experience in the future. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Heritance Kandalama was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka, and we left with a deep sense of appreciation for this unique and beautiful hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were in awe of the striking architecture—this hotel is truly one of the most beautiful buildings we’ve ever seen. Designed by the legendary Geoffrey Bawa, it is perfectly sympathetic to the surrounding forest, blending seamlessly with nature and offering breathtaking views at every turn.

The food at Heritance Kandalama was amazing—a brilliant buffet. The variety was exceptional, and the quality was even better. We particularly loved the hoppers, daal, and the delicious selection of breads and fruits. There were also plenty of international food options for those who wanted them, ensuring that everyone’s tastes were satisfied. Every meal felt like a treat, and we enjoyed trying the local specialties every day.

The hotel’s three pools were a highlight, with the infinity pool offering the most breathtaking views of the nearby lake. It was the perfect place to unwind and take in the serene, peaceful surroundings. The entire hotel felt like an oasis—lush, beautiful, and incredibly calming. We spent time relaxing by the pools, soaking in the views, and enjoying the natural beauty all around us.

The nature surrounding the hotel is extraordinary. We loved watching the monkeys play and observing the wild birds that seemed to be everywhere. The sounds of the forest added a peaceful ambiance, making it easy to relax and feel truly connected to the environment. And the sunsets! They were simply incredible, casting a golden glow over the lake and the forest, creating a memory we’ll cherish forever.

The service at Heritance Kandalama was another standout feature. The staff were brilliant—professional, friendly, and attentive. They clearly take pride in their work and are great ambassadors for the hotel. This was our first experience of Sri Lanka, and we couldn’t have been made to feel more welcome. The staff were not only helpful but also genuinely interested in us, always going the extra mile to make sure we were comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and their warm hospitality made our stay even more memorable.

We also had the privilege of experiencing some incredible nearby attractions. One of the standout experiences was walking with a monk. This meditation experience, where we visited caves and received the monk’s wisdom on the side of a mountain, was truly moving. It was a privilege to be in such a breathtaking setting and learn about Sri Lankan culture and spirituality.

We also climbed Sigiriya and Pidurangala, both of which were unmissable. While the sites can be crowded, the views from the top, especially at sunset, were absolutely worth it. The Dambulla caves, with their ancient and solemn atmosphere, made us feel like we were stepping back in time. The sense of history surrounding us was palpable, and we felt privileged to visit these sacred places.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama provided the perfect setting for a peaceful retreat—luxurious, connected to nature, and full of exceptional experiences. The combination of striking design, amazing food, brilliant service, and the chance to connect with nature made this stay unforgettable. We absolutely loved every moment and can’t wait to return. 

Ruth and Priya
title: Beautiful setting; extraordinary hotel

ownerResponse/text: Dear Niran….. It is truly heartening to hear that Heritance Kandalama continues to hold its magic for you, even after so many years. Welcoming returning guests like you is always special for us and knowing that you enjoyed everything from our warm hospitality and flavorful cuisine to the serene natural beauty surrounding us is deeply rewarding. Your mention of the hoppers, lively wildlife, and those timeless moments of carrom and arrack under the evening melodies perfectly describe the uniqueness of this enchanting place. We are delighted that these experiences resonated with you once again. We look forward to welcoming you back for yet another memorable stay. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
This is the fourth time I've stayed here over the course of about 30 years and I found it to be as magical as ever.

The service was warm and attentive from the moment we arrived and the food was outstanding (possibly the best hoppers we had on our trip and we had a lot).

Wonderful moments included watching monkeys cavorting and birds of prey swooping with Sigiriya in the distance, playing carrom on the terrace and drinking arrack listening to the evening piper.

We will certainly be back
title: Idyllic

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest….Thank you so much for your kind and thoughtful review! We're absolutely delighted to hear that you had such a memorable experience at Heritance Kandalama. The stunning design by Geoffrey Bawa, combined with the beautiful surroundings, truly makes this place a one-of-a-kind destination, and we're so glad it left a lasting impression on you. Our team takes great pride in offering a personalized and attentive service, so it warms our hearts to know that you felt well taken care of. We would love to welcome you back anytime, and we look forward to creating more wonderful memories for you. Thank you again for your recommendation, and we can't wait to host you again in the future. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are travelling as a family. Ask for extra beds to be put in your room.
text: Lovely in all areas. The building itself is a  fabulous experience. Designed by Jeffrey Bawa,the godfather of "tropical modernism" Set in an incredible forest location by a lake. The staff are charming and are constantly attentive to you on a nicely personal level. I would happily go back here again. X
title: Highly recommend ❤️

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest…���Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are absolutely thrilled to hear that Heritance Kandalama played such an important role in making your wedding a truly unforgettable experience. We are deeply honored that you chose our hotel to celebrate this special occasion and that the natural beauty, design, and hospitality exceeded your expectations. It warms our hearts to hear that the views, the staff, and the food were all highlights of your stay, and we are grateful for your kind words about Gamini, Dimuth, and the entire team. They are truly dedicated to ensuring every guest feels cared for, and we will be sure to pass along your compliments to them. The stunning surroundings, from the glass bathrooms to the vibrant wildlife, are a unique part of what makes Heritance Kandalama so special, and we’re so glad you and your guests were able to experience them firsthand. We cannot wait to welcome you back for another visit, hoping to help you and your loved ones create many more beautiful memories at Heritance Kandalama. Warm Regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book early if you're traveling during peak tourist season, this hotel books up quickly.
text:
That is how every single guest at our wedding described Heritance Kandalama. We're American, and were bringing a signficant number of folks from the West who had never seen Sri Lanka. I wanted to show off the island, and chose this hotel, sight unseen. The fact that architect Geoffrey Bawa designed it and it's a sustainable building were big sells, but I had my fingers crossed that this would be the place that I hoped it be. The minute we drove up to the hotel, jaws dropped. People were speechless at the views. Truly "one in a lifetime" surroundings with views of the UNESCO world site, Sigirya Rock. But what made this place so special was the staff, and how deeply they cared about making this an incredible experience for us and our guests. Gamini and Dimuth and all the staff took meticulous care in ensuring the food was perfect and the ceremony location was the best the hotel had to offer. The food here is amongst the best on the island, guests could not stop raving about the options and the chef's skill. The rooms were again, specatcular. The bathrooms are all glass and set in the jungle, so you'll often have monkeys flying about you as you bathe. 

It's one of the most stunning places on earth, and it'd be a shame to go your whole life without seeing this absolutely wonderous place. We were so blessed to have our wedding here. If I could give more than 5 stars I would. This was a trip of a lifetime, I cannot wait to go back.
title: The Wedding "Of--A-Lifetime"

ownerResponse/text: Dear Shyamala …. Thank you for choosing Heritance Kandalama for your recent family holiday. We are truly grateful for your kind feedback and are delighted to hear that your stay was made so memorable by the service provided by Mr. Shantha Kumar Cruize.  It warms our hearts to know that Shantha's attentiveness and personalized care enhanced your experience and that you were able to enjoy the breathtaking views from the Royal Suite. We believe in providing exceptional service to all of our guests, and it’s wonderful to hear that you felt that throughout your stay. We sincerely appreciate your compliments about the food, the staff, and the overall cleanliness of the hotel. Your thoughtful words are a great encouragement to our team, and we look forward to welcoming you and your family back for many more memorable stays in the future. Warm regards, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I went recently on a holiday to the Heritance Kandalama Hotel in Dambulla, Sri Lanka. What made our stay memorable was the absolutely amazing service that we received from Mr Shantha Kumar Cruize, the Manager at the Hotel. He was attentive to our every need and would greet us every day with a charming smile inquiring how our stay at the hotel had been and whether there was anything the staff could do to enhance our experience. We had booked rooms with a 360 degree panoramic view but because we were on a lower floor, the view we had was of the surrounding jungle. When I discussed this with Shantha, he was very receptive, and imagine our amazement when we found that he had upgraded us to the Royal Suite free of charge. The marvellous views from our suites were absolutely breath taking and has given us such wonderful memories of our holiday at Kandalama. In addition, the food was delicious, the attention from the staff was par excellence, the hotel was clean and spotless and I would without doubt state that this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.
Shantha has worked at the Heritance Kandalama Hotel for many years and is an absolute credit to the organisation that manages the hotel. It is the amazing personalised service that he provides to guests that makes them come again and again in order to have a wonderful and memorable holiday.
title: Thank you Shantha Kumar Cruize (Manager)

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for sharing your lovely experience. It’s a joy to know that you felt truly connected with nature during your stay. The forest surroundings create a unique and engaging atmosphere, and we’re glad you enjoyed it. It’s also wonderful to hear that our diverse dining options, cleanliness, and sleep quality met your expectations. We’d love to welcome you back for another stay in the heart of nature. Warm Regards, General Manager

text: It was a wonderful feeling to feel mingled with nature in the forest. The restaurant's open buffet meals and breakfast were rich. The cleanliness was very good. Sleep quality is full marks. If we come again, we will definitely stay again...
title: essence in nature

text:
We had a truly memorable experience at the iconic Galle Face Hotel in Colombo today. The setting is absolutely stunning — a perfect blend of colonial charm and seaside elegance. We especially enjoyed the high tea on the terrace, with breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean and the gentle sea breeze adding to the ambience.

A special mention goes to Krishma, who made our high tea experience even more exceptional. She was warm, attentive, and incredibly professional — ensuring that everything ran smoothly and that we felt well taken care of throughout. Her thoughtful service really stood out and added a personal touch to an already wonderful afternoon.

Galle Face Hotel continues to uphold its reputation for timeless elegance and outstanding hospitality. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Colombo!
title: A Perfect High Tea by the Sea – Thanks to Krishma!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Esteemed Guest,
​
We are truly grateful for your gracious review. It brings us immense joy to know that your visit with us was a memorable one.

Your kind words will be shared with Natheela and the entire team—they will be deeply honored by your recognition.

We would be delighted to welcome you back for another indulgent escape. During your next visit, we invite you to explore our signature dining destinations: 1864, Fire Beach, and Traveler’s Bar—each offering a curated culinary journey, thoughtfully designed to reflect the elegance and spirit of GFH.

We are also thrilled to share a glimpse of what’s new: our beloved King of the Mambo has undergone an inspired transformation and is reopened with renewed Cuban charm and flair. Likewise, Fire Beach has being reimagined to elevate your seaside dining experience to extraordinary new heights.

We eagerly await the pleasure of your return, where luxury, warmth, and exquisite experiences await.

With sincere appreciation,

Noel – GFH

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka

roomTip: They do not have drivers quarters. However, they recommend a near by place for drivers.
text:
Me and my husband spend a day at Theva as part of our honey moon trip. We stayed in the suit with a spectacular view of Kandy. The ambience of the residence is very calm and quiet making us wanting to stay more. The room had a Jacuzzi where we could enjoy a hot bath with a splendid view from the window. The bathroom was very spacious and was in very good quality. The bed was very comfortable. I want specifically mention about their food. The food we had from Theva was the best we had in our trip. We specifically tried their iconic Sri Lankan rice and 17 curries menu. Also we tried avocado ice cream with the recommendation of the restaurant manager and it was very good. The food was very tasty and highly recommended. The service provided by the staff is commendable.  They even helped us to find accomodation for our driver. If you are look for a calm and quiet experience with good food, we highly recommend Theva.
Thank you again Theva for the flavourful food and amazing service
title: A serenity with flavourful food

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
During my recent getaway to Sri Lanka, I found sanctuary at Theva. From the friendly welcome to the cozy rooms with stunning views, every moment was a pleasure.

The food was a highlight, offering a taste of authentic Sri Lankan cuisine made with fresh ingredients. Whether lounging by the pool or enjoying a bath with a view, relaxation was effortless.

Conveniently located, the hotel was a perfect base for exploring nearby attractions with helpful staff arranging tours. Overall, my stay was a peaceful escape filled with warm hospitality, making it a definite recommendation for anyone visiting Sri Lanka.
title: Overnight stay in Theva

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
My wife and I spent the night at Theva as we had to attend a wedding at another hotel in the vicinity.

We stayed in a Superior Room, which was spacious and nice with a great view of the City.

The lady at the reception walked us down to our room and gave us a complete briefing of the facilities.

In addition when we returned from our wedding in the early hours of the morning a staff member was waiting to greet us with our bed time chocolates.

A beautiful view greeted us in the morning and we opted to sit out on our balcony and have breakfast in our room. The breakfast was well presented and delicious, with nice little touches to the scrambled eggs and omelet we requested.

A Great experience overall
title: A Short but Enjoyable nights stay

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: This place is nice but I would not say it’s a five star hotel.  Three star maximum.  The best part about the hotel is the scenery and the quiet - away from Kandy.  The food served at breakfast and dinner is really good however the prices for dinner compared to other places we’ve stayed at during our travels of Sri Lanka, is really expensive.  The pool area was much smaller than it looks in the pictures.  There was no gym or spa.  The place is basic.  The staff and scenery are the best bits.  We stayed here while visiting Kandy.  If we came again to Sri Lanka, I would by pass Kandy completely.  It’s noisy, busy with traffic and full of people ready to scam you at every opportunity.
title: Friendly staff, great views, expensive food, not 5*

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
今回で2回目の滞在になります。スリランカの古都キャンディーの丘の上にある景色のすばらしいホテルです。町の中心地からもトゥクトゥクで5分ほどですが、静かに滞在ができる大人なブティックホテルです。

創作料理のお料理も、お値段リーズナブルな上どれも美味しく満足できます。何よりもマネジメントがしっかりしているからか、メンテナンスが行き届き、ホテル全体がとても綺麗で、スタッフのサービスも洗練されており、ストレスなく気持ちよく滞在できます。

地域の伝統工芸やローカルアーティストの作品が所々にあり、迷路の様な敷地内を散策するのも楽しいです。アート付きの方にもおすすめです。
title: ロケーションはもちろん、設備とサービスが行き届いた素晴らしいホテル

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: When were driven up the long windy road from Kandy I was sceptical. However the journey was worth it. The hotel is delightfully decorated and the scenery lovely. The food and service, however absolutely FIRST Class. Our waiter, Wasantha was charming and very attentive.
title: Fabulous boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: What a gem of a find in the hills just outside of Kandy. The staff couldn’t do enough for us and from the moment we arrived we felt at home. Our room (14) was spotless and spacious, with a very comfortable bed and allowing incredible views across the landscape over the city. The food was terrific and would echo previous comments that you have to try the 17 dish Sri Lankan curry experience. The restaurant manager recommended we share between two and we’re very glad we did as the portion for one is huge! Compliments must go to the chef for the cuisine and to all the wonderful staff  for their fantastic, helpful service.
title: Wonderful stay in the hills of Kandy

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: Troisième étape de notre circuit au Sri Lanka , nous y sommes restés deux nuits . Nous lui attribuons une note de 4/5 , dont 5/5 pour la partie restauration et 3/5 pour la chambre . A y réflechir , il y a sûrement de meilleurs options pour le logement sur les nombreuses collines de Kandy mais la restauration restera un grand moment de nos vacances , en particulier le dîner de la Saint Valentin ( 13,000 roupies net de taxes à deux ... ie  40 euros ) . Le repas du midi et les petits déjeuners étaient excellents avec un choix continental ou local . La chambre quant a elle s'est révélée assez bruyante , en particulier avec les équipes de nettoyage qui ont démarré très tôt le matin (  7h ) et n'ont pas arrêté de parler très fort au lieu de nettoyer la chambre contigue . Aussi la décoration et le mobilier sont très très minimaliste me faisant penser à un mobilier IKEA recyclé . Ceci dit , comme toujours au Sri Lanka le personnel est très aimable et attentif . Autre point négatif , pas de Spa à l'hôtel ( possibilité de faire venir un masseur pour une personne ... donc pas extra lorsque on est en couple ) . Le vue est belle mais rien de plus spectaculaire que des autres hôtels ou restaurants sur les hauteurs de Kandy . Il y a également sauna et petite piscine à disposition que nous n'avons pas essayé
title: Allez y pour le restaurant , pas nécessairement pour y dormir ...

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The staff make this place a joy to stay, the restaurant Manager is a delight, always smiling and will do anything to please. But what makes this place sir isl is its cuisine, we loved the food here, the Sri Lankan 17 dish spread is highly recommended and plenty feed 2 people.  The ginger cake is the best we’ve tasted.  In addition the place is spotless. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel up high in hills with fantastic views over the mountains. Having visited Kandy we were so pleased we were staying away from the noisy centre.
title: Haven up in the Hills

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd

roomTip: Walk down to Kandy and get a tuk tuk back
text: We spent two nights at Theva as part of our honeymoon trip and would highly recommend this hotel if staying in Kandy. It’s a great location, out of the hustle and bustle of Kandy itself and offers amazing views of the city. The hotel itself is clean, the staff can not do enough for you and the food was excellent, a great selection and very reasonable; the Sri Lankan breakfast is a must. The pool area offered great views of the mountains whilst cooling off in the infinity pool. The room we had was a junior suite and it was very clean and comfortable with incredible views of Kandy; great shower and comfortable bed. If we could have stayed longer we would have and would highly recommend the tropic thunder cocktail whilst watching the sunset.
title: An absolute find in Kandy, away from the busy city

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka

text: Our stay at Theva was fantastic! The cozy and unique room with a jacuzzi and an open window offering a stunning view of Kandy, a delightful infinity pool, and the delicious food, skillfully crafted by the chef with attention to detail, made our one-day visit memorable. The thoughtful staff even brought us some sweets before bedtime. Highly recommend it!
title: Wonderful Stay

text: 10 Minuten oberhalb von Kandy, gut geeignet für einen Zwischenstopp auf einer Rundreise. Tolle Zimmer - hatten Room 1 mit diesem vorstehenden Wohnzimmer, ein riesiges Zimmer - mit sehr schöner Aussicht und freundlichem Service. Essen im Restaurant sehr gut. Das Hotel ist ruhig gelegen und mit rund 12 Zimmern eher klein. Aber auch der Zahn der Zeit nagt an diesem Hotel, gewisse Instandstellungsarbeiten müssten zwingend gemacht werden.
title: perfekte Aussicht

text:
We spent two nights at the Theva whilst touring Sri Lanka.
A stunning setting nestling in the hills.
Large spacious rooms, that do need a little tlc and updating.
That said what made me give this 5 stars was the fabulous food in the restaurant. We had the best meal during our 14 day stay here, 17 curries dish. Even breakfast was a work of art.
The staff were very friendly and attentive to all our needs.
title: Amazing restaurant

text: Very friendly staff, great food but the building itself is very tired with damp issues - mold on the walls and appliances. Looks like it's not been renovated since 80s. Even bedding felt a bit damp. A dehumidifier in each room should be a must. Food was good and staff were amazing.
title: Amazing staff and food but the place is quite worn out

text: This beautiful hotel is nestled at the top of a mountain with amazing views. It is like heaven on Earth! The Theva Residency was our favorite place we stayed on our 2 month trip.

text:
Boutique lux hotel on the slopes of Hanthana mountain facing the Kandy town and surrounding mountains… it was a breathtaking view whole day.. 

Book a suit if you can, for this splendid view with the jacuzzi.. they also have a sauna n a pool.. and the meals were nice specially the Sri Lankan breakfast..

Staff was super nice and helpful.. always check on what they can do to improve your stay..
title: Breathtaking view all day long

text: Great place to stay, amazing views. Staff so easy going. Our aircon didn’t work and we got upgraded. We were happy to stay at Theva restaurant both nights, would highly recommend 16 curry meal 10/10 bets food we’ve had.
title: Great stay, food was amazing

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Stayed at Theva this weekend with my family, what an absolute slice of heaven. 

My wife and I are returning after a few years, and the staff are friendly as ever, the food was delicious, and oh that view 😍 

We thoroughly enjoyed our albeit short stay, went for a walk in the environs and took a stroll to the top of the hill which boasted spectacular view and came back to the property for a wonderfully chilled swim in their private pool 🥰 

Theva truly offers a serene and tranquil atmosphere that is perfect for a relaxing getaway. 

The lush greenery surrounding the property adds to the overall charm and beauty of the place. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, providing a cozy retreat after a day of exploring. 

The attention to detail and personalised service at Theva is truly exceptional. Whether it's arranging for a romantic dinner or helping with local sightseeing recommendations, the staff goes above and beyond to ensure a memorable experience for their guests.
title: Slice of heaven in Kandy

placeInfo/address: Yaddehimulla Rd, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel! The room was spotlessly clean and well-maintained, creating a very comfortable and relaxing environment. The staff truly went above and beyond—Aslam, Kasuni, Dulakshi, Janith, and Farhan were all exceptionally friendly, attentive, and helpful throughout our stay. One of the highlights was a delicious pork curry they specially prepared for us, even though it wasn’t on the menu—such a thoughtful gesture that made our experience even more memorable. Highly recommend this place for both the service and hospitality!
title: Exceptional Service and a Memorable Stay!

placeInfo/address: Yaddehimulla Rd, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a huge property with upscale finishes and excellent staff.  On arrival, we had been assigned a room by the elevator so requested a change.  This was ably handled by Akila at the front office.

There is a large pool as well as a beach area that is roped off for guests only, free yoga classes at set times, spa, beach bar, etc.  the buffet offerings are plentiful and varied.
title: Great amenities and Staff

roomTip: All good, nothing bad !
text:
Exceptional Experience at Araliya Resort and Spa - Unawatuna

I arrived at Araliya Resort and Spa on the 2nd of July, and my first impression was absolutely wonderful. The front desk team was very friendly, and the welcome I received was warm and professional. I would especially like to highlight Akila from the reception—he was exceptionally friendly and provided outstanding service from the moment I arrived.

The check-in process was smooth, and the escort from the lobby to the room was superb. It was truly the best service I’ve ever experienced. The Food & Beverage team was also very proactive, and the food at the Olive Restaurant was fantastic.

I highly recommend this hotel to both locals and foreigners traveling to Unawatuna. It offers great value for money and an unforgettable hospitality experience.

Thank you once again to the team at Araliya Resort and Spa for exceeding my expectations!
title: Exceptional Experience at Araliya Resort and Spa - Unawatuna

placeInfo/address: Mahawaskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a wonderful day out at Mermaid Hotel and Club! The property is clean, well-maintained, and offers a truly relaxing atmosphere. A special mention goes to Dinushika at the reception—she was very welcoming and helpful throughout our visit. The staff at the buffet were also attentive and courteous, making the experience even more enjoyable.

The food was delicious with a good variety to choose from. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. The beach nearby is stunning—beautifully clean and perfect for a peaceful walk or just to relax by the sea.

Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and we’ll definitely be coming back! Highly recommended.
title: Excellent!

placeInfo/address: Mahawaskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a wonderful 2-night stay at Mermaid hotel. The hotel was maintained excellently by the staff and all of them were really helpful. The rooms were clean. It had a large bathroom. The food was great. The chef and the restaurant staff were kind enough to ask for our preferences and prepare and serve delicious meals. The gym had all the equipment for a proper workout and the gym attendants were so helpful. Specially Mr. Shiwantha who was kind enough to play cricket with our kids, made their day. The pool is also well maintained and the length and the depth of the pool is ideal.

We also had a birthday during our stay, and the restaurant staff were kindly prepared a complimentary birthday cake. I'll consider staying at this hotel again when I visit Sri Lanka due to the friendliness of the staff and the excellent service.
title: Ideal Place for a Relaxing Stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for sharing your honest feedback about your experience with us.

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our hospitality, the helpfulness of our staff—especially Gimhani—as well as the food, rooms, and overall service. We will be sure to pass on your kind wishes to Gimhani, who will be very encouraged by your words.

However, I sincerely apologize for the miscommunication you experienced during your telephone booking regarding birthday celebrations. This is certainly not the standard of service we strive to provide, and I understand how disappointing this must have been for you and your family. Please rest assured that we do offer special celebrations, and I regret that you were not informed in a timely manner to make those arrangements.

Your feedback is invaluable and will be used to improve our communication and booking process to ensure future guests do not face similar issues.

We truly appreciate your understanding and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you and your family back for a flawless and joyful stay in the near future.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo

roomTip: They do your birthday celebrations while your stay..
text:
I love their hospitality and helpfulness of staff (specifically I should mention ‘Gimhani’ a student girl who was willing to help her customers’) I wish her success.
But while I was booking over the telephone I was told when I asked them, that they don’t do birthday celebrations in their hotel.. and I was disappointed :(( 
afterwards I gave up my plans to celebrate my dad’s birthday on our stay. Only while checking out they said they normally do such celebrations and I was already late then.. 
other than that, I loved their food, their space, their rooms, their service and everything else was perfect.
title: Nice service in hotel :) but not over the phone :(

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
An ideally located property right in the heart of the Galle Fort precinct , surrounded by shops and restaurants galore . 

This hotel had such a lovely charm to it and the room was beautiful. I loved sitting on the chair outside our 3rd floor room . The towels even smelt really pleasant . 

Thoroughly enjoyed both a foot massage as well as a face massage . 

Breakfast and dinner was in the open restaurant looking out onto a tree filled courtyard .

Staff were friendly and helpful. 

 If you are having breakfast and require GF neither the Sri Lankan nor Western breakfast will be suitable but you could have the traditional one without Roti or hoppers or the Western without the bread . Somehow this got lost between checkin and breakfast . Just tell them when ordering .
title: Location location location

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: It's really beautiful with heritage ambience. Spacious rooms & wash room. Beautiful garden, dining and corridor. Street side property gives the feeling of old Galle era. Staffs all are very cordial. It was really a pleasure to stay there.
title: Beautiful Heritage Property

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Complimentary 10min foot massage👍🏻
text: Location, location, location.  In the heart of Galle Fort. Spend a couple of nights here if you love history, fabulous restaurants, and beautiful staff. Luxurious clean rooms with fantastic products, enormous firm bed. Great drying space in small back veranda with a little washing line near the aircon outlet room 224. This hotel has thought of little things. Loved our stay. Book it you won’t regret your decision. No pool but didn’t miss it.
title: Amazing, book it👍🏻

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: La struttura si trova all'interno dei bastioni del forte di Galle, con camere disposte su tre livelli in un edificio storico dal sapore coloniale, affacciate su un giardino interno, su cui dall'altro lato si trova la sala da pranzo porticata. Le stanze sono semplici e senza fronzoli, ma dotate di tutto il necessario per un soggiorno confortevole. Ottima qualità del cibo a cena e a colazione. La nostra prenotazione includeva anche dieci minuti gratuiti di massaggio ayurvedico ai piedi, ideale per rilassarsi. Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo, consigliato!
title: Ottima scelta nel cuore di Galle

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Enjoyed an overnight stay in this colonial style hotel within the Galle fort area - a perfect location from which to discover this historic site.

Room was comfortable, well furnished with an enormous bed and efficient air conditioning. Although the room did not have a balcony, a comfortable chair on the veranda provided a relaxing place to enjoy a view over the hotel’s attractive courtyard.

Complimentary 10 minute foot massage was professionally provided in the hotel’s spa.

Professional and friendly staff.

Recommended.
title: Excellent colonial style hotel within the Galle fort area.

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Fate colazione da un'altra parte
text: Struttura caratteristica in stile coloniale, situata al centro del forte di Galle, le camere non sono grandi ma ben curate. Il personale è molto cortese, sempre con la pecca di una scarsa conoscenza della lingua Inglese. Al vostro ingresso la struttura vi offre un breve e piacevole massaggio ai piedi. Il ristorante, anch'esso caratteristico, offre cena di livello discreto. Purtroppo il buffet della colazione è pessimo e scarso, soprattutto per un occidentale.
title: Struttura caratteristica

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The property is beautiful and full of charm and character. The staff are outstanding and nothing is too much trouble for them and they treated us as though we were family. A special mention for Soonimal who was very attentive and remembered all our choices and requests. The seafood is sourced from fresh local ingredients and the portions are very generous. We would highly recommend.
title: Outstanding staff

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely boutique hotel with beautiful classic styled spacious rooms, with the most enormous bed we have ever seen. 

The staff were fabulous and friendly. The restaurant team was delightful and catered for special requests for breakfast. I am very grateful. 

We had a massage at the spa which was also wonderful. 

The veranda was perfectly set up to sit back and read a book taking in the beautiful environment. 

The hotel is perfectly located within the Fort to safely walk about day and night. 

The lady on reception was so bright, happy and engaging such a wonderful first impression. 

I can’t wait to return.
title: Perfect Fort location with great service.

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights in the family room. Beautiful hotel and great location. The room was spacious and very comfortable double beds .. a vegetarian breakfast was prepared for us with abundant fruits and other food choices. Very nice complimentary foot massage too..our flight arrived at midnight and we arranged the pick up with the hotel with ease and it was very smooth.
Only point is the room has no windows, on both sides it opens onto a passageway .., if one expects a room with a view then they will be disappointed, but this did not bother us as the location and overall experience more than made up for it .. will definitely recommend and stay again if in galle in the future.
title: Excellent stay
