title: Nice Traditional Experience

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We only got to stay one night but loved our stay. Such a fab location to explore Galle Fort. The staff are so wonderful and friendly. Rooms have HUGE beds and very nice airy bathrooms with beautiful colonial feel. Complementary massage was divine. Wish we had stayed longer and had more treatments.
title: The perfect stay

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just relax and really enjoy yourself...
text: I was so happy staying at this hotel. It is beautiful; designed by Ashley de Vos who was a student of Geoffrey Bawa. Clean and pleasing to the eye from the white frangipani trees to the squirrels in their branches. The food is good and it is conveniently located but best of all are the people. The staff are so helpful and kind from the manger who drove me himself to the chemists when I found I had left my medicine behind to Padmini the massage lady who gives such wonderfully soothing massages. When it was time to leave all I could say was, "But I don't want to go. Are the citizenship requirements in your country very difficult?'
title: I was so happy at Heritage Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: What a lovely hotel. Beautiful, tranquil setting. Room was spacious - it had to be as it contained the biggest bed we've ever seen. Staff were extremely lovely - especially the guy at breakfast who made the start tk the day perfect. The gigantic amounts of food helped too. My wife reports her massage in the spa was great too. Hotel really well positioned to get to all corners of the fort.
title: Really lovely hotel

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent location  exceptional service and great tasting food. The rooms are very comfortable with aircon. Guest receive complimentary foot massage for 10 min. That's exceeded my expectations.  The messuse were great. Very friendly and caring.  Plenty of parking. Walking distance to many great restaurants.  Would definitely be back here..
title: Great location, service  and food..

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a nice hotel in the centre of the Galle Fort area and is very convenient for sightseeing as well at dining options. We found the hotel quiet and peaceful. The service is good and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. The large shared balcony is an added bonus. Breakfast is ok but not amazing.
title: Good location and comfortable

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
It was a wonder stay at Heritage hotel. The hotel is very calm and quit place.The hotel is located in the Galle Fort itself and it’s just 5 mins walking distance to the Galle city. 

The staff is very friendly, especially the Resident manager Suneth is very helpful. 
Excellent hospitality by Hirudima and the front office team

Thank you and all the best team !
title: Great Stay !

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The building is very beautiful and the hospitality is warm and welcoming.  Exceptional comfort in the room.  The furnishings and setting are very impressive and offer a memorable experience of Galle.  Our Sri Lankan breakfast was cooked by the chef at the hotel and was my best experience of Sri Lankan food with a great variety of dishes and fragrant spices e.g. egg hoppers with accompaniments and dahl to name a few of a great spread.
title: Outstanding comfortable stylish rooms in a garden setting with surpurb cuisine

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
To summarize, The Heritage Hotel offers more than just accommodation; it provides an experience steeped in history, and unparalleled hospitality.  The property's heritage charm is evident in every corner, from the intricately carved furnishings to the antique artifacts and furniture every where in the hotel and rooms. With a perfect location inside the Galle Fort, you can easily explore the fort at your convenience. The staff shows warmth and professionalism, attending to your every need with smile and personalized attention - whether it's arranging bespoke city tours or accommodating special dietary requirements.

Pro Tip: Try their Srilanka breakfast its really good.
title: Truly Heritage

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely, relaxing hotel in a good central location in the old town, perfect for exploring Galle. Very clean, comfortable and spacious room on the first floor overlooking the central garden area. Really friendly, attentive staff and excellent food, both at breakfast and evening. Lots to like!
title: Great location

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text: Nous regardons tous les avis des voyageurs avant de partir , je tiens à vous donner le mien , mon ressenti . J’y ai séjourné du 19 au 29 mai . Il y avait quelques remarques négatives, en ce qui me concerne, franchement rien à signaler ! L’hôtel est vraiment sympa , la nourriture bonne ( certains se plaignent, j’aimerai bien voir ce qu’ils mangent chez eux ) la chambre était bien, propre , la Clim fonctionnait, salle de bain impeccable,  bon ! Chambre un peu humide mais on est en front de mer . La plage , c’était la marée haute et agitée, par contre , sur la gauche , une petite plage bordée de cocotiers, sauvage, déserte et à 5 mn a pieds , allez-y. Maintenant quelques conseils , j’ai fait l’excursion de 3 jours , j’ai adoré mais méfiez vous ! Monsieur Buddhi de DTH Travel , je l’appelerai Buddhi l’arnaque, j’ai payé 450 € , mes copines Léa et claire 415 , un couple de hollandais 400 , c’est à la tête du client , donc ne payez pas plus que 400, ça parait un peu cher mais franchement top , le parc national d’udawalawe , vous y verrez principalement des éléphants, le fameux train bleu 3h ne pas le faire , c’est comme venir à Paris et ne pas voir la Tour Eiffel, les paysages sont juste griandioses ! Plantations de thé, kandy , rocher du lion , sortie complète.il y a une ville galle , inutile de payer une sortie , demandez à la réception les horaires de trains , vous prenez un tuk tuk devant l’hôtel 3€ et le billet de train est à 1€ vous visiterez galle pour pas cher . Idem pour colombo le train de la même gare 3€ conseil prenez la seconde classe pas la 3 eme ! On dirait les wagons de trains de films western , beaucoup de monde , la 2 eme est à 1€ !  Pour les petits budgets les tuk tuk devant l’hôtel ont des catalogues et peuvent vous proposer toutes les sorties que vous souhaiter 2 fois moins cher , des gens l’ont fait et pas d’arnaque , vous monterez sur un éléphant plus cascade pour 20 balles , si vous souhaitez acheter des souvenirs , privilégiez Bentota , c’est moins cher , pour le thé c’est Ella ce n’etait pas beaucoup plus cher et thé d’exception , j’ai goûté et 8€ les 200g . Je vous rassure , on a mangé des crudités, personne n’est tombé malade . J’insiste si vous pouvez , prenez le train Ella kandy , le personnel de l’hôtel très gentil , souriant , c’est pauvre mais je n’ai pas vu de mendicité, une petite parenthèse, ma nuit à kandy , j’ais 6 singes sur le balcon , c’etait marrant . C’est très vert et les paysages sont juste magnifiques. Pas de tourisme de masse . Profitez bien si vous partez . Nourredine
title: Très beau voyage

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Tuk tuks are so easy to use and cheap!
Local restaurant are good and very reasonable prices.
text: Incredible hotel! Very friendly staff, nothing is ever too much trouble for them. Even had a breakfast bag for us one morning when we left at 5am for a tour. Sara, Fowsan, Chanchala, Heshan, Paskndu.... all so attentive. The security guard, waiters/waitresses/pool staff.... literally everyone we came across was so hospitable. Would highly recommend staying here and we'll definitely be back!
title: Holiday May 2025

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
I always try to be as honest as I can with reviews. So here goes.
We arrived to a lovely warm welcome.  As you walk into reception,  your met with stunning views of the Indian ocean.  We were checked in and shown to our room. We had room 205, a standard room which was perfectly fine.  Stunning views of the pool and the ocean.  We saw reviews saying the beach was dirty and full of sandbags. We saw none of this. Staff cleaned the beach every morning and the hotel can't help the fact the sea was too rough to swim in. 
The bed was a little bit hard, but that's a personal thing. 
Food was lovely, and we didn't go hungry. There was always something to eat. And the warm puddings were amazing.  There was usually a roast at lunch and my only gripe was there wasn't any gravy. 
Staff are friendly, helpful and always smiling. 
The drinks are perfectly fine too. Measures are generous and the local gin was lovely. 
We booked our trips through a chap called Indica, on the beach. Brilliant value for money.
Loved the tuk tuks, which you can get outside the hotel and are very cheap. 
We absolutely loved our 2 weeks here and really didn't want to leave. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to return.
title: Amazing hotel, beautiful country

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing 10 days at this great hotel. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful from arrival and always greet you with a smile. 

The food was especially good with great variety of dishes. They also have a grill option. The deserts were presented beautifully and varied day by day. 

The room was stunning with an amazing view of the sea and was spotless each day. We had a deluxe room, which had a delightful surprise of a jacuzzi bath and stunning sea views from the balcony. 

The pool was lovely and they had three staff members just dedicated to helping by the pool which was really nice. The sun loungers faced the beach which was lovely. There was also always security outside the hotel along the beach and pool which made it feel really safe which was great. They were really nice and would always smile.

We did excursions with TUI and bentota travel which were great and the hotel prepared us lots of breakfast bags every time we went out early for day trips. 

Overall this was an amazing hotel and we would really recommend it!
title: Fabulous hotel

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text: Un séjour vraiment incroyable. chambre au top, piscine vue sur mer exceptionnelle, nourriture délicieuse ! Le coach de sport est génial et mention spéciale à Malitha, Kalum, Chasaka qui sont fantastiques. Si vous voulez vous détendre et lire au bord de la mer et découvrir la nourriture locale, n’hésitez pas !
title: Fantastique

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Utilise the Tuk-Tuk drivers outside the hotel to shop where the locals do.
text: I always write honest reviews and I would have given 5 stars if it wasn’t for a few things that really need addressing here.Let me start by saying that if you’re looking for a beach holiday (which luckily we weren’t)you’re going to be very disappointed as the beach is covered in unsightly sandbags due to the hotel coastline suffering severe coastal erosion.You are unable to walk along the beach and the seas are rough and after talking with a local it was confirmed that it is like this the majority of the time.The room we had was perfect and led straight out to the swimming pool as I had emailed the hotel beforehand and requested,which they kindly obliged.The food is the outstanding feature here with the Sri Lankan curries my favourite,everything was fresh and tasty with a great selection to cater for all.The day time activities were hit and miss and the lounge bar and billiard room were closed due to refurbishment but the Sky lounge was open.All staff were courteous and made you feel like a VIP but towards the end of the holiday I felt they were hanging around for tips which felt a touch uncomfortable as we do tip but you can’t do it for everyone.A few other things we noticed was that some of the sun loungers were broken and needed repair and a limited selection of drinks on the all inclusive list and no wine, but you could buy a bottle in the restaurant for £30 which is Dubai prices!.We didn’t bother buying any wine as the local Tuk-Tuk driver called ‘Sudath” who parks outside the hotel which we made friends with,took us to the local wine store amongst other places,Sudath also does realistically priced tours of the local area which were great fun and very authentic.All tours further afield I booked prior to leaving the UK with Bentota Travel Mart who were far cheaper than Mercury Holidays and due to having no beach the guys selling trips weren’t there,so it was a good decision in the end.We really enjoyed our 10 day stay here,we have found memories of the warm Sri Lankan hospitality and the beautiful country.I recommend staying here as a base as the hotel has 5* star dining and wonderful staff which outweighs the other niggles that I’m sure will be sorted.
title: Lovely stay but no beach due to severe coastal erosion!

text:
A Truly Memorable Stay at Araliya Resort & Spa Unawatuna – June 28th Stay

We checked in on 28th June and stayed one night at Araliya Resort & Spa Unawatuna, and it was an unforgettable experience from start to finish!

The panoramic views and infinity pool were absolutely stunning—unlike anything we've experienced before. The easy beach access, kids club, play area, and lively DJ and music kept the whole family entertained and excited throughout our stay.

The food selection was excellent, offering a wide variety that made every meal feel special. Room No. 922 will always hold a special place in our hearts.

A heartfelt thank you to Mr. Rasanga Nawarathna, Dimuthu, and the entire team for their warm hospitality, excellent guidance, and thoughtful care. You all made our short stay truly delightful.

We’re already hoping to plan our next visit very soon!
title: Araliya Beach Resort& Spa - Unawatuna ;Breathtaking Views, Exceptional Hospitality – A Perfect Stay!”

text:
Отель очень уютный.Персонал вежливый.Отличные завтраки.Было большой радостью среди персонала отел увидеть  русскоговорящую девушку,Ализу.(работает на ресепшен отеля),каждый день общались,подсказывала и помогала решать вопросы по отелю.Цены в кафе и ресторанах выше среднего уровня.На обед и ужин ходили в кафе Moments(ооочень вкусно,обычные блюда ,с необычной подачей).Отдыхом остались очень довольны.
Есть один минус.В субботу и воскресенье приезжают местные жители,их очень много и они отдыхают тоже на пляже,на песке.на территорию отеля они не могут пройти,но береговая линия доступна для всех.но мы в эти дни выезжали с отел и нам это никак не мешало.
title: Рекомендуем

placeInfo/address: Mahawaskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing experience at Mermaid Hotel..!! The staff was incredibly friendly, always greeting us with warm smiles and ensuring a pleasant stay.  

The location is perfect for relaxation, offering a serene atmosphere. It’s a great spot for groups, with plenty of activities and a family friendly environment, making it ideal for kids. The well maintained garden adds to the natural beauty of the place.  

The rooms were comfortable, with some featuring balconies facing the beach, while others overlook the pool area. We stayed for two nights, one on Full Board and one on Half Board, and found everything well organized. The bathrooms were clean, with hot water, and the linen was fresh and tidy.

The two pools were clean and well maintained, providing ample space to unwind and enjoy. While the beach was a bit rough, the hotel ensured it was kept clean, making for a pleasant coastal experience.  

Last but not least, the food..! The variety was excellent, with both Sri Lankan and international cuisine available. The chef and restaurant staff were incredibly helpful, making dining a memorable experience. We especially enjoyed Saturday’s BBQ night, which was a fantastic addition..!

Since there were fewer guests, our last two meals (dinner & breakfast) on Half Board were served à la carte. Despite this, the chef and restaurant staff made sure we were not disappointed, providing exceptional service. They even went out of their way to accommodate special requests for our two kids, ensuring they got exactly what they wanted, even if it wasn’t on the menu..!

Overall, a fantastic getaway with excellent service, beautiful surroundings, and a relaxing atmosphere. Would definitely recommend..!!
title: Mermaid Hotel – A Wonderful Stay..!!

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Select rooms in the top floor
text:
My husband and I had to visit family in Galle and rather than coming back on same day, both of us wanted to experience the present Galle Fort @ night. My husband's family were living inside Galle Fort for over 5 decades and their house is now a Villa owned by a foreigner. 
We were looking at all options to stay over for one night and our main criteria was to get with car parking . There was only one option The Heritage which had car park in the premises and matched our requirements. Our room was on the top floor facing the garden and we could see restaurant beyond. Though the rooms are on 1 and 2nd floors above ground there is an elevator to take us up and down. 
Staying inside Galle Fort gave us the opportunity of walking along the ramparts in the evening as done by us when the family lived on Parawa Street. This brought us many memories. It was a good choice of selecting The Heritage (previously known as 'Kotuwe Kade') which gave us good rest to sleep in. Room was very comfortable with all amenities and the bed was great. Washroom and the Toilet looked brand new with good flow of hot and cold water. 
One of the special item that caught my eye as I checked in was the antique telephone that is used as an intercom. 
One more I would like to comment is the room service. Next day we tried making morning tea and noticed that the kettle was not working and we informed. Within a matter of few minutes we heard a tap on the door and one of the staff is there with a spare kettle. We valued the splendid service. 
Overall the staff was very friendly - room service, the restaurant and whom we spoke with during our stay. 
Food was good and we selected the Sri Lankan menu. They had hoppers, Pan Cake, Milk Rice and String Hoppers with suitable curries to match with. There was a flow of fruits as deserts. 
Overall our stay was pleasant and enjoyable leaving behind lasting memories. 
Thank you - The Heritage
title: Pleasant and Enjoyable Stay in side the Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
A comfortable hotel with a relaxed and friendly feel. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the central area with its pretty Temple Trees. It was a nice size room with very comfortable beds and cosy bedding. A spacious bathroom with a powerful shower was very welcome for a hose down in the morning and after a day out and about. 

We really enjoyed the breakfast which was a choice of European or Sri Lankan, what a feast, fruit platter,  pastries, eggs, toast plus juice, tea and coffee. The only negative was the coffee, I am super fussy and it wasn’t to my liking.

Having stayed in many of the hotels in Galle Fort I would definitely choose The Heritage Hotel again. We didn’t eat in the restaurant but friends did and they were impressed with the selection of delicious vegetarian curries. 

The location is very central on Church Street where a nice choice of restaurants and other hotels are located. The Pasta Factory opposite the gates serves truly authentic Italian fare. For a Latte or Cappuccino fix it has to be Fort Bazzar on Church Street. 

Thank You to the lovely restaurant  breakfast staff who brought me breakfast to the room when I felt unwell one morning.
title: A five star stay in the Galle Fort!

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were booked at another hotel within Galle Fort which told us they had double booked and there was no room for us for one night - so The Heritage was our second choice. We liked the place so much we cancelled the first hotel we had booked and stayed at The Heritage for our entire holiday. 
Its a quiet, clean, spacious hotel with wonderfully warm and friendly staff. Our room was large with probably the largest bed we had ever slept on and the bathroom was also spacious. We loved the huge veranda with comfy lounge chairs, a perfect place for reading and chilling. On site free parking is a huge bonus for a hotel inside the Fort. 
The food is very good and the Sri Lankan coffee is excellent. The lovely garden with Araliya trees next to the dining area is very relaxing. The spa is small but the therapists are excellent and the prices are reasonable. We had to check out early and the staff were very accommodating, making sure we had an excellent early breakfast before departure. 
The location of the hotel is great, very central to many restaurants, shops, the ramparts and all the other attractions of the beautiful Galle Fort. We really enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel and we will definitely be back.
title: Spacious and comfortable Hotel with wonderful staff

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:

title: Zeitlich zurückversetzt ins 17. Jahrhundert

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for two nights and we highly recommend staying within the fort walls. The gorgeous cobble stone streets can then be well explored day and night.
This hotel is very sweet and the rooms are well appointed. The large verandah was a perfect spot to read a book or watch the rain. 

Breakfast was served rather than a buffet - this did not bother us and the food was plentiful and delicious. 

We did miss a pool to cool off in, later in the day but we went over to the beach at the lighthouse to cool off and it worked well.

The only negative we have is that the 2nd night we stayed there was a function in the open air restaurant right below our room. It went until past 3am and had speakers playing a religious chant every 3 seconds from early evening - we didnt sleep at all. 

We understand that it was a religious expectation but a warning or apology would have been nice. 

The fort itself is so beautiful- excellent restaurants and shops and character everywhere. Get here soon before the tourism takes over. It would be even better if the fort walls we maintained a bit better (ie there was a bit too much rubbish around the ancient sites (the streets were very clean though)
title: Great location and lots of character

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka

The hotel has a little spa with well trained professional therapist.

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: 🇬🇧 Galle Fort hotel: This iconic Galle Fort building has a history that dates several centuries back. According to their website, the hotel was “a former gem merchants mansion, RAF barracks, a post office, bakery, lapidary and even a pitch for the forts juvenile cricketers”. The building was restored in 2003 and features 14 suite rooms today. I highly recommend their breakfast. They have a Sri Lankan and a Western option — I always go for Sri Lankan, because I can make eggs myself any day of the week. It’s a great value for money, considering you are surrounded by such beauty. Plus their service is impeccable.
title: Great value for money

text:
I booked this as I wanted to extend my stay in Galle from 3 nights to 4 nights, and the hotel I’d booked for the other 3 nights were unable to accommodate us.
It has a central location on Church Street although the main entrance is in a side room off of church street.
The staff are very friendly.
The room was old world elegant and had everything in one could want, with a central location.
Breakfast was served on the corridor outside our room, which sounds bad, but was quite nice, as it was like a terrace.
We would have happily spent another 3 nights there, but had our other hotel to check into, so only stayed one night.
I would happily recommend, this as a mid priced hotel (For Galle that is, which is quite expensive).

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text: We traveled as a group of three to the Pandanus Beach Resort & Spa in Sri Lanka and had a wonderful time. The service was excellent, the staff was always friendly, and the atmosphere very relaxing. We especially enjoyed playing volleyball in the water – it was so much fun! The beach was beautiful, the food tasty, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. A great place to unwind and enjoy some quality time. Highly recommended!
title: funny week

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent Stay at Pandanas Beach Hotel!

Our overall experience at Pandanas Beach Hotel was truly excellent. We were lucky to get a beautiful room right opposite the pool, which gave us a fantastic view throughout our stay.

The food was delicious, and we especially appreciated the baby pool – it was very safe and perfect for our little one.

A special thank you to Sara, Chathu, Pasindu, Hashan, and Kumara – they were all incredibly helpful and friendly, making our stay even more enjoyable.

We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to relax and spend quality time with their loved ones!
title: Excellent Stay at Pandanas Beach Hotel

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text: We had a wonderful stay at this place. It was incredibly comfortable, and the staff were absolutely lovely. Special thanks to Kumara, Upul, Fowsan, Pasindu, Ajith, Danajayaya, Sara, Poojani, and Cathri from the restaurant, as well as Budika, the sportsman, and Manju. Every single staff member was so friendly and welcoming. I don’t remember all their names, but everyone made our stay so memorable. We will definitely plan our next trip to Sri Lanka when the sea is perfect for swimming. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing and enjoyable stay!
title: nice place

The food at the restaurant was delicious.

Recommended for a relaxing escape.
title: Lovely staying

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text: Chambre très spacieuse . Très belle vue sur la mer , très grande salle de bain . Personnel très serviable et souriant : sara pasindu chathu fowsan upul susanthi. Buffet très bon. Le tea Time est super avec de très bons produits. Sauf la plage trop petite.
title: Très bon séjour

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a really lovely stay at the Pandanus. We upgraded our room to have jacuzzi and private balcony which made it extra special. Staff were great, especially the guys who lifeguard/help with sun loungers. 
The beach is one of the nicest beaches I’ve ever been on.
title: A slice of heaven

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
Super expérience, l'hotel et le personnel est vraiment très agréable, accueillant et toujours souriant. Les repas sont exquis, il y a du choix au buffet, et tout est qualitatif. L'accès à la piscine 24/24 est aussi un véritable plus, avec la vue sur la mer c'est vraiment très agréable.
Les excursions proposées sont au top, avec des guides très agréables et toujours prêts à partager. Un véritable plus pour découvrir la culture Sri Lankaise.
L'hôtel est aussi bien placé, avec un accès direct à la plage et la possibilité de faire les boutiques à seulement 10 minutes en TukTuk disponibles devant l'hôtel a des prix moindres.
Le spa est vraiment bien, le personnel est accueillant et compétant.
Un super séjour, merci à toute l'équipe Sarah chathu fowsan pasindu ajitj heshan.
title: Superbe expérience au bord de l'Océan indien

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We visited in April when it was quieter. I think this is a good time of year to visit. Easy to travel locally by tuk tuk. 1000 rupees usually covers a trip to Bentota.
text: We stayed at Pandanus Beach for 10 days, our first visit to Sri Lanka. The hotel itself has been great, particularly the staff who are always smiling & very helpful. Notable mentions go to Fowsan, Sara, Poosani, Chathuri, Saith and Pasindu!
title: The staff are excellent. So happy and accommodating. A wonderful experience!

placeInfo/address: Colombo - Galle Main Rd Yalegama, Bentota 80510 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel was excellent.  The food was of a high standard, with plenty of choice.  All inclusive, suited us but it didn't stop us adventuring out and about.
Our room was on the lower left, with the swimming pool right outside. The view of that and the sea was fantastic.
The staff were very helpful and friendly,  special mentions for Kalum, Deano,  Kusin and Mahseen (not sure if spelled correctly)
There was water volleyball daily, which we tried to play, it was fun.
We would certainly return to this hotel.
title: First time in Sri Lanka and what a wonderful  hotel

text:
We stumbled across The Heritage whilst visiting Galle Fort for the cricket. Drawn in by the frangipanni grove that commands the courtyard, we were quickly taken with the hotel’s understated chic and simple thoughtful design. 

The hotel is in a great location and fantastically priced, giving you ample opportunity to explore Galle Fort at your leisure.

The staff are so welcoming and attentive (including the young man who had to deal with a couple of happily inebriated elders!). 

Opt for the Sri Lankan breakfast. You won’t be disappointed though your belt might have something to say about it!
title: Fantastic experience

roomTip: Amazingly have quite some room for parking; returning late entry on Layn baan Cross str is closed, use entrance on Church street
text: In the very centre of the old Dutch Fort, this great hotel offers good rooms and kind staff. Rooms are well equipped with large beds (two one person, matras bit hard, could use a topper), bathroom with shower. Balcony in front overlooking the yard. Looks very authentic but was told that only the restaurant/breakfast room is an original Factory, the hotel part is actually new, but very well in style with the surrounding. Pleasant staff, eager to help.
title: Nice oasis in historic Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel itself is a beautiful colonial style building with a courtyard and a lovely restaurant.

The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and clean, with AC and a ceiling fan to keep us cool (being from England that is important)!

What really sets this hotel apart from all the others is the people. They went above and beyond to help, would always smile and say hello when we saw them, and took a genuine interest in us. Nothing was too much trouble. Thilini on reception, Shanushka (who we gave the nickname "the nice guy" before we knew his name), and Sidath the manager were absolutely amazing. Nahlinda, our TukTuk guy also deserves a shout out even though he isn't technically part of the restaurant staff.

Location wise there are an absolute tonne of restaurants, cafes, shops, museums etc that you can walk to in 2 or 3 minutes. It is only a 10 minute journey to the beach by TukTuk, and there are temples, spice farms, and lots of wildlife to visit nearby! The Fort itself is also really interesting and great to walk around, grab a King Coconut, and watch the sunset.

We will definitely be returning on our next trip to Sri Lanka.
title: The people really make the difference - amazing stay!

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The thing I appreciate most about the people at Heritage Hotel Galle is that they are nice, considerate, and trustworthy people. A special shout out to the manager Sidath!
title: Excellent!

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
we found this hotel by walking past and looking in so we went to ask for the room prices. what a find this little gem is. superb location near the old dutch hospital, next to some nice restaurants but only a few minutes walk down the lane to Cargils Express (little grocery store) and the fort itself. 
the bed was ginormous and the room was very clean, although a bit dark but that is just the way they are built. the room comes with a fridge and A/C and you get two little bottles of water every day. 
the building itself is in the colonial style with one huge balcony area where you access the rooms. there are lovely loungers outside each room where you can relax. 

the staff were superb, absolutely lovely and wonderful. starting with the maintenance and cleaning crew who made sure we stayed toped up with water, coffee etc, they even left the things outside the door the one day we forgot to remove the do not disturb sign. 
Also our waiter, Sunimal and the chef Udesh were so friendly, polite and attenuative and the breakfast was not only delicious but it was everything you wanted, so much food we were set all day. 
and a big thank you also to Lakshani and Hirudima for making us so welcome overall in their hotel. 
thank you everyone, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel. next time we are in Galle we will definitely come back!
title: Lovely staff, amazing value for money

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: 212 - 221 was towards the parking lot and probably quieter
text:
We stayed 3 nights at the Heritage Hotel in 4 single rooms for Rs. 8000 on BB basis.
It was a very good rate for the excellent amenities and service. 

The hotel has ample parking within the premises, which is rare for a hotel inside the Fort. The Manager, Chef and the staff were very caring and polite, always checking on our well being throughout our stay.
 
The room was well equipped with crisp clean linen and even bathrobes and toilet slippers. The room had a mini bar and hair dryer as well. The washroom had bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body wash. So you only have to bring your toothbrush and tooth paste with you! The air conditioner worked very well. And the bed was very comfortable. 

The hotel is very central and walking distance from all the sites, shops and restaurants. And we felt very safe walking even after 9.30pm. 

We enjoyed sitting on the large balcony on the easy chairs (hansi putu) just looking over the lovely garden full of Frangipani Trees and rooftops. 

The food was good specially the western breakfast, Pol Roti breakfast and sweet corn soup at dinner! Yummy! 

Thank you to the Management and Staff for a lovely stay!
title: An oasis within the Fort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Wahab.....

Thank you so much for your wonderful and detailed feedback and taking time to share your experience with us. It was so nice to hear that you have had an unforgettable, relaxed and luxurious experience during your stay in our Hotel. Our team made your stay even more memorable and meet all your expectation. Also we are pleased to know that you enjoyed buffet and the services 
Thank you so much for choosing The Hertage Hotel Galle Fort to spend the day with us. The whole team of Heritage would be very much looking forward to having you back again in future. Until we meet again stay safe & healthy!

Thank You
placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here for a weekend. The hotel is nicely located in the Fort, and has a surprisingly spacious area with ample car parking within the property. We got a free upgrade to the suite which was a nice touch as well.  The suite is spacious with a small sitting room, large bedroom area with two double beds (ideal for a small family) and a decent sized bathroom with shower and bathtub. The beds are comfortable, there are plenty of pillows and the AC units work very well which is welcome in the relentless heat when the sun is out. There is a lift to access the first and second floors as well, so helpful for the elderly and differently abled.

The restaurant is also spacious and airy, open concept facing a courtyard of araliya trees. We had the dinner buffet (due to rain) which proved to be for the best as the spread was wonderful - the prawn curry in particular was exceptional! Breakfast was an equally fulfilling affair with a nice mix of Western and Sri Lankan delights. Salutations to the Chef for doing a fantastic job.

The staff are genuinely warm and friendly. Sidath (Resident Manager) and his team go the extra mile to make you feel welcome. They were always inquiring about our well-being and very accommodating to requests - we requested a newspaper in the morning and it was there before 7am! Managing Director Manjari was present at the hotel as well and is also a warm personality who makes guests feel at home. 

If you want a place to stay right in the Fort whilst you walk around and explore this historic and cultural place, this hotel is the one you should pick.
title: Cozy and comfortable place with great service

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Maintained grounds and  great veranda outside of room to sit and relax and enjoy the mornings and evenings.
text: Last minute reservations made and staff, very cordial and helpful with accommodations. Clean rooms and great breakfast. Our rooms were on 2nd level and easy elevator access to carry items to car. Centrally located in Galle and easy access to shops and plenty of eateries near hotel.
title: Warm hospitality

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Recently modernised in the colonial style, the Heritage Hotel makes a good base in Galle Fort.  Our room, where we spent four nights, was on the second floor, reachable by lift, with a communal balcony.  The room had high ceilings and was very cool, but lacked windows, having only carved wooden grilles placed high up and a shutter arrangement behind the mirror which was difficult to get at.  This made the room seem rather dark and claustrophobic.
We arrived just as Galle Fort was starting to shut down due to the Covid 19 restrictions, so there were very few people staying there and restaurants were closing.
The Sri Lankan breakfast was delicious, consisting of two kinds of hoppa, dosai and coconut rotti with dhal, fish and meat curries, and two types of sambal; we barely dented it.  Western-style breakfasts were good too.  Having stayed in lots of isolated places, going out for dinner was a joy.
The hotel manager was very helpful when we were trying (unsuccessfully) to get an earlier flight home.
title: Elegant hotel well located within Galle Fort

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Nice views from the upper rooms but to avoid steps request a room on the ground floor.
text: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel although this was curtailed by the Corona virus crisis.  The hotel stayed open to help guests from other nearby accommodation which could not offer meals to their residents.  The staff were unendingly helpful in allowing us full use of all the facilities and helped us to resolve our travel problems due to the shutdown of the area and subsequent curfew.
title: Quiet haven with excellent service

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
out of the 7 hotels that we stayed in this was voted by 4 out of 5 of our party as the best! Although there was no pool and the hotel is small, we enjoyed the more personal atmosphere, which we found really lacking in the bigger, plusher hotels. My personal complaint about it was the malarial bathroom, and the fact that this was the only hotel where I was bitten by mosquitoes- so badly that I awoke a few times, once in actual pain.

However, the location is great, and the fort area is an enjoyable experience, even though it is aimed at fleecing the tourist. The hotel has character, and we found the staff to be really friendly and helpful. The food was good, although we struggled to eat the large portions. The breakfast was far too much for us, but we managed to all cram in a few extra egg hoppers each! On the last day the waiter even made us a packed lunch from the leftovers. His name is Chiradh, and so we send him our thanks. The best waiter for the whole two weeks award, however, goes to a really friendly member of staff called mr Sunimal; he really looked after us, and helped make our stay really good! When we left, the manager and some of the staff even came out and waved us goodbye; no other hotel did that during our stay!
title: Stay

placeInfo/address: 27,Church Street ,, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I visited Galle as part of a group trip to Sri Lanka and we stayed at the Heritage hotel. It is stunning and with a Portuguese influence in terms of style and decor. Very classy and comfortable. The staff are attentive and very kind, they made us feel welcome. The food is also delicious, especially their local breakfast. A must!
title: Lovely stay in the beautiful Heritage Hotel Galle Fort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Ian Bennett,

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your touching message.

It is truly an honour to hear from a guest who has been part of the Mermaid Hotel & Club’s journey for so many years. Your words warmed our hearts and brought back cherished memories of a time when you were with us — not just as a guest, but as a valued member of our extended Mermaid family.

While some faces may have changed over time, the spirit of hospitality and care that you experienced remains at the heart of everything we do. We are deeply grateful for your loyalty and the kind wishes you’ve shared. Rest assured, your legacy and memories live on within the walls of our hotel and in the hearts of those who had the pleasure of serving you.

On behalf of the entire team — past and present — we send you our very best wishes, and we hope those beautiful memories continue to bring you peace and happiness.

With warmest regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
placeInfo/address: Mahawaskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent months there from 2003, 6 0r 7 visits all told. The management and staff were always accomodating and helpful which made my stays all the better. Now I am 93 years of age and I would think management and staff have changed. I made many friends amongst the staff and visitors there and if any of them are reading this I wish them all well. I cannot walk any more or travel but I have good memories.
If you are going there then have a happy time. I wish you all well.

Ian Bennett, Ramsey, Cambs UK.
title: Always Happy there.

text: The restaurant is top notch in terms of the amenities it provides, its beach front location, the overall cleanliness and quality of food and a very hospitable, competent staff. text:
We had such a lovely stay this month at Pandanus. The resort is lovely- great food, drinks, gorgeous pool area, and such helpful and friendly staff who made us feel so welcome.

My sister had a birthday while we were there and we were treated to a room upgrade to the Royal Suite for the last 4 nights of our stay. The suite was absolutely stunning with its own pool, jacuzzi, and made our trip even more special.

Danajaya and Chathuri on reception were so lovely as were all of the staff working in the restaurant area who were always so polite, friendly and happy to help. The young man who prepared the special birthday table was a real star. 

Thanks for a wonderful stay!

text:
A wonderful 5 star experience. Hotel and amenities excellent.  Staff always helpful and willing to go the extra mile to make our holiday very special.  All staff in reception Pubudu,Ajith,Chaturri,Sara,Dananjaya, Chanchala. Very helpful and friendly. 
Restaurant staff very attentive and helpful and made my birthday very special, the manager Suranga especially made every effort to make sure we were pleased with the food and even made sure my wife had special vegetarian food. Very helpful and friendly. Isuru also made sure things went smoothly. The waiters Dilip and Kalum dressed our table beautifully with happy birthday written in coloured rice and beautiful flowers and also our farewell table with an aeroplane of coloured rice and flowers. The Baker who made all the fresh bread and cakes was a brilliant chef. Thank you to all the chefs as their food was exceptional. 
Hotel position was beautiful.  Rooms have a lovely view and very comfortable Kept to a high standard if cleanliness. 
Pool attendants and lifeguards very friendly and attentive , with good service.
We would recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: A wonderful experience, beautiful hotel, wonderful staff  we were sad to leave.
